text: Décevant. Les images semblent plus jolies qu’en vrai. Chambre et nourriture sont médiocres pour un hôtel cinq étoiles. Le personnel est gentil et serviable. Je pense que pour cet argent vous trouverez meilleur à cet endroit. Mais on n’y ira pas une deuxième fois.
title: Un peu décevant

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
An das Aarunya hatten wir mit die größten Erwartungen auf unserer Reise, allerdings war dieses Hotel die größte Enttäuschung.

Wir verbrachten Ende Oktober 4 Nächte in der Sky-Tented Villa. Die Aussicht des Zimmers war unglaublich, das Zimmer entspricht allerdings keinesfalls einem 5-Sterne Hotel. 
Die Ausstattung ist eher durchschnittlich, wenn nicht sogar unterdurchschnittlich und die Klimaanlage hat zeitweise nicht gekühlt. 
Das Badezimmer, insbesondere das Klo waren abgenutzt. 

Eine der größten Enttäuschungen für uns waren allerdings der Service und das Essen. 
Uns wurde bei Ankunft ein persönlicher Butler zugeteilt, welcher allerdings ab dem zweiten Tag frei hatte und nicht mehr zur Verfügung stand. Der angeblich Ersatz reagierte auf unsere Bestellungen erst nach Stunden. 
Das Essen an sich war eher schlecht. Die warmen Speisen waren meist versalzen, in Hähnchen Gerichten musste man aufpassen das viel Knorpel und Knochen enthalten war. Das anschließend bestellte Dessert war Tiefkühl und nicht vollständig aufgetaut.
Auch beim Frühstück gab es Tiefkühlkost - so kam es vor, dass die Muffins die uns serviert wurden noch gefroren waren in der Mitte. Brot und Croissants wirkten oft alt und trocken. 

Uns wurde ein Spa Treatment geschenkt auf Grund des langen Aufenthaltes. Ein wirkliches Spa feeling kam hier in diesem Resort allerdings nicht auf. Das Spa war ein „Raum“ mitten im Freien, die Geräuschkulisse war störend. Von Sägen bis Musik von Nachbarn war alles dabei.

Das Personal sprach teilweise nur schlecht Englisch sodass die Kommunikation manchmal etwas schwierig war. Jedoch waren alle Mitarbeiter immer sehr bemüht uns jeden Wunsch zu erfüllen, nur ist dies leider nicht immer.

Wir würden dieses Hotel insgesamt nicht weiterempfehlen- zumindest nicht für diesen Preis. 
Zudem ist Lage nicht vorteilhaft wenn man Kandy sehen möchte.
title: Aussicht top, der Rest FLOP

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text: The location was perfect and the view is breathtaking and the staff were very nice and helpful,, food was nice but overpriced..the bad thing was that we had bed bugs in the spare bed they provided us and we wake up full of bites marks
title: Nice location but bed bugs made it a horrible experience afterwards

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text:
This is my honest review.
This is not really a luxury hotel and definitely not a spa resort. It is really a collection of bedroom chalets in a very beautiful location with stunning views, if the weather allows. 
There is very little “spa” experience!  as they only have one member of staff who does the treatments. My husband and I could not ,for example , get a massage at the same time.
The massage room is located right next to a village house with a barking , whining dog , chopping and loud music , so it was not very relaxing. 

The location is not ideal for visiting Kandy . The trip into town took over 45 mins each way, so I would  suggest taking in the sights of Kandy before staying at the hotel. 

The food is good but not not amazing given the prices. I was charged 20 US for a large gin and tonic , which was served with a plastic bottle of very unpleasant  tonic.

The bedroom was very pleasant and had everything you need but I did not find the bed very comfortable . The bed creaked and the linen was an issue for me. We used the jacuzzi only once as you have to call the staff to get it working .

The main dining area is in the same space as the main Reception , the “bar” , the billiard table and everything else. So, on dining one night , a large van arrived with new arrivals right by our table and the driver left the engine running and the noise and the fumes was really in pleasant and disturbed the enjoyment of our meal.

The staff are really lovely and try their hardest but the resort??  ( I’m not sure what to call it ) is bit of a sham.  Go for the views and the lovely staff but for me, nothing else.
title: A big disappointment and not good value .

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Somasiri,

We are indeed surprised with this review. With the exception of an issue with hot water, owing to us utilising solar energy for this purpose, we are disappointed with the outcome of your stay. This too was rectified after switching to regular electricity. The comfort and satisfaction of all our guests is important, so despite the negative review we appreciate your feedback. 

On the issue of price, since you have mentioned it 2 times, please note that the price you paid is certainly not higher. While you stayed on a heavily discounted rate, it certainly has no bearing to the high levels of service or product offering we strive to maintain. This is aptly made clear by the positive reviews by hundreds of guests who we have had the privilege to host in the past. 

Note for future guests :

We do not serve buffet style meals, this is conveyed both at pre-booking as well as on arrival.
Lunch is traditional Sri Lankan or an alternate depending on guest movement.
Dinner is a 4 course international menu.
Breakfast is a choice of Sri Lankan or Western, which is a fantastic spread. We do not offer dessert at breakfast. Fresh fruit is however served. 

We are in the mountains, we are a nature resort, and our focus is on lessening the impact on our environment. Our villas all offer varied and individual views overlooking the mountains. We don't intend on cutting down any trees in the immediate future. 

I will be in touch with you direct.

Sincerely,
placeInfo/address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road Alawatugoda, Kandy, Kandy 20140 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at Aarunya during a weekend and the stay did not live up to our expectations. We got a warm welcome from the hotel staff and a quick check in to our room. After having a quick shower we went for lunch and asked for the menu but we were told that only chicken biriyani is available for lunch. We were told previously that they offer à la carte menu to choose from but NOPE. Good luck if you're a vegetarian and trying to have lunch at Aarunya. But the biriyani was nice, then again when you're paying a higher price, you need to have options to choose from. We stayed some time during the eve in the Jacuzzi which was the only luxurious thing that I can highlight during our stay, but being it an outdoor jacuzzi the magnificent view of the mountains were blocked by some trees in the garden. For dinner and for breakfast (no desserts were available for the breakfast) we had the à la carte menu (some satisfaction at least). The food is fine, but nothing really to highlight. The most frustrating thing was hot water was not available in the morning. At 7.00 am I called house keeping and informed, a person came and said he turned on the solar and in 5 min the hot water will be available. Waited 10 min, NOPE. Called again and another person came and said he routed the power back from generator and in 5 min it'll be available. Waited more than 15 min and no hot water and the water supply totally ran out, so no water at all. Called again and another new person came and did a fix saying they have two water lines and there is no water in the line routed to our room. Then it took another 10 min or so to get water back. So from 7.00 am to 8.00 am I was trying to wash myself. Such a disappointment. The staff was nice and have a nice view of the mountains for the main pool. But unfortunately it was a  average stay for a higher price.
title: Average Stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Julie L,

Thank you for taking the time to review Taru Villas – Rampart Street. We truly value the opinions of all our guests.

Having gone through your review I would like to start off by thanking you for listing the positive aspects of your stay. 

However, we do apologize that your stay at ‘Taru Villas – Rampart Street’ fell short of expectation. We strive to maintain a high level of service at our property and apologize that we fell short in this regard during your stay. 

With regards to the issues you faced, please note that our building is over 200 years old and had no attached bathrooms renovations and refurbishment. Since the property is located in a heritage site (Galle Fort) we had to follow strict guidelines when carrying out the renovations and this was the only position, for the bathroom, which was permitted by the world heritage site council. As a result of this feedback however we will be looking into the possibility of attaching a screen-like feature for privacy, without impacting the view of the garden too much or the architecture. Thank you for this constructive criticism.

As far as the electricity problem, power surges are unfortunately common in the Galle Fort and there is a delay of approximately half a minute before our generator automatically switches on. We are fortunate to have room enough to house a generator, a rarity in many (small) Fort properties where space is limited, but we do understand this time lapse can be disturbing to our guests. We are sincerely sorry for this inconvenience and while we appreciate the feedback we cannot currently find a better solution for this issue.

It is unfortunate that you did not have the best experience at our property, however if you do come back to any of our properties I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you directly, so please ask for me.

I look forward to meeting you in the future and wish you the very best.

Best regards, 
Oshaan Weerasekera 
Business Development & Marketing Manager
placeInfo/address: 25 Rampart Street, Galle Fort, Galle, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Taru Villas Rampart Street - Galle Fort
roomTip: Do not chose room 2.
text:
The hotel is just as it is pictured- well finished and classically decorated.  The service and staff were friendly and accommodating.  The daily breakfast was a highlight.  The Galle Forte is small enough that it is well situated in the forte.  

We opted for the Garden View room which is more expensive than the pool room.  Unfortunately the room information on bookings website failed to note that this particular room has the bathroom detached from the room itself.  You had to exit the room onto your balcony to access your private bathroom.  During the day your balcony was exposed to the back of the grounds so you had to make sure you were adequately dressed to move from your hotel room to your bathroom.  You had to bring clothes in to change from showering or dash through the balcony in your (small) towel.  Also this meant there was no air conditioning in the bathroom and there were always mosquitoes in there so we found at night we were getting bitten a lot.  Lastly, as another guest mentioned there were at least 2 power outages in the middle of the night and so fumbling outside and back inside with no lights was problematic.  We noticed this was the only room that had this "feature".  The other 3 rooms had the bathroom connected.  We would not have paid extra for this room had we known this was the case.  This impacted our overall stay which is unfortunate. 

If we could give 3.5 stars we would.  It's a shame because had we stayed in any other room we would have given this hotel a 5 star rating. Other than that the room was very nice, spacious and clean, with comfortable bed.
title: Loved the Hotel, Not our Room

text:
my wife and I enjoyed our stay for two nights at Taru Villas. The service would definitely need improvement where for the price we are paying we would like to have better hospitality. The hard ware is really awesome. The lobby, the dining area, the lounge and the bedroom. But lacking in service to make us feel at home. Some of the boys were good and helpful. The weather for very bad and even when we came back all soaking wet I could see that the staff did not come to us to carry our things or offer us help. Breakfast is good. The dinner we had was also very good. we stayed in the room facing the sea. Room is nice and comfortable. The safe in the room is not safe at all as it can be carried out and moved. Aircond is not sufficient for such a large space. otherwise pretty comfortable.

nevertheless its an awesome property and we love the fine things that was used in the hotel decor. the lotus flowers in pots were amazing.
title: Outstanding Property - A really Beautiful Hotel

Nice place, very busy on check in due to a large party checking in at the same time, looked a bit disorganised but thst is my opinion

text:
The check-in process was standard, but I was surprised that no one escorted us to the room. I had to ask for directions, and they simply pointed us to the lift, which felt unusual. The room itself was a bit dated but had the usual amenities.

We had booked a king bed but were given a twin bed room instead, as the hotel was fully booked. However, a housekeeping staff member attempted to adjust the beds by pushing them together. Unfortunately, he seemed inexperienced, as he was unable to properly fix the bed sheets and mentioned he hadn’t done this before, which wasn’t ideal.

On a positive note, the dinner experience was fantastic. The food was amazing, and I want to specially thank Randil and the entire F&B team for their excellent service. Randil was very accommodating and initially offered a complimentary meal for one adult, later realizing I was an in-house guest. His professionalism and warm service made the experience memorable.

Looking forward to returning soon. Thanks again, Randil!
title: Food & Beverages Team

text: Ramada Colombo markets itself as a five star hotel when in fact it’s more like a good three star and four star hotel.  The room was a good size room, tea and coffee, tv which said it had free films and not one started to play, air conditioning was loud and noisy which I had to turn off at times.  Room cleaning was not great considering It’s status, the housekeeper used to leave their cart in the corridor every night and by the morning people had clearly gone through it taking what they wanted. Had to call down on my second day as by 4pm my room was still not cleaned. Restaurant apart from breakfast was an also service, the bar was dead and many a time I was the only one in there buying a drink and taking it to my room.  Ordered room service twice and food was good. Bought coffee at the shop downstairs and always reluctant to give me my change without me asking. I also found this in the Galle Mall downstairs the road. Plenty of large hotels on Galle Face road which I would use next time.
title: Ramada Colombo four star with a four star service not five star

placeInfo/address: 30 Sir Mohamed Macan Markar Mawatha, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We were there for the Easter Lunch. 
Amazing spread. The food was super good! Did not expect that much of a spread for that price. I was definitely value for money. 
I my view, the food layout could have been better with a proper flow for the buffet. It was scattered everywhere and the dishes that were kept together didn’t match at times (I guess some miscommunication). Having said that, it did not have any impact on the taste of the food. 
I loved the Salads, Roasted/Grilled section and the Biriyani with Mutton Curry! 
We had two waiters serving us. One of them, a fresher from the Banquets who had come to help the restaurant, Jonath Thamiliniyan, who was very efficient, paid so much attention to our needs, did everything with caution, and so nice with a smile. I would say that is one of the best staff I have met in a hotel in Colombo. He should definitely be rewarded for his amazing attitude and dedication.

Unfortunately there was an incident that showed the flip side of Service by another staff member. 
Given that the package included evening tea with a piece of cake, we wanted to see how that looks like. The captain came to us and took our order and told one staff to serve us. Time went by, nothing happened, people who ordered after us, got their tea, and when we were just about to leave, this guy brought 4 cups of tea instead of 5 we ordered. All the tea cups/saucers had tea dust spilled all over. Some cups had half and less than a half. Only one cup had more than a half full. 
It was actually not tea, more like hot water with milk and tea sprinkled. For a permanent staff of the hotel, not sure how he applied the standards of an international hotel when serving tea like that. Utterly ridiculous and disappointing. 
If not for this incident I would have rated 5 stars.
title: A mixture of both Amazing and Crappy Service Attitude!

roomTip: Ask for an itemised restaurant bill before paying as the staff are quite unprofessional.
text:
We stayed here recently in one of the heritage rooms which was quite nice but extremely noisy as there were wedding photos being taken outside our room from 6.45 am until 8am as it was raining. Very unsatisfactory. 

The night of our arrival we ate dinner in the restaurant and enjoyed a few beers as it was my husband’s birthday. The next morning we checked out and settled the bill which was more than we were expecting. We were not provided with an itemised restaurant bill. Later, when we checked into another hotel we rechecked the bill and realised we had been charged for at least 4 more beers than we consumed. This is very disappointing for a hotel of this calibre. All restaurant bills should be itemised and produced at check out so they can be scrutinised by the customer. Very unprofessional practice and I would certainly not recommend this hotel given our experience.
title: Overcharged

placeInfo/address: 257 KKS Road, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Jaffna 40000 Sri Lanka
text:
Fox Jaffna stands out as one of the top choices for staying in Jaffna. Placed in an excellent location, this hotel is full of local history, making it a one-of-a-kind place to stay. Although many view it as a luxurious hotel, our experience suggests it's more of a standard accommodation. Our room was quite basic and could use some updates, especially in the bathroom. Unfortunately, the balcony door lock was broken upon our arrival, but it got fixed promptly. The overall hotel area and the pool were well-kept, creating a pleasant atmosphere. The service, while friendly, didn't stand out as exceptional. 

During our dining experience, the waiter pushed the dinner buffet, but we declined due to its questionable value and selection. Unfortunately, many menu items were unavailable. However, we chose a curry, which turned out to be quite good. On a positive note, the breakfast had a wide selection and was delicious. We suggest exploring dinner options outside the hotel. Adchaya Pathra restaurant, with its reasonable prices, polite service, and tasty food, left us satisfied. 

What makes Fox Jaffna special is its rich history. The hotel tells a centuries-long tale of a home that has endured tough times, now transformed into a tranquil resort. While Northern Sri Lanka is definitely worth exploring, currently, the value for money at Fox Jaffna isn't quite there. Therefore, we recommend considering another hotel instead.

If you’re looking for more travel tips, follow us on Instagram @fallinlovewithearth. Thanks! We hope you have an unforgettable time in Sri Lanka
title: Historic Charm Meets Standard Comfort

Finally tried out the dinner buffet at Amari and here’s what I think of it-
The interior of the restaurant was quite nice. 
The buffet spread wasn’t as big as some of the other dinner buffets I’ve been to and some of the dishes were quite underwhelming , although they had a variety of items like cold cuts, fresh seafood, cheeses , soups, salads, a few types of sushi , a Thai noodle station, a Mongolian action station, Mediterranean corner, Sri Lankan corner, Indian corner, and a dessert corner. 

The service was good, but I found out afterward from a friend that they actually have a Michelin-star Thai chef who does tableside dishes. That would’ve been amazing to try, but the hotel never mentioned it, so we had no idea it was even an option. For a hotel of this standard, you'd expect them to highlight something so unique — quite disappointing that they didn’t.
title: Dinner buffet at Ahara

Warm regards, 

Sibi Mathew
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
My recent stay at Taj bentota resort was a significant letdown, particularly given the esteemed reputation of the brand Taj in our country. While the location boasts a pleasant view, that's where the positives end. The rooms are in dire need of renovation, we were met with outdated furniture, broken tiles, rusted bathroom fixtures, and stained curtains and bathtub – certainly not what one expects, regardless of price point.
Although the food quality was commendable, the dining experience was marred by inattentive restaurant staff. On one occasion at The Shack, we waited an unacceptable 20 minutes before a waiter approached our table. Furthermore, during breakfast service, we were inexplicably denied table service.
Ultimately, despite the appealing view, this resort offers nothing else that justifies its cost. It simply does not represent value for money and falls far short of the standards one would anticipate from such a respected name.
title: A respected brand falls short: Not a Taj we heard...

We had booked this hotel as our final stop on our trip, based on the reliable reputation of Taj hotels. However, we found it to be quite shabby in both the bedroom and bathroom. Of all of the 7 hotels we stayed in this had the smallest room. Maintenance had to fix the noise from the plumbing whenever the toilet was flushed, but very quickly the problem was back again! We had asked for a twin room which in theory it was, but the beds were pushed together meaning one headboard and beside table were not aligned with the bed and one set of pillows were in front of the light switch panel.
We did point it out to a member of staff but nothing was done to rectify it! After our experience at Jetwing hotels in particular,  we were surprised by the lack of care at this hotel. Incidentally, this hotel was twice the price of it’s nearest rival.
title: Disappointing Hotel

text: Изначально заселили в номер категории ниже, чем я оплачивала (и это не смотря на то, что при заселении я обратила внимание на оплаченную категорию). Изначально заселили в номер Стандарт. Он был ужасный- сантехника разваливалась, плесень и грязь в ванной, пыль и ржавчина на светильниках. Мне пришлось обращаться к своему оператору. Около бассейна не хватало лежаков для всех желающих. Люди сидели на стульях с полотенцами и ждали своей очереди. Это недопустимо для отелей с 5 звездами. Мне так же пришлось обратиться к оператору, что бы решить этот вопрос. Потом откуда то принесли доп лежаки. Завтраки бедные. Ходила только один раз. Очень дорогой спа. Отель не предоставляет лежаки на пляже, их можно взять за небольшие деньги у местных. Понравилось обслуживание в номерах, быстрое реагирование на просьбы. Территория приличная, зеленая.
title: Неоправданные ожидания.

text:
Was really looking forward to this hotel,last bit of R and R before we flew home,3 days here should be good,5 star and that. Getting into the gated grounds,our taxi was inspected by a I.E.D. mirror under and around the car,then our cases were security screened before entering the lobby,thats a first!. The staff are amazing at this hotel,chatty,smiling and very very helpful. Room was ok on the top floor,bit dated really,but spacious all the same,good sea view.
Pool area is nice and spacious,with plenty of beds and umbrellas. You also get visited by little squirells and occasional lizard wanders by. Annoyingly two beach microlights keep buzzing nearby all day,which can become tiresome. Tried all three restaurants,Chinese was very quiet,big portions and very tasty,Shack is a fish place,pick your fish by weight,they prepare and cook it,very tasty,and good size portions. The buffett place is big,outdoors or indoors,staff again are superb,food is really,really good,but by the windows,there are a few dead insects and the windows are grubby,in fact most of the hotel windows are the same. Shame really.
So for me,4 star tops.
title: Not really 5 star.

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
The Taj is a 5 star hotel set in lush well maintained gardens , on a amazing stetch of beach . The staff are all very attentive , to add to the 5 star atmosphere. Nothing is too much trouble , and any issue we had was quickly resolved . 
We stayed for two weeks on a bed and breakfast basis , the breakfast consists of a really good spread of western food , local food and Indian food there's something to suit all the guests. 
The  chefs will freshly cook up fresh , omelettes, Hoppa's, Aloo paratha, Dosa's to name a few. And then bring them to your table .
There's only one pool at the hotel , and it never seems to be overly busy , a lot of people seem to opt for the beach instead. 
There's plenty of sunbeds to go around , either next to the pool , on a quiet area just away from the pool , or in the gardens with beach access. The pool guys are always there arranging cushions , putting up sun shades and providing towels.
If I was reviewing on just the above I would give the hotel 5 out of 5 . Alas the rooms let this Hotel down badly, which is why I only give the hotel 3 out of 5. 
The first room we stayed in for a few nights on the 4th floor was supposed to be a newly refurbished room ,it smelled very damp , all our clothes smelled of damp . The decorating left a lot to be desired, and some guests above scraped chairs throughout the night along the floor disturbing our sleep. 
I mentioned to reception about the chair noise in particular , and requested a top floor room so we didn't have that issue . We met the duty manager and he took us to a room the the top floor as requested. I mentioned the chair noise all night off and on and he said he doubted that to be true !!, I felt annoyed by his words .
We stayed in the fop floor room the rest of the holiday , it was a old style room in need of a complete refurbishment , but no damp smell and nobody above us. The only issue was with 3ft crack in the ceiling after a heavy downpour of rain , the engineering department fixed this by adding a large wooden baton across the whole ceiling as  a support . It looked awful but i guess it supported the ceiling .
title: Mixed Reviews

text:
Everyone has different standards. Somebody might feel that there were no issues to complain about, but that does not mean everything was perfect. There’s a big difference between good and perfection. Sometimes good is all we are looking for, and sometimes perfect is what we seek.
Let me begin by saying that what makes this hotel so special are the people that work here, so caring,kind, and considerate.
Yes, we had quite a few downfalls, but every issue we had was addressed and put right. This is down to a receptive GM who listened to us and made the changes. I have always found that if you have an issue, raise it and give the hotel a chance to put things right.
Even though I can not rate this hotel with 5 stars, the luxury is missing, and the hotel is worn and tired looking.
Little things such as cushion covers in the main buffet restaurant and pool sunbed covers which have lost their bounce and newness.
I am aware that this is an old hotel, as with older properties, ageing is one of the problems. It needs a face-lift, but this is being done as we speak. Rooms are being refurbished, and the painting and decorating team are hard at it.I have no doubt that in a few years, they will reach their 5 stars. But I feel for the money charged, it is worth what you are paying for. 
I praise the team for all their hard work, their humbleness  and devotion, and I would like to thank you for making our stay so memorable. ❤️
title: When only 5 stars will do !!

Sibi Mathew
General Manager
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I are staying here for 11 nights. We used TUI as our booking agents. TUI put this hotel down as a 5 star hotel. At best, it's a 4 star. Why!
There are several reasons. Before I start, let me say that once the staff get used to you and you, them they are aways helpful and friendly.
When we first visited Sri Lanka back in 2021, we stayed at the Anantara in Kalutara, now that is a 5 star hotel.
These are our observations of the Taj Bentota:
1. The Spa is drab and dark. You walk from the lobby across to a decking that leads you through trees where you come upon a large fish tank that has seen better days. I'm amazed that the fish in it are still alive. It needs attention. The Spa is just to the left of the fish tank. The services offered are, as far as my wife and I were concerned we're average at best. You feel like they have missed a trick here as there are no creams, oils, or ointment  available to buy. The reception area needs brightening up.
2. We are both in our 60's and did not expect to have to climb into a bath to use a shower. The room was not good, so the following day, we went to reception, explained our concerns, and we were then allocated a different room with a walk in shower which was not available the day before.
This is to the staffs credit that they did this for us for which we are grateful.
3. Food, where to start? For us, the best place to eat was The Shack. It's a fresh fish restaurant and is the best place to eat as you can pick from.the days fresh catch what you want. We both totally recommend this restaurant. 
The Palms is the main restaurant, which everyone uses. It's like a canteen, and you feel like you're being herded in and herded out like  being on a conveyor belt. You also use this place for breakfast. Now I like Eggs Benedict. What I received was not. One of the 2 eggs was not runny, and I have no idea what the sauce was, but it certainly wasn't Hollandaise!
On the 13th, we decided to go to the other restaurant called The Oriental. We arrived at 19:10 to find nobody there, we waited for 10 minutes and then went to reception to ask if the restaurant is open? They made a few phone calls and then we were escorted back down to the restaurant. We sat down and eventually we had another really nice meal, but, only 1 person was there serving due to a function taking place adjacent to the restaurant, Why!
4. While the pool area is clean, well maintained and very good you cannot help but think if this place had full occupancy then there would not be enough room for everyone, yes the beach is about  50 yards away but not everyone likes the beach. For me, they need another pool, they have the room.
I think TUI need to look at their grading system as this is not a 5 star hotel. Room for improvement by all concerned.
title: Room For Improvement

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We appreciate the time you took to provide feedback on your recent stay at our property. Your positive comments are deeply valued and serve as a significant source of motivation for our team. It is gratifying to learn that your experience with us was both pleasant and comfortable. We eagerly anticipate the opportunity to welcome you back during your future visits to Galle. Please do not hesitate to contact us if there are any additional measures we can take to enhance your next stay.
Thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Warm regards,
Le Grand Team.
placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't waste your $ on a Plunge Pool Suite
text:
We stayed two nights in a plunge pool suite, which we would not recommend. The suite is extremely large but it was a little dated and had a number of issues that affected our enjoyment and comfort during the stay. 

The bathroom is massive however one side is open (it has a large outdoor shower) which meant it was incredibly hot, and as there were a number of heavy thunder storms it was constantly wet, with water running across the tiles and into other parts of the bathroom. It does not have a jacuzzi as advertised on their website. You are unable to keep the heavy bathroom door open, which was annoying when walking in and out of the bathroom.  

The plunge pool was a little dirty and quite cool compared to the amazing main pool of the hotel. Our plunge pool had an air conditioning compressor positioned above it which blew hot air across the pool. The outside area was partially covered but leaked in numerous places, which meant all the outdoor furniture was constantly wet and we were unable to use the outdoor sitting area at all during our stay. 

The plunge pool suites are positioned on the opposite side of the building, which meant no views towards the Fort, and to the see the ocean, you had to walk 15 metres to the end of the grass courtyard. 

Don’t waste your money on a plunge pool suite - go for a Premium Room with great views across the lovely pool, Galle Fort and out to sea. 

We found service at the hotel consistently good, including at breakfast. We thought the range of food was ok, but the quality was not as high as some other hotels we stayed in during our Sri Lanka trip. 

The hotel of the location is excellent. It is less than a five minute walk to the Fort which is great for sight seeing and we experienced some amazing bars and restaurants whilst visiting in the evening. 

The main pool is fantastic, it’s got amazing views and is of a high quality. It gets busy, which is to be expected due to the size of the hotel. 

I would thoroughly recommend the hotel, but don’t waste your $ on a plunge pool suite.
title: Great location and fantastic pool

We take all feedback seriously and have already taken steps to address the specific issues you raised with the relevant departments. Please rest assured that we are committed to improving our services and ensuring that similar issues do not occur for our future guests. Your feedback is invaluable to us as we continuously strive to enhance our guests' experiences.

Thank you,
Warm regards,
Le Grand Team
placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Should improve the customer service skills of our employees
text: The experience at hotel started really bad at the lobby ,the person who checked us in was unprofessional and rude .we requested driver accommodation way before we checked in ,the hotel said no problem.when our driver went in and asked for it unfortunately there was no space .i went in and spoke with the gentleman and he insisted that there’s no room for the drivers .so just imagine the panic which I have to go through to find accommodation for my driver where I came into relax and enjoy our time.then when I showed the proof that I had a conversation way earlier with the hotel through booking.com confirming that there’s accommodation some how all of a sudden there was space for our driver ..I was so confused ten minutes ago the gentleman said there’s no accommodation and fee minutes later there’s space for him .this incident was a really bad start for our two nites stay at the hotel ,when we’re paying top dollar we except way better customer service than this  .furthermore throughout our stay that gentleman ignored us ,probably we did something wrong to him ..it’s so shame to see employees act like this,clearly this guy is not unprofessional at all .moving on the room and the view itself was the highlight of our stay .we were disappointed that there was no buffet at the night ,only was available in the morning .the first night a la carte was awesome but the second night think the wheels felt off .the starter with tuna was really cold in the middle,it was just taken out of the fridge,we couldn’t eat it .overall I think you guys should focus more on the dinner menu .
title: Worst customer service experience at the reception

roomTip:
The view is awesome but still there is old furniture, bad smell in the bathroom. 
Staff are helpful but still need to be more professional.
text:
Overall my experience was somehow good, there are a lot of things need to be changed. 
Location is good, hotel is nice but old furniture.
We understand the it costly to change everything; but the hotel needs to start changing things slowly…..
title: I don’t think will recommend this hotel to anyone, even though it’s in a perfect location and nearby the Galle fort.
