placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at Le Grand Galle Hotel was generally positive. The room was clean, and the staff was very accommodating. However, we found the restaurant to be quite expensive compared to Sri Lankan standards, and the food quality didn't match the price. The hotel's location is excellent, just a five-minute walk from Galle Fort. Unfortunately, due to the rainy season, we couldn't fully enjoy the pool and outdoor areas. The breakfast was good, and the service was attentive, though sometimes overly so. Overall, a decent experience with room for improvement in the dining area and prices.
title: It was a nice stay but...

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 3 days before going to Tangalle to stay in The Anantara. We chose this hotel because of the proximity to Fort Galle and the views of the Fort were indeed fantastic. 
However before deciding to book this hotel you need to be aware of some things. You will not be able to walk to Fort Galle as the access via a gate is permanently locked. A tuk tuk will take you from the quite dirty entrance via a very busy road for about 500 rp each way. The staff at breakfast whilst very respectful are not very well trained and you may have to wait for coffee. Orange squash at a hotel of this calibre and in a country full of fruit!! There was one waiter who was very attentive but unfortunately I didn’t get his name sorry. Only 3 tables at the pool bar if you want to have lunch. 
Pretty but very small beach but no sun beds and the sea is full of rubbish. This is not the fault of the hotel and they employ someone to try to clean the area. Most people stay to visit the Fort so hopefully won’t spoil your visit. 
This is the worst part. DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 007. This is a delux room or as the reception kept pointing out to me a ‘basic’ room. I could go through lots of problems we encountered but this is the important bit. There is a metal door in the wall of the patio area. This is unlocked and contains outside work items used by workmen who used the patio as a short cut up to the pool area. I was told the workmen had been instructed not to use this door so why was it unlocked leaving us feeling our privacy and safety was severely compromised. Having previously complained about the room I had been told that all other ‘basic’ rooms were full.
We were so disappointed in a hotel that could be amazing.
title: Disappointed

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Insist with staff about any issues and about cleaning. They will ignore the first few times you ask.
text:
La Grande is a wonderful location and property, mostly. Not a "grande dame" hotel like the Galle Face in Colombo - it is more modern. It has a beautiful view of the ocean and Galle Fort from many rooms. 

It does have some real issues though that limit its value. 

My wife and I booked a jacuzzi room facing the ocean. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bed a bit overfirm but not bad at all.  However there was real damage to the ceiling in the bathroom and the staff seemed intent on making it worse, digging the door into the damage rather than just open it the other direction.  
The cleaning of the room was haphazard at best - dishes from room service on our first day sat in the room for two days and the furniture on the balcony was filthy - covered in dirt. There were also weird stains on the duvet. Blood? Food? No idea and they never changed it out.

Worst when we finally got to use the jacuzzi on the last night we had to jump out after five minutes. The drain and vents and deck around the jacuzzi were full of red ants. We were both bitten several times in just a few minutes. And when we informed the staff they seemed completely unconcerned. No apology, no "we'll fix that".  Literally just stared at us like "so?".  

Restaurant service was also not great, but that would be a whole tale of its own...
title: Wonderful location, but bad service and issues really limit value

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Excellent location for a view of Galle Fort.
Beautiful large infinity swimming pool.
Avoid for food.
General Service a let down
text:
Modern hotel with views to die for from a large infinity pool overlooking Galle Dutch Fort.

Unfortunately as previously mentioned in other reviews this location is let down by poor service and average food.

Our lunch was particularly bad. We ordered a chicken burger and pizza by the pool bar. This took over 45 minutes to arrive and when it did the chips were stone cold and the pizza cheese had hardened, presumably from being left standing in the kitchen awaiting service.

The pool bar staff were clueless on how to address this and sent the food back to the kitchen which then reappeared 10 minutes later after being “re warmed”. When we said this wasn’t an ideal solution the chef was dispatched to argue with us. Reluctantly he re cooked the meal, which was average quality at best. Shame, and not really expected from a 5 star hotel or what we had experienced in our two weeks in Sri Lanka elsewhere.

The mango cocktail was however excellent!
title: Excellent location and infinity pool but poor food and general service

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Although this hotel on first arrival seemed fantastic it did have a few failings in our eyes.
There was only one bar area and snack bar and it was located by the pool. There were only 3 tables. Service there was extremely slow, although the food was good.
The buffet restaurant was small for the size of the hotel and the food on offer was limited ( many spicy or hot options but little else).
I must however commend the staff who were very friendly and welcoming.
title: Not so grand.

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Eat in town.
text:
As with our visit to Sri Lanka, our stay at Le Grand Galle was somewhat disappointing.

On the whole the staff were friendly and helpful but many had little experience and they were not well managed. As such the service at times was not good. 

The NYE dinner/event was not particularly well organised and given the cost, would have expected to be entertained between dinner's completion and 12 midnight. We sat in reception, trying to order drinks!

Hotel location good, but hotel should supply favoured tuk tuk drivers that are not intent on ripping off the hotel's customers?!

Food disappointing.
title: Sri Lanka, not ready for mass, international tourism.ouris

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We had a pleasant stay and Avanta was very helpful in making our time here comfortable. Although the resort was not completely booked out, we had to rush to checkout although we requested just a little extra time. That could have been handled in a better way since we reached late in the evening for checkin. Otherwise friendly staff and a clean place.
title: Good stay

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
For the price and location, I had expected a little better. Service was a little sluggish (took a while to check-in, had to repeatedly ask for morning breakfast coffee to be served at my table with little diners). They also are burdened with very outdated guest policies (I was told by another visitor that it was an old COVID rule to refuse visitors and they are the only few hotels that still reinforce them). 

Didn't help that the location, while strategic, is marred by a very ill-maintained road leading up to the lobby. Maybe they expected patrons to take TukTuks or cars up to the entrance but for its proximity to the Galle Fort, they should be prepared for visitors to want to walk there. There's an apparent path through the government park that offers a  short-cut to the Fort but access is closed or restricted. 

Rooms are clean and comfortable for sure and more than serviceable. Ocean view rooms offers a nice slice of the sea, but a little overpriced all things considered.
title: Slightly overpriced for what it offers.

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel itself is very comfortable and the room was clean and of high standard. However we didn’t have a good experience with our check in and felt the manager was not helpful. Also the food was not as high a standard as we expected. The staff are polite but distant . I would prefer a more personal service.The pool is lovely.
title: Good hotel but impersonal service

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Great design with an amazing view from rooms,  automated toilet seat. The only drawback for the hotel is their location not being on the main road and their poor marketing to the establishment, by letting trainee run the place (front desk)

Our special thanks to Mr. Lakmal at restaurant.
title: Great luxury boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The room has a fantastic design and the restaurant and service are professional but the micro environment around the hotel was rather disappointing for me. there is no direct access to the park which is very close to the hotel ( closed gate)  and the only way to sightseeing in galle fort is to pass by dirty street and a very busy bus station. 
The shop and spa were closed
title: Nice building and good restaurant

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I am writing this note to mention my experience at the Le Grand Hotel in Galle, Sri Lanka.
I was at this hotel from 23rd December - 25th December, 2022.

My self & My wife arrived at this hotel on December 23rd afternoon. We were greeted well by the 2 young ladies at the reception. We were promptly given the keys to our room. 

I am specially writing this review to mention the excellent Customer service we received from Mr. Chamila & Mr. Alwis at the food and beverage section and Mr. Dinesh Kumar in House Keeping. Their service was exceptional and motivates me to go to the Le Grand again.  

However, we were little disappointed with the choice of the food. 
The Christmas Eve and Christmas day breakfast was good. Other days food selection was very limited. The management needs to improve on that. 

 In general it was a good stay. Very good rooms. 
But for sure the upper management needs to improve the food choices and give more variety. 

All the very best. 
Chandima Gunasekara
title: My Visit to Le Grand Hotel Galle, Excellent Customer Service

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I was very much looking forward to my weekend stay, as I had read great reviews of this hotel. I was welcomed very courteously and check in was straight forward. The welcome drink was nice, though all three options had lots of sugar in them (and small).
The room was very comfortable, spacious, modern, and had a super bathroom and shower. Comfortable bed and pillows. And a day bed on the veranda. I had a side view of the sea (311).
First night in the restaurant, the creamy chicken pasta dish was very mediocre, not much flavour at all to be honest, this was quite disappointing from a top star hotel. The second night there was a buffet and barbeque and this was very tasty.
I am a fresh coffee fan and when I read that the rooms had espresso machines I was delighted. Very rare in SL. (Many hotels list coffee machine in their amenities, but it means a kettle!) However, this was not to be. No coffee machine in the room, a call to reception quickly remedied this. The machine didn't work properly and was leaking water everywhere except in the cup. After trying 5-6 different machines I eventually gave up. Please management can you sort this out?
Staff were courteous and friendly at all times and the view of the Galle fort and the ocean, from the front rooms, is spectacular.
title: Can be better

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Walking into the lobby has a lovely look and ambiance and the staff were very pleasant. The room was hot and the ac did not work properly, the staff got it functional but it was problematic and had a bad aroma, we decided not to use it and opened the patio doors for the breeze. Tried to use the gym but the ac smelt so musty we could not use it. In hindsight we should have stayed in the Fort area.
title: Looks better than it is.

placeInfo/address: No. 30 Park Road, Kaluwalla, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We chose this hotel for the location, pool and food. So here is the good and bad.
Location is ok as very near to Old Galle Fort however the park gates are locked so you are not able to short cut through the park but walk round, not to far but past the municipal garbage! Of course not the hotels fault and a tuk tuk is less than $2 usd.
We booked the super deluxe room but it was not as shown on the website and has an enclosed bathroom. One of the most poorly designed bathrooms I've stayed in. No hooks only a rail on the toilet and shower door for towels, nothing for hand towels and no where to put your toiletries. 
The only mirror is in the bathroom above the sinks with nowhere to put anything...the hairdryer barely reaches  for you to see in the mirror and it gets hot in there as it has no ac in the bathroom.
No mirror in the main bedroom.
Tea is the worst and no tea pot...this is Sri Lanka tea country? They did however bring milk when we requested it for our in room tea.
Breakfast was a large buffet but not great quality.
So now to the positives, the staff are helpful and happy.
The pool area is peaceful and a good temperature.  Not sure how this would be when the hotel is busy as there are not any beds.
title: The good and bad.....

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from Resplendent Ceylon!

We wanted to take a moment to personally thank you for your feedback on your stay with us. We truly appreciate your valuable insights and feedback as we are constantly striving to improve our special blend of hospitality.

We am very sorry we could not deliver your experience to the best of our abilities. We are looking into each of your constructive comments and they are being actioned for immediate improvement.

We hope you give us the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked a luxury villa for two nights. But unfortunately this villa didn’t have ocean view (at least partial). It’s not worth the premium price. We recommend you call ahead and specifically clarify the ocean view if that’s important to you!

Food : Breakfast was excellent. Dinner options for seafood were limited. I had local seafood platter which was great.

Rooms/ villas
Clean and well kept, but substantially below the standards for a high end resort. 

Out toilet was not flushing and hot water system was not working. This caused great inconvenience for us on the first day. When we complained maintanece staff came to fix it, but they could not. 
Then they offered us another villa, and said it would be ready by 2.30pm, and advised us to pack and be ready. But it wasn’t ready until 530pm. 

Staff- 
Good and friendly. But they looked tired and exhausted. 

Front-desk staff- 
Mahendra was great and helpful but Govinda needs bit more training in customer service. 

Location
Excellent and unique

Beach 
Have access to 2 public beaches, small walk, west beach was very rough, but the south beach was great, and about 300m walk from that point another excellent surf beach, all accessible. 

Surrounding village
We did a walk bit-beyond surf-beach. Noted number of luxury resorts and the area has become very trendy!
title: Tropical beach holiday

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks for your valuable feedback regarding your culinary experience, which we will certainly take into consideration. We hope to welcome you again!

The Resplendent Team
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: The property is beautiful and has stunning views of the Indian Ocean along with comfortable rooms. The staff provided us with amazing service and hospitality and I loved the activities that were available including  a mask painting workshop which was really fun! But the  the food left much to be desired. Dinner was average and the breakfast was not very good that I didn’t even up finishing it. Ordered an eggs Benedict and was given a boiled  egg with something that resembled a paste rather than a Hollandaise sauce. Was very much disappointed with the overall food.
title: Stunning property, amazing hospitality , disappointing food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Claudie, thank you for your feedback. My apologies that you found the melon gazpacho soup too spicy. Whilst we offer Sri Lankan cuisine, our menus include a wide range of highly rated western dishes. I wish you’d stayed with us and experienced more than one meal, which would have convinced you of our culinary capabilities. My apologies once again, we have shared your findings with the team as a learning.

warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Fantastic views, outstanding estate probably focused on couples more than families (since no room can accommodate a family of 4 as default) and extremely quiet. 
However the main Terrasse restaurant is a disappointment, the attending staff is lovely, the view is once again breath-taking but the food is so called Sri-Lankan fusion and not targeted for western palates. Despite asking for no chillis we found ourselves in tears most of the lunch... We love spices, we just don't appreciate chilli that adds nothing to a dish flavors in our opinion. My husband tried with difficulties to eat his dishes when I gave up at the first one after 2 spoons in f the Melon soup ( previously confirmed with waiter - who was lovely by the way)- that it was not spicy /hot - explaining while taking order that we will choose non spicy dishes )
So when carefully selecting dishes and making it clear while ordering, it was disappointing to see the kitchen isn't able to follow clients' requirements. A pity for a Relais & Chateaux establishment.
It’s actually our first time having such an experience in a Relais & Chateaux restaurant.
Ended up the experience with a pushy cashier getting way too close to myself  while I was getting cash out of my purse just because you need to carry perfectly new USD notes with you otherwise they will not take it (supposedly a bank requirement. The notes were absolutely fine and I got so confused with the notes that he wanted to exchanged, the one that I already gave that it made me feel very nervous. It was a very unpleasant moment.
Overall, despite the amazing and breathtaking location, the lovely restaurant set up, and pleasant and welcoming staff (except the cashier) our experience was just a disappointment.
title: Restaurant at the Terrasse

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Over rated Hotel. Pictures at website and general at the internet are not showing reality.

There is not really a beach as nicely shown.

Furniture are very old and the overall area missing maintanance Speciali family area.

Luckily we staying only for 3 days.
title: Over rated

ownerResponse/text:
Please accept my sincere apologies for the malfunctioning air-conditioning and the inappropriate way our team handled the matter.  I have gone into the shortcomings personally to take corrective action. I am glad you enjoyed Cape Weligama despite this and understand it made your stay less than perfect. We look forward to delivering that perfect stay on your next visit. 

warm wishes, Malik
Managing Director
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed at Cape Weligama for two nights over the last weekend to celebrate a part of our honeymoon. We have visited Resplendent Ceylon Wild coast a few times before this, so was eager to visit this property despite the negative comments we had heard about it.

The property is situated in a stunning location and the views from different areas of the resort were breathtaking. My wife and I wanted to highlight how much we enjoyed the food and the drinks at the hotel. Every single meal we had was very good. Ruwen and Sanka from the restaurant attended to all our needs and truly went out of their way to accommodate our every request.

However, we were quite upset about one thing that happened to us during our stay. 

On our way to lunch we asked for our room AC to be fixed because it was not working. When we came back It was still not fixed. An engineering team was sent to our room and their response was " this is how the AC works, the hotel is a bit busy today so this is all the central AC can put out". 

One of our friends joined us on this trip for the second night and we went to their room to see if their room had the same issue, however their room AC was working far better than ours. Later we asked for the engineering team again but this time with our villa host Sherom. Even he visited the room and acknowledged that the room AC wasn't cooling. However the response to the issue by the team was for us to open the doors in the toilet and the room and let the toilet AC cool the room. Unfortunately this was a really bad experience for us. A room change was not even suggested to us by them and I don't think even the GM was informed about this.

It was really unfortunate that this happened to us because we enjoyed everything else in the property but coming back to a room with a broken AC in this heat was not a pleasent experience. We were up most of the night due to the heat.

However, great property, excellent food and great service by the restaurant staff but I feel like our issue should have been handled much better.
title: Beautiful property, Excellent food but our issue was handled very poorly by management.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Olly, I’m glad that you found our rooms perfect. Our villas are located at the top of cliff and are named Ocean Villas. The suites are in the valley, alongside the ocean and overlook the family pool hence termed Pool View Suites. There is a prominent image on the website showing the family pool which is by the Pool View Suite you booked. The restaurants bars gym and main pool are at the top of the hill.   

I’m afraid I don’t understand your comment about depicting a wrong beach. We have two beaches, one on either side and always have had. If you would send me the image you refer to I will verify which of our two beaches it is.   East beach isn’t “very dirty”. Yes it is a public beach as all beaches in Sri Lanka are. But not at all busy. It is next to our adventure centre. We plan to open a beach club with full drinks and meal service in July - this has taken time as approvals are cumbersome. If you would honour us with a return visit this would address all your concerns. My apologies that we fell short of your expectations. Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We were at Cape Weligama towards the end of our stay in this beautiful country. We were there after 4 weeks of travel and after having beautifull experiences in  what would be at the end of our trip,11 other luxury hotels (all the Uga, Kandy House, Water Garden, Tintagel....) and even Norwood Bungalows Tea Trails who belong to the same group which was excellent. 
We were disapointed with 3 things :
1-The hotel could be located anywhere in the world it has no special local features except if you look in the dining room at   the niche for the lights which resemble the niches on the stairs of the temples.
2-We thought we would be 40 m above sea level, Wrong we were in part of the hotel which is located in a sort of small valley. None of the pictures of the hotel show that part!
3-The beaches : we could not find the beach which is on the brochure! There is an east beach. Out of the hotel . It is a pubic beach very dirty (battries, plastics of all sorts...) no service from the hotel. Across the road a annex of the hotel.
The west beach, very nice but you have to go down some steps and then only part of the beach is "swimmable" (corals) , no shade, and there again no hotel service.
The hotel will tell you that all beaches are public in SL. That is true but some hotels do have services on the back of the beach (lounge chairs...) Amanwella for instance. 
We were told that we could stay at the infinity pool....
We left the hotel one day early, I have to say that the management was good about it and they refunded the night that we did not spend with them, I thank them for their understanding. 
It is  a shame as we thought that we would be relaxing on a beach and although the rooms are perfect it is not what the brochure or internet leads you to beleive.
title: Lie by omission

ownerResponse/text: Hi, I was scratching my head on reading this until I realised that you had stayed one year ago. I acknowledge that we had some service shortfalls back then as a result of a spate of hotel openings and staff movement. In the one year since​ the team has been rebuilt to deliver the high standards that guests in the past year have experienced and posted on TripAdvisor about. My apologies that we couldn't do our best for you, warm wishes, Malik J Fernando
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask for an upgrade: I doubt occupation rates ever get near 75%
text: I stayed here as part of an extensive tour of Sri-Lanka.  A lot of money has been spent on copying other All-Inclusive resorts that exist around the globe BUT .......   although the accommodation (villa) was huge and palatial the whole project fails in many ways.  If you are a holiday maker that does not mind paying up to twice the going rate for food (as included or to order) that is the same as that yards away and does not want any link to the actual country you are visiting then this place may suit.  Where money has not been spent is on staff training or to install any pride in working where customers are paying premium rates.  Is the food good? Is the position of the resort and the views good?  Are there plenty of staff?  Are there places to swim?  Are the villas/rooms of high quality?  All these questions I would have to answer, Yes.  Somehow though, the whole place lacks atmosphere and anything special.  Even by Sri-Lankan standards, service is completely haphazard.  One person will be energetic and, at least, trying to provide service for every three trying to avoid any connection with customers whatsoever.  Best summed up for me in that the villa had its own (shared) large plunge-pool and ‘Spotify’ available on the huge TV/Sound system but in the ‘snack’ restaurant there was little Sri-Lankan food, if any, and the guy that served us had started work an hour earlier with no training and, as a result, took 25 mins to get our food order completely wrong.  There are better places, in terms of value, that are not hard to find across Sri-Lanka.
title: All-Inclusive missing the point.

ownerResponse/text: Sorry we disappointed you Kalhari on your anniversary. We strive for a particular modern Sri Lankan food direction which clearly didn't appeal to you. Since you live nearby, we did invite you back which you refused. We do offer good value as other guests often attest - I’m sorry about the mismatch of expectations in this particular case. We did offer to make it up to you - the offer stands. Warm wishes, Malik
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We chose Cape Weligama as the hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary.the hotel,architecture,view was breathtaking.beautifully furnished large rooms.
But we were so disappointed with the service,food quality and experience.for the price we paid we truly looked forward to a great experience.after trip adviser ranking it the best property we didn't think twice.
The staff really tries hard but we felt they are not up to standard to serve at a 5 star.guests pay good money and expect value for money.
The food was mediocre.poorly served.
There was no room in the terrace for us to have a drink.they can easily create spots for people to relax.
It was unbearably warm that day and less sea breeze,with badly functioning fans it spoiled our evening.
They serve food with no proper combination and poorly presented.nothing close to a 5 star restaurant.
My friend called that night to surprise us with a bottle of wine and the hotel staff simply said to deliver the bottle.they don't even know how to handle a request like that on a special day.
Absolutely nothing for kids! The kids ply area was closed even at 2pm in the afternoon.
They have to understand that a great property is not good enough.create a great experience!
Train your staff.
title: No value for money

ownerResponse/text: Hi, I'm sorry the food disappointed - with just 39 rooms we have 2 restaurants, Ocean Terrace and Ocean Grill. New menus are being introduced in November. I will private message you to understand the quality concerns. My apologies. War wishes, Malik J Fernando
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: The villa did not disappoint - beautiful in every aspect.  However, food was extremely limited - there is not an array of restaurants at all.  One main (dark) room where you eat breakfast (good), lunch (slow and average) and dinner (same as lunch).  The menu never changes and after two meals as a family, it was difficult to think of something new to try.  Quality was also very disappointing but our family loves its food so we would expect more.  Some staff lovely and helpful, but a lot of new staff who clearly were being trained on the job, not before as you would expect with a hotel in this price range.
title: Fabulous villas, disappointing food

ownerResponse/text: Dear William, I’m sorry that your found your stay below expectation. Am looking into what went amiss and will take take corrective action. I hope we will have the chance to restore your confidence in the future. Warm wishes, Malik J Fernando
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: This property has so much potential to be a top notch resort on the island, however its service and facilities are let downs. The food offering is very limited, considering there are few options near by. We are extremely lucky to have met Chef Tim, who looked after us during our stay. Come here for its amazing views, but do not expect the service of a luxury resort.
title: Style no substance...

ownerResponse/text: hi Ekmini, thanks for your review, I'm happy that you found Cape Weligama stunning! My apologies for the power outage, we had been redoing some of the pathways - an underground cable had been damaged with intermittent issues until it was replaced. We hope to see you back!
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Bit of a bumpy start.. check in took longer than expected.. and was a bit disorganized. Then we were left in our room until the butler came back because he was checking out the room above us.
However he was extremely gracious, warm and helpful.
The resort is absolutely stunning. With gorgeous scenery at every turn. Since I was there in the off season.. felt very tranquil and quiet. The pool was shared by 4 rooms.. but I had the pool all to myself. The infinity pool was just amazing. The view breathtaking.
Unfortunately the property doesn't have a beach.. you have to walk down the road to get to the public beach which isn't busy at all.
The rooms and bathroom were huge and beautiful.
Dinner was amazing. Desserts are delightful with a local twist. I had the jackfruit pannacotta.. which I think is probably one of the best desserts I've ever had.
At night we woke up sweating, turns out the electricity had gone out. I called extension no.3 which was the reception and no one seems to be able to pick that line. Finally called operator and they had someone fix it.
There appeared to be something wrong with the phone.. because when I tried to dial the butler, it wouldn't connect as well. Not sure if these are problems only present during the off season..
Overall didn't really meet the expectations of other 5 star resorts, but was a pleasant stay.
title: 1 night stay

placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: Room was not ocean view as booked. Very disappointed . Did get an upgrade last two days. Main pool is great. Food has been good to very good. Service not there yet but great butler, . Large room ok interior but not a good master plan . Other guests seem to enjoy so maybe our stay was affected by the poor views from room .
title: Okay stay

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for taking the time to pen down such an extensive review. I'm sorry that you left Cape Weligama with mixed sentiments. Whilst taking comfort in the positive points you make, I am personally looking into the areas for improvement - corrective action has already been taken, such as increasing the number of sun beds by our spectacular Moon pool. The pools in the Residence gardens that require it will soon be afforded more privacy with new landscaping. Our duplex Cape Weligama Residences already have exclusive use pools. Luxury hospitality is relatively new to Sri Lanka and we do have the odd hiccup with the quality of English for instance. It's also been our first full high season and, whilst we fared very well as seen from the vast majority of responses, we fell short in a few cases which have provided useful learnings. English classes will be intensified for those staff who aren't yet proficient. We have sun beds at the beach club although it's set back slightly from the beach. We also have a new dedicated spa opening mid year. It's been 16 months since we opened and in the coming summer months I'm confident we will, as the pioneer Sri Lankan luxury resort brand, meet the standards of the long established global hotel groups you mention. Toward that end, your frank feedback is extremely useful. I will private messages you in case other suggestions come to mind. I do hope you might return to Sri Lanka and experience our next resort; Wild Coast Tented Lodge near the Yala National Park, due to open end year.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 7 days in Cape Weligama and although there were a lot of positives we left with mixed feelings about our stay.

We stayed in the Grand Residence which was spacious and nicely furnished with a private garden overlooking the ocean. Unfortunately there was no private pool, a common feature in similarly priced hotels in Asia and the Indian Ocean. The concept of the shared pool didn't work well for us - it was situated just outside another villa and we didn't feel comfortable using it while that villa was occupied, which was for most of our stay.

Although there is essentially one main restaurant the food was probably one of the positives. There was a reasonable selection of dishes and cocktails with nice cold soups for lunch. The chef was very attentive and the service was quite efficient. The only exception was the afternoon teas - the tea selection was good, but the canapés could have been better. The service was mediocre at best. There seemed to be a different team of waiters providing the afternoon tea service with a rather poor knowledge of English.

The butler service did not seem to make much of a difference. Having a butler added no value beyond basic house keeping services and transportation around the resort. Speaking of service, we acutely felt a lack of a professional concierge. We've had the most appalling tour of Galle arranged by out butler. Never before have we come across such an unprofessional tour guide. We wanted to share this with the management team, but unfortunately they have not been available to discuss. Not having any meaningful engagement with the management in such a small hotel was indeed rather unusual and very different from our experiences elsewhere.

Even though not having a private beach was unusual in a negative way, the beach club was one of the nicer features, our daughter really enjoyed the activities and had a great interaction with the staff. Having some chaise lounges available at the beach would have helped - we've seen such service provided for hotel guests in public beaches, including really busy places like Copacabana. I guess it would have been a matter of not sparing a cost of few more employees. We went to Udawalawe and whale watching tours arranged by the beach club. We were largely satisfied, although considering the price ($500 for Udawalawe) the quality of the vehicles could have been better. Arranging for some nice snacks would have been a nice touch too, we've had Esyjet quality sandwiches, surprising for a luxury resort.

Public spaces and overcrowded adult pool were probably the biggest disappointments. Adult pool has beautiful views, but very little space around it. On more than one occasion there were no available chaise lounges. We were asked not to use the pool with our 7 year old daughter, but ended up using it anyway in the absence of other options. Unfortunately the families pool looked very unappealing, with no views and surrounded by rather grim looking buildings housing the smaller accommodations. On the subject of children, I would not recommend this hotel for families with small children. Spending a holiday with no kids club and around a rather depressing looking families pool may not be the best option.

The spa facilities were inadequate, a small villa was converted for a spa, so no pools, spacious relaxation areas, etc... They provide in the room treatments, but having it done in a bathroom with no air conditioner wasn't tempting and I ended up not having a spa treatment for the first time in quite a few years.

There is a nice potential and the location is truly beautiful. Having less villas and hotel rooms crammed into a relatively small space and more place left for private pools and spa facilities would have made for a more exclusive experience. Having a proper butler and / or concierge service as well as an engaged management team would have also made a difference.

We have been lucky to stay in quite a few luxury hotels and resorts around the world, including established chains, such as the Four Seasons, Mandarins, Banyan Tree, etc... Unfortunately with all the positives, and there are some, Cape Weligama comes short.
title: Mixed experience

ownerResponse/text: Hi, thanks for your review. Although in the minority, it is taken very seriously indeed as we do have the occasional hiccup and always seek to improve. We have started a diagnosis of the systems and human resource issues you flag. I may need to contact you in this regard, if I may. My sincere apologies that these matters marred your stay.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Upgrade to a Residence for a more peaceful experience. The rooms in blocks of 4 are  right by the family pool and not well sound-proofed.
text:
We spent 6 days here recently and sadly I think my review will be in a minority based on our experience.

Firstly, the positives - CW is in a lovely setting, the rooms are beautiful, the food is great, the staff are lovely - very warm and genuine.

We were in one of the rooms in the blocks of 4 - right by the family pool.  The room was huge and beautifully fitted out. We'd been on a wait list for a cancellation for a more private residence as we travelled as a couple without children.  Sadly no joy but we met a couple who booked only 2 weeks before arrival for the same dates as us, who managed to get a more private Residence.   No-one had informed us this room type had become available.  These rooms are great if you have children ... but if you don't, and are seeking peace, you should definitely make sure you get an accommodation outside of these blocks.

We had a butler who was very sweet but whose English was so limited, there was little point in asking for anything - a contrast to most of the other reviews on here.  We weren't told of excursions, timings for breakfast, etc. Upon check in, our room rate was incorrectly logged - not a great start when you have paid up front.  There was a catalogue of issues that I am noting with our travel company. It was 4 days before we saw a Manager of any description.  There is no information book in the room to detail what is where ....  I've never stayed in a hotel of this level and cost, and been so poorly informed.

The reception area seems to be manned by a few teenagers and a 'manager' of sorts - our check-out was far from seamless. That's another story.

The saving grace of this property would be the rest of the staff. The restaurant team especially were just so lovely - the chef's, waiters - nothing was to much trouble and they were attentive and charming. The food was great too.  Afternoon tea every day was a lovely touch, again with perfect service.  

I think the management presence and modus operandi needs to tighten up - the staff are great - but cohesion and clarity for guests is much needed for it to be under the Relais Chateau name.
title: So much right but far from perfect ...

ownerResponse/text: Whilst thanking you for your kind comments on the location and beauty of Cape Weligama, I'm very sorry that you found the butler and some service aspects wanting. I will get in touch for more details to help with corrective action. My apologies once again.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
When we booked a weekend stay at Cape Weligama, we really did count the days till we got there. Having flown into Colombo a few days prior, the pictures and prospect of a luxury stay by the beach was incredibly enticing.

On arrival, there was great promise of the type of service and standards we expected. We were warmly greeted with cold towels and refreshing fruit sorbets - very welcome in the heat. Our butler then introduced himself and escorted us around the property and on to our Residence Villa. 

The property is stunning, set on a cliff top overlooking Weligama bay. It's an architectural delight and well appointed. Our villa was really beautiful too. The manager made himself known and chatted with us at mealtimes, which was also nice. 

So where did our stay go wrong? Mainly we found service and attention to detail could be vastly improved. Here's why:
- our butler was a nice man, but he didn't explain anything to us properly. For example, on our tour of the property he should have told us more about amenities and services available. 
- a cot was requested a few days prior to our arrival. When we reached, there was no cot set up in our room. Once it was set up, it required another call and another wait for bedding to arrive. 
- same when I requested milk and meals for our toddler. Despite placing the request several hours earlier for a specific time, it was always brought late to the room. 
- where was the afternoon tea that I had read about? Again, we weren't sure if this was included as part of our stay (a regular feature in other hotels of a similar standard). Well we didn't get it on the first day and there was no mention of it on the second either - although we chose to spend the day out. 
- the food was mediocre, Sri Lankan dishes not very authentic. The spices are severely toned down to appease Western palates, but I don't believe that every dish should have been so bland. The chef on the other hand was a delight - he happily obliged our requests to turn up the heat for dishes we ordered. Hoppers on the Friday night were also not good - they were flat and doughy with no crispness. Breakfast was better. 
- Turn down service had to be requested and in fact, we went without on the first night as our toddler was already asleep by 7.30pm. A 2-point plug vaporiser for mosquitos is provided for a room that is only equipped with 3-point plugs. Again, yet another phone call to be made. 
- speaking of turn down, there is nothing placed as a special treat in the room. No petit fours, no fruit basket, toiletries, nothing! Not asking for towels to be sculpted but a little something is again a standard in any hotel! 
- also note that a pool is shared between 3 residence villas, it's not completely private for your own use. 

Additionally, we never really heard from our butler. Whether to organise excursions or if we had any special requests, we never received that type of personalised service. We treat ourselves to a couple of luxury retreats every year, mainly around South East Asia and each time, have been blown away by the standards and attention of staff. Sadly not here.

Cape Weligama is a very beautiful place with warm and friendly staff; but has far to go to reach a level of service expected in a luxury retreat of this category, despite charging prices that are on par (or above) similar resorts in Bali and Vietnam.
title: Misses a few special touches

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. I'm glad you liked the facilities. My apologies that we missed the sorbet at dinner. I understand the Resort Manager delivered it to your table and offered you alternate meal choices. We don't have a welcome pack. We will ensure the room service menu is more prominently displayed. Thank you for your feedback and once again, my apologies for the mishap at dinner.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for 3 days over Christmas as a family. We arrived early and promptly checked in and shown around the property and facilities. It is has 5 start facilities, no question. My issue was with the Dinner on Christmas eve. It was poor quality, rushed and we had courses skipped. When we complained, we then had no further service at all. I do not think a senior member of management was in the restaurant. We did not receive a welcome pack, or was advised that we could have dinner delivered to our room......Bottom line, when you are made to pay in advance, you have little recourse to complain. The food by the pool was pretty good for lunch, it is a shame that the evenings are buffet. If you are pay over $1500 a night it needs to be 5* +, and I am sorry to say this is not.
title: Good, but could do better

ownerResponse/text:
I am happy that you liked the rooms and the grounds. My apologies for your sub par experience with the food. We seem to have fallen short with every meal you experienced. I will investigate thoroughly why we fell short of our usual high standard in your case and contact you directly. Thank you for bringing your concerns to our notice, we seek every opportunity to improve. 

Frederic Perrin, General Manager
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
We are devotees of this properties sister hotels the Tea Tails, which I have reviewed on this site. So we decided to try the new addition to this chain.

On arrival there was such promise. The site is spectacular. The buildings are just beautiful. The master suite we stayed at huge, beautifully appointed and finished with great love and care. The room phone did not work and I could not log into the WIFI, no issue the in house IT man came and sorted it out. Now where do you get this kind of service?

Then we hit the restaurant! I ordered a beef burger, which was just dreadful. The pattie had absolutely no seasoning, which would have been fine if the beef had flavour. The Crepe I had for dessert was a really thick pancake.

Afternoon tea again served beautifully and with divine pastries. Shame about the stone cold scones that were dry as the Sahara dessert.

At dinner we were encouraged (Strongly!) to eat at the buffet which really was a sorry sight for a US $940/night all inclusive stay. We asked foe the A La Carte. The coconut crumbed prawns were shrimps drawing in oil and batter. The steak was much better for the main as was the dessert of cold strawberry soufle.

Breakfast was another disappointment. Again actively encouraged to the buffet, again a sad sight. Stuck with the A La Carte with consequences. The croissants were stone cold. The eggs Benedict was on a muffin that was rock hard and that had clearly been defrosted in a rush. My partners Sri Lankan omelet had no spice in spite of him asking for extra chilli. The Passion fruit and Mango Smoothie never arrived.

This is meant to be a Relais and Chateaux property which it currently clearly is not. Such a shame, stunning pools, gardens would work perfectly with a functioning kitchen.....

I am well wisher of this chain and I hope my comments are taken in a constructive context.
title: So close and yet so far in executing a fabulous experience

ownerResponse/text:
I'm sorry to note your disappointment with the lunch menu at Cape Weligama. An exciting new menu with a seafood focus will launch July 20, by which time other improvements in the kitchen would also have taken place. 

I'd like to invite you any time after that date to sample the new menu as my guest. Your feedback would be valuable. I will private message you my contact details.

Rates at Cape Weligama include meals and drinks. The $60 charge is for walk in guests and  includes free flow wines and spirits. As some prefer flexibility, the new menus will be individually priced for walk in guests.

I hope that we will have the opportunity to redeem ourselves in your eyes.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Undoubtedly, Cape Weligama offers the most spectacular views of the ocean for a Sri Lankan hotel of its size (39 huge villas). Unlike most beach hotels with which we Sri Lankans are familiar, one cannot step out of your room or hotel lawn into the sea but rather, must content oneself with contemplating sweeping, azure horizons and the rippling, rolling, sonorous surf from afar. Not surprisingly, it is this height and distance that proffers a breathtaking vista and architect Lek Bunnag must be congratulated for cleverly positioning the villas so that each affords a different view of the ocean while simultaneously providing privacy to the occupants. The panorama from the bed on the upper floor of the Joris van Spillbergen villa was especially magical.

The villas themselves are a study in opulence and comfort, with the bathroom almost equalling the size of the bedroom! Your very own butler is also on hand to cater to your slightest whim. However, I sorely missed the spare, clean lines I have come to associate with most Sri Lankan boutique hotels and villas designed by renowned local architects –both Bawa and beyond—that stimulate ones aesthetic sensibilities at every glance and turn; I have often strolled down a path or corridor and been stopped short by the sheer beauty of the architectural form and the elegant configuration of interiors and exteriors. Not so at Cape Weligama, unfortunately. In fact, the reception area was particularly hideous and uninviting. The only interesting architectural feature was the installation of drop down guttering that must conjure up sweet music when it rains.

The greatest disappointment at Cape Weligama was the food. I hasten to add that I only had one meal, lunch, as we were pressed for time but it was singularly unexceptional and so exorbitantly priced (US$60 per person) for what was on offer that I don’t think I shall return to this hotel no matter how stunning the views are from its dining deck or concave, salt water pool. 

My friend Minnie had been promised ‘fine dining’ by Manager Kosala so we sat down for a rather late lunch with great anticipation. Sadly, the menu offered up the usual clichés --your basic burgers, some pasta, a couple of dishes infused with Sri Lankan spices and a few others that echoed Thai dishes. Most surprisingly, there was no seafood on the menu with the exception of a tiny slab of barramundi slathered in ‘curry’ sauce. One member of our party did find the Thai beef salad appetizer very tender and succulent and Minnie’s Thai papaya salad appetizer provided a wondrous burst of flavor but my cold pineapple and coconut soup was too sweet and had an unpleasant aftertaste. All the mains were mediocre –my grilled vegetable and feta wrap was indistinguishable from ones I’ve eaten in hole-in-the wall cafés in Colombo. The desserts were similarly unimaginative. Thankfully, this uninspiring repast was mitigated by a delicious dinner at Café Ceylon, a few kilometres away, for ¼ the price of our lunch.
title: Spectacular views but mediocre food

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. Your constructive comments are important to us to take corrective action. Please accept my sincere apologies that we disappointed you. I assure you that this is not indicative of the service levels that we pride ourselves on. 

I’m glad that you found Cape Weligama heavenly despite the setback and assure you that corrective action has already been taken, which I trust you are experiencing to your satisfaction presently at the resort.
placeInfo/address: Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Heavenly place, a perfect  location and breathtaking views but........ Horribly let down by the food.  We have been here two nights so far and have had cold food both nights, and indifferent food at that. Our experience is not unique, other couples staying here have also complained and got nowhere.  

It's really frustrating as the staff are great and the service excellent but the restaurant is seriously letting the place down. We have stayed in Sri Lanka three times, in many hotels and I can honestly say this is the worst food we have eaten on this lovely island.  

We've tried western food and Sri Lankan here, both have been indifferent and served cold, it's just not right!  Roll on our return to Colombo.
title: Just not good enough

ownerResponse/text:
Hello there,

Thanks for taking the time to rate us and write us such a detailed review.
I believe it will help many fellow visitors to imagine the ins and outs of Elements.

We will take the areas for improvement  to our consideration as well.

Really hope that you visit us again on your next vacation to Sri Lanka.
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Elements Beach & Nature Resort for 2 days and enjoyed ourselves overall. We were greeted on arrival by the Manager and offered a welcome drink. It was very quiet when we arrived, we did not see any other guests or staff, so we did not know what to expect. We were not required to formally check-in as with other hotels/resorts and were shown to our room by the resort's Housekeeper. 

This resort is very much back to basics, it is calm and peaceful. We enjoyed hearing and seeing the donkeys around the resort, as well as the dogs and a cat who were usually around the dining area/beach. We found that the staff were very friendly but generally kept to themselves. The staff were kind enough to provide fresh milk for our tea and to check in on us when we skipped dinner on our first night after having a heavy lunch before arriving at the resort. 

We were not informed of any activities available at the resort but there is a board with a list of activities next to the Reception, so we assumed you would have to enquire yourself if you were interested in any. We were there to relax, so this was not really an issue for us although I do think some conversation from staff may entice guests to try something new while at the resort! 

The tide was rough when we visited, so we could not go into the sea but we did enjoy walks along the beach after breakfast. The swimming pool and view of the sea was lovely and the sunbeds provided were comfortable to relax on. The room's outdoor shower was very nice and worked well, toiletries provided were OK. The breakfast and dinner buffets were limited but were generally tasty and sufficient to keep you full till the next meal. We had lunch from the A La Carte menu on our second day and enjoyed the poke bowl and chicken burger with chips. We also ordered mocktails, which were very nice. 

It was very hot when we visited and the ceiling fan would not have been sufficient by itself, fortunately we found another fan upstairs in our room. We were also advised not to flush any tissue down the toilet, instead a bin is provided for you to place your tissue after use - this was a reminder that we were staying in an eco friendly resort! We generally enjoyed our stay and would consider revisiting and possibly trying kite surfing or paddleboarding, which the resort seems to be well known for and may enhance our experience at the resort!
title: Something different...

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
De villa met zeezicht staat vergenoeg van andere villa's zodat je genoeg privacy hebt. Er is geen airco, alleen 'natuurlijke' airco door de luchtgaten en openingen in dak. Het bleef alsnog wel warm in de kamer. We hadden 3 keer een kakkerlak in de kamer, maar dat hoort daar 'bij de natuur'. Buiten heb je een royale zitplaats waar je lekker kan relaxen. Er zijn wel heel erg veel vliegen, die hier zijn door de kippenboerderij en andere boerderijen in de buurt. (Dat is wat Samith de manager ons vertelde) Veel vliegen zijn er dus het hele jaar. Om 5.00 uur in de ochtend hoor je de moskee van de buurtgemeenschap. Wij waren er met de kerst en op kerstavond was er een BBQ. Rest van de dagen vonden wij het eten oke, maar niet heel bijzonder. Dat is ieders eigen smaak uiteraard. De locatie ligt vrij afgelegen en voor het regelen van eigen vervoer komt er geen Uber of Pickme. De manager kan iets voor je regelen, maar daar staat een vrij hoge prijs tegenover omdat ze een local vragen (prima, ook eigen keus)
Wij vonden de prijs die we per nacht betaalde best pittig, komt ook nog 10% tax bij (ook bij restaurantrekening, maar dat staat erbij vermeld). De echte eigenaars van dit resort zijn erg vriendelijk en correct. Daar kregen wij een beter gevoel bij als bij de manager. Het personeel in het restaurant is super! Heel vriendelijk en gezellig en ook recht uit hun hart heel betrokken.
title: Mooie villa met zicht op veel vogels

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ian

Thanks a lot for your detailed and honest review. We highly appreciate all of your feedback.

- Room/Bed size for 4 people: I see you were staying in a round Villa. You are absolutely right that the two beds upstairs are not really made for 2 adults, especially not in the round villa. In the rectangular there is a bit more space upstairs. I will instruct our staff/management to accommodate 4 people only in the rectangular villas and to inform the guests before the stay that the space is limited upstairs.

- Shower/hot water: I just instructed the staff to check this and take action accordingly.

- Number of sun beds: Noted and you are absolutely right, that we don't have 20 sun beds around the pool. Normally never more than half of the guests use the pool beds at the same time, but as we are growing again at this moment this will be brought forward by me at the next meeting which takes place later this month, so we can invest there.

- Breakfast & dinner: Both are included in the room charge as you state correctly. That the food is not hot is not the standard that we aim for. Will definitely take action there. Also you should definitely be welcome to eat later if you desire to do so. 

- Attention to the detail: I know about that and it is the hardest part currently as an owner if you cannot be on the spot yourself at all times. However this shall not be an excuse and also here: Thanks for telling it.

Summarized: All points noted and taken seriously. I hope that despite these weak points you enjoyed your stay!

Thank you and best regards
Laurent Bobay
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
The resort is set in a lovely, quiet location and peaceful, natural environment. They try to be eco friendly so rooms do not have AC, and they provide glass water bottles that they refill each day from a large water bottle to reduce plastic use, which is to be applauded. 

While the rooms are generally adequate, the villas are sold as fit for 4 adults - with a king size bed and 2 single beds. This is a bit of a stretch as, in reality, the single beds are only useful for younger children; they certainly were not really big enough for our two sons aged 17 and 19. 

Others have commented that the waterfall shower is good. I agree that it is a good idea as a concept. However, the water seems to be heated from solar panels but the water in our villa was not hot at any time of day that we tried to use it, so our waterfall shower was in reality a cold water shower. 

During our stay there were 21 guests, but the resort cannot really cater for this number, as there are insufficient sun loungers around the pool or on the beach for this many guests, and in any event those around the pool are not fully shaded. The resort needs to invest in more sun loungers to match with the number of guests that the rooms can accommodate. 

Perhaps the area most in need of improvement is the food. The breakfast is charged at Rs1400 and the dinner at Rs2100 (plus 10%), which is far too much for the quality available (though both were included in our room rate). The meals are buffet style and if you aren’t there when they bring the food out (8am for breakfast and 7pm for dinner) they sometimes run out before you’ve eaten.  

At lunch we ordered a number of dishes, including the chicken kotthu, which arrived cold. We sent it back asking for it to be warmed up but it was returned - still cold - with the explanation that they couldn’t use the oven as it blew the fuses if they tried to do so. I would have expected them to take things off the menu if they couldn’t serve hot meals hot, rather than serve them cold - particularly as it was twice the price of any other kotthu any of us have eaten during our 2 weeks in Sri Lanka. 

As mentioned at the start, however, the surroundings are magnificent. The resort just needs a bit of attention to detail and improved food to be considered value for money.
title: Great location, but room for improvement

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks a lot for your review! 

I have noted the weak points that you listed. It should really not be the way as you describe it with regard to breakfast and dinner times and no way should anybody feel like being under pressure to finish the meal and leave for the room again. I take this issue very serious and will look into this.

Regarding yoga and massage: We had it on our website in the past as we had a yoga instructor on site and an ayurvedic doctor on request, but we removed it quite some time ago. I just saw that on TripAdvisor we still had some images of ayurvedic treatment. I just removed them. Can you tell us where yoga & massages were advertised? It would help us to remove misleading information.

Thank you very much!
Best regards
Laurent Bobay
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful beach, easy to swim in ocean, lovely, cosy cabanas. We spent 4 nights end December- very enjoyable but no massage and yoga on site (as advertised) and nothing nearby outside the resort to do.  

Food very bland and disappointing compared to the great Sri Lankan food we ate elsewhere and the atmosphere was terrible - you have to be at breakfast at 08:00 and dinner at 19:00 or the meal is cold - We felt under pressure to finish eating and go back to our rooms as quickly as possible so the staff could clean up the dining area.

If you love kite-surf then highly recommended, if not look elsewhere.
title: Good location and cabana but no “atmosphere”

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Roel,

Thank you very much for your feedback. Indeed we were facing many flies during the wet/rain season in November and we were trying hard to improve the situation as much as possible.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Chips_with_Jam,

Thank you very much for your review. Good to hear that you had a good time at Elements. 

Let me briefly address the issues that you experienced:

Positions and pricing:
While pricing as a very delicate yet important topic, we continuously aim at at good balance between product and price. Our presently greatest difficulty there is our relatively small size hotel (10 rooms) coupled with its relative remoteness that raises the total cost per room. We constantly try to make the guest feel that the stay is worth the money. Compared with hotels in the area with a similar product (Bar Reef Resort, Ruwala Resort, Dolphin Beach Resort) we are in about the same price range.

Machinery at the beach:
Since many years the coast at Kappalady (Elements beach) is suffering heavy erosion. At the Elements we have lost approx. 40 meters of beach since 2007. We are happy that the Coast Conservation Department of Sri Lanka has approved the installation of 4 breaks to stop the erosion. Unfortunately that work was still in progress when you were at Elements. We apologise for the inconvenience caused. However it will be of great value for all of our future guest.

Billing/Checkout:
Thank you for this feedback. I will take initiative to speed up the checkout process and have it done accurately.

Thanks for your time to rate and review our place!

Best regards
Laurent
placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a tricky review as there are some great bits and some less good! We came specifically to kitesurf and weren't disappointed as both the wind and location is great. Fantastic flat lagoons with lots of space and the ocean side is also good.

The Staff were amazingly friendly and really looked after us and the chef and food at dinner was excellent.

The biggest problem in the positioning and the price. It is pretty expensive to stay there, and whilst previous review responses say it is not a kite-camp but rather a boutique resort, it really is somewhere in the middle. We have stayed at far nicer 'camps' with better breakfasts (breakfast is very basic), bar etc for a fraction of the price. The accommodation is however very good and certainly 'boutique' with big rooms and lovely outdoor showers.

The one thing that has made us rate it a 3 rather than a 4 is that the beach and restaurant had heavy machinery (diggers and a truck) continually going up and down the beach all day long. This really spoiled the peace and was non stop noise (they were building sea walls). Also be prepared for some noise/bangs in the mornings as there is a military testing ground nearby!

Also be sure to check your bill as ours (and others staying at the time) was wrong and the guy doing the invoicing seemed not to have a record of our booking or deposit payments! It took a while to sort out!

All of this considered, I would still recommend visiting for the kiting as it's a truly great location and even though we've given it 3/5, we would probably go back for this alone.
title: Lovely remote location but some issues

placeInfo/address: Ocean Drive 1, Kappalady Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344 Sri Lanka
text: The bungalows were spacious clean with fabulous outdoor showers. Breakfasts were simple but plentiful. Evening buffets were excellent if you like rice and curry ( we did) but the alternative menu for evenings or lunches was limited and quality poor apart from the fruit platter. Price for water was more than we experienced anywhere else in Sri Lanka . The fridge in our room didn't really cool anything and when the main fridge in the dining area broke down we had warm beer or warm water on offer for our last 2 days. The kite surfing was good but expensive .I felt one of the instructors was far more interested in his young female clients and had little patience with me as a middle aged mother.the resort is well off the beaten track and forced us to switch off and relax which was great.
title: Good place to unwind

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Find rooms close to lobby. Buggy is unreliable.
text:
To start off, the pluses - beautiful property, spacious rooms and well intentioned staff. The rooms overlook the tea estate and has a gorgeous view of the estates and a huge balcony to enjoy it. We stayed in a premium signature room. The food, service staff at restaurant were solid..so was the breakfast.

Now for the not so good - there was a rain shower which knocked down the internet, phone and TV! Which meant, there was no way to connect with the lobby or get help. We were passed from person to person and spent 530-730 pm fixing the issues, which left us all with a headache. Problem was not the issue but the fact that nobody took responsibility to fix it, nor did we get an eta on when it will be fixed. 

Second, there are a lot of fixable issues - no sign boards on property, understaffed which meant no buggy service post 10 pm and before 6:30 am! No public telephones (everything was IP phones). 

The swimming pool is down for renovation and they give access to Ravana pool, but it’s not a place for kids (hikers come to Ravana pool to get drunk and hang in the pool). Also the buggy cannot reach Ravana due to poor roads! So it’s not really a replacement pool. 

So overall, would I recommend? At this price (500 usd a night), not really. At that price and in Sri Lanka, I would expect top notch service that did not happen. The front office manager did his best to assuage with a small discount but that doesn’t cut it for a supposedly 5 star property.
title: Nice property with more misses than hits!

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No heated pool. Access to the pool shown in the promos is 20,000 LKR
text:
Whilst this hotel is located in some of the most serene countryside, this hotel is a MASSIVE tourist trap.

The deluxe room is very similar to much more reasonably priced hotels. King size bed, shower etc.,  
The electric here is terrible, constantly cutting out which means that the fan stops working when it switched to the generator and the consumer unit beeps each time it switches over. The rooms are poorly insulated from noise, I am not talking about the wildlife but the people in the room above.

Whilst the staff are lovely, everything else here is daylight robbery, everyone we spoke to complained, especially at the £13 for some spiced bar cashews. Food and drink are extremely overpriced and the  pool shots etc., they use in the promo materials are actually from a paid  separate club that isn’t included. A small, unheated pool is available but is very different from the promo materials.

My partner had a massage which she enjoyed but you don’t need to stay at the hotel for that and there is no discount.
title: Overpriced but with stunning views

text: 98 Acres cannot be faulted for its stunning location room and bed sizes/comfort and attentive house-keeping staff. Where it completely falls down is in the restaurant. The breakfast promises much, with a stunning view over Little Adam's Peak & Ella rock and with a cold buffet that is varied and tasty. However, the made to order cooked breakfast is not so good. On both occasions, ours arrived cold and with missing items. Surely it can't be that difficult to serve hot food on warmed plates?  When a hotel is charging 5 star prices, then guest expectations are naturally set at a level that needs to be delivered upon.  The restaurant falls way short of the mark. Our advice; go room only and take a tuk-tuk into town for your meals!

roomTip: Make sure ALL the building work has been finished before you go
text:
This hotel is wonderfully situated and the views are stunning. The staff are incredibly helpful and welcoming. The rooms are spacious, Clean and comfortable. You can walk easily to Little Adam’s peak. 

Unfortunately all of the above is marred by the heavy building works. Restaurant, pool all closed for renovation. Which we knew about - but there was also more building work around the rooms. Which meant you could not easily relax on your balcony and enjoy the views because of the sound of building from 8am - 6pm. We were placed next to a new block build. 

The upgrade to Ravana pool club is not an upgrade in our eyes. Unless being by a pool with loud music and drunk backpackers is your thing. Not a great environment for people with children. 

This is the only hotel - which on check out did not ask us how our stay was or to give feedback. It’s because they don’t want to hear it. 

This will be an amazing place once all the building has been finished and pool is open again. It’s a beautiful spot. It’s just a shame that the above distracted from the positives.
title: Mixed feelings

placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
+
The location
The view
The room (room itself + bedding)
The reception staff

-
Restaurant location and atmosphere
Staff training in restaurant 
Cleaningness when going to the restaurant
Service vs value

The staff at reception is welcoming and the first contact is warm.
We discover our room and wow, very nice (freshly build). The view is breathtaking, clean, smells good, the bathroom is huge and the bedding is comfy and qualitative. All good so far.
You have a direct access to mini Adam’s peak and several activities like zipline, swing, etc.

We go to the restaurant for the diner and begins the disappointment. First, this bright and horrible automatic light oriented on the tables is really annoying, but seems normal to everyone. We could see in other guests’ eyes we weren’t the only one annoyed.
The staff is kind and smiley, do their best to please you but it is obvious that there were given either zero or a very light training. Give these guys a proper high standard hotel training please!
The breakfast is even worse as you discover that the restaurant is in the middle of the shop, the place were people from outside are meeting, you feel like in kind of a lobby. Really not pleasant. 
When you pay ~300usd the night, you expect something at the level of the price, and for this part, we are far, very far from it.
To conclude the “what to improve”, cleaningness. 
The hotel is ok, but you have to leave the hotel space to go to the restaurant and let’s be clear, it is full of rubbish (paper, plastic,…). Quite disappointing for a high-range hotel in Sri-Lanka and one of the best in Ella.

Overall, experience is pleasant, but leaves a bittersweet taste for the price you pay vs the service you get.
title: A mix between wonderful and disappointing experience

roomTip: Not suitable for people with mobility issues as lots of steps to get to the restaurant.
text:
We had been recommended by friends to stay at 98 acres and they described it as a treetop hideaway. Things have changed since they were here. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and it became evident that the construction of a further 8 rooms was creating a lot of noise, and continued throughout Sunday too. We had booked a deluxe room and honestly it was far from deluxe. The bathroom was dirty and a lot of scum build up in the shower. The shower leaked and flooded the floor. The bathroom was very poorly laid out with the shower next to the window and only a dirty window sill to put shampoo and shower products on. The rooms were very poorly designed with no thought to finishing touches. I was expecting 5* and this was nowhere near that. 

The staff and food were excellent and it is undoubtedly a spectacular setting. The views from the restaurant and pool are stunning. However the rapid expansion and commercialisation of this area is so sad. The Ravana pool club pumped music out all day and late into the evening spoiling the peaceful tranquility of the place, as did the bus loads of visitors coming to visit the club and the zip line. The buses and tuk tuks were constantly up and down through the hotel as that’s the only access. Overall we were very disappointed with our stay. We had high expectations which 98 Acres didn’t live up to.
title: So disappointed.

We genuinely appreciate your feedback as it allows us to identify areas for enhancement. We understand your disappointment and frustration, and we would love the opportunity to regain your trust and provide you with the experience you initially hoped for.

Please feel free to reach out to us directly if you plan to visit again in the future. We would be delighted to ensure your stay is exceptional and memorable in every way possible.

Front Office Manager
placeInfo/address: Passara / Namunukula Road Greenland Estate, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
We had three nights here which was meant to be a tranquil setting. On arrival we were taken to our room (Premium deluxe) and told it was a 4 minute walk to the restaurant! Maybe that was running! It was in the furthest block from the central hotel area with great views. The room itself was lovely with a large balcony and it was really nice to lie and listen to the wildlife.

It rained a lot whilst we were there and the path back up the hill became very muddy and wet. Calling for a tuk tuk was one thing but we felt very unsafe in them. The road is full of holes and really not in the condition you would expect from a resort of this calibre. In fact we often had to get out so the driver could get up the hill! Walking up in the rain meant we got to the restaurant feeling very wet. Not great.

The restaurant was lovely and the food on offer was very good. Service was sometimes a bit slow and the staff were not always as attentive as they could be. The breakfast spread was very good.

Our biggest problem was the noise in our room. To book into an expensive boutique hotel we did not expect to have to put up with noisy children who ran round and round the room next door shouting and screaming. They insisted on playing loud music and turning theTV up too. One morning we were woken with Christmas songs. Really not what we expected. The sound proofing in the newer rooms is non existent and when the people above us decided to move the furniture around it was very loud indeed. We did mention it to the staff and had the 'we could move you" but the thought of moving all our belongings on a wet night in an dodgy tuk tuk did not appeal. There was no real concern from a manager and we were told the family were local. Not sure that should make a difference. In a hotel of this standard families should be put together and couples allowed to have the peace and quiet we paid for.

Sadly we didn't have the experience we had hoped for here.
title: Slightly disappointing but great views
