placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel au Sri Lanka. Le cadre est magnifique, les chambres confortables et très propres, et le personnel globalement chaleureux et attentionné. La restauration était également de très bonne qualité, avec un large choix. L'hôtel dispose d'une grande piscine sur le toit de l'hôtel et offre une vue panoramique.
Cependant, nous tenons à signaler une mésaventure avec l’un des voituriers, un homme parlant français, qui nous a amené à l'un de ses amis pour acheter des souvenirs de vacances en nous promettant payer un bon prix car nous étions clients de l'hôtel. Malheureusement, il a clairement profité de notre méconnaissance des prix locaux pour nous facturer un tarif excessif, ce que nous avons réalisé trop tard. Ce genre d’expérience peut gâcher un peu l’impression générale, surtout quand on pense pouvoir faire confiance au personnel.
Cela reste une très belle adresse que nous recommandons, mais nous conseillons aux futurs voyageurs de bien se renseigner à l’avance sur les prix.
title: Expérience globalement positive, avec un bémol

placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
roomTip: only recommended for business trips
text: First of all I would like to appreciate Mr. Dhinal Perera GM of the hotel who helped us a lot other wise one of us should sleep on sofa . Our package was a triple room but when we reached the hotel we found there is no triple room and we faced with a standard room with 28 SM that had no area for extra bed however as I mentioned by help of hotel GM we received extra bed . In second i do appreciate hotel staff who all were helpful and polite .in opposite of mentioned advantages i found serious problems which should be checked and removed otherwise the hotel can not meet 5 star hotel standards. actually the hotel is new built and still some construction activities signs can be seen different parts . It seems the hotel cooling system has major problem which returns to its design , the minimum temperature of our room  was only 26 centigrade in the day but nights it was better , I could not find exhaust fan in wash room which made me surprised  , i think exhaust fan is a must for ventilation that was missed , the windows was fixed and fresh air should be provided with HVAC system that as I mentioned above need redesign and doesn't work properly . The night that we entered the hotel I think it was full and it seems the hotel has not been mobilized for this condition , the first night that we went for dinner almost we found nothing to eat except some salad ,... there was 15 minutes remained to finish time of dinner but main foods did not charged and this made some problem which caused I meet Mr. Dhinal . as a conclusion I do believe Kandy Myst should totally re-checked for meeting 5 star hotels standards , its not recommended for families by no way and those who has planned for vacation , Kany Myst is okay for a business trip and for bedding i the nights , no more . I was going to miss there are GYM and swimming pool in top of the hotel that may help the conditions be a little better . near the hotel there are only second hand car shows and only one supermarket    .
title: 5 star hotel that is not 5 star in real

placeInfo/address: 273 Katugastota Road, Kandy 20800 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Ask for a room on the upper floors.
text:
This new hotel on the outskirts of Kandy seemed to be suffering from teething problems when we arrived. The receptionists took our passports and got our room mixed up with another guest which led to total confusion when checking out.
On the plus side, our room on the 14th floor had stunning views over the countryside, comfortable beds, good free wi-fi and powerful hot showers. 
The bar on the top floor also had excellent views and a DJ playing music till 23.00 - a great place to relax despite a very limited wine list (ie only 1 bottle of red wine available) though there was plenty of other drink options. The pool on the top floor was also very good.
We had the buffet dinner which had a large variety of dishes- however my wife had some chicken which hadn’t been cooked (the explanation from the restaurant staff that it was only 1piece was a bit ridiculous.) We did not eat there on our 2nd night! Having said that there was an extensive buffet breakfast with a chef making excellent omelettes to order.
The porters and cleaning staff were all very friendly and efficient.
Hopefully, this new hotel will get over its teething problems and become 1of the best hotels in Kandy - the potential is there but more care is needed.
title: New hotel on the outskirts of Kandy

text: Отдыхали в августе 2023 года, поскольку это не сезон для этой страны, то народу было мало и много номеров были не заняты. Поэтому были крайне удивлены когда при заселении менеджер , который привел нас в номер под видом того что он дал нам очень хороший номер, стал за это у нас деньги просить. Я предложила 10 usd, на что он сказал , что номер очень хороший (хотя мы такой и бронировали) и надо 20 usd. То есть с самого начало испортил нам отдых.  И так было везде. На территории один ресторан, где завтракаем и там же можно пообедать. есть еще ресторан на берегу, мы там ужинали, можно заказать конкретное блюдо. Номера большие , но много насекомых (муравьи, тараканы).  За пределы отеля лучше не выходить - на тебя набрасываются водители тук-туков , очень навязчивые, они бегут за тобой, чуть ли за руки не хватают. Попросили отвезти в супермаркет , так повезли в какой- то свой , с ужасным ассортиментом, хотя рядом был хороший супермаркет, куда я потом пешком дошла (минут 10), а они бежали за мной с криками - мадам, тук-тук!! Ездили на сафари. Обратились к sri_lanka_tours_with_manu (instagram), он же нас встречал и провожал. Понимает по русски, но говорит на Английском. Также ездили с ним на обзорную экскурсию.
title: Нет инфраструктуры вокруг отеля

roomTip: The hotel is well situated to use as a base if you want to visit the sites in sri lanka.  We took a overnight stay in Ella and travelled by rail to rhe tree plantations.
text:
The hotel is clean and tidy. The pool is nice and the grounds are pritty. The all inclusive is OK with limited cocktails and local drinks.  The food is buffet and is OK. Would compare the all inclusive experience to the ones I have experienced in Spain, its exceptable but not 5 stars.  You will never forget your room number as everytime you have a drink you need to give your room number and sign a receipt.
The big let down for us that there is no beach.  There are just boulders at the front if the hotel. This was very disappointing as all their advertisement showed a nice beach at the front. Another annoyance was at the fence facing the sea locals were stood pestering anyone who walked up to look out to the sea. At times i felt like i was in a zoo being looked at and it felt quite intrusive. Also the noise of the trains at the back could be disturbing as they ran through most of the night.
Overall the hotel tries hard but didnt meet my expectations.
title: Tries hard but has its faults

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid rooms near railway track.
text:
Booked this hotel because it looked amazing and was all inclusive.
We were given room 320 which was clean and comfortable albeit a bit tired, it had beautiful views overlooking the pool, gardens and sea.
We didn’t get much sleep as trains rumble pass at all hours and then there’s the bread delivery van which arrives at 6.30 playing a tune similar to the ice cream van we all know and love in the UK. We were eventually given another room and were able to get some sleep.
This hotel is not all inclusive, most things that we enjoy were chargeable. Travelled the world and never come across this before.
This hotel is advertised as a beach hotel, there isn’t one, where the beach was is now boulders, sandbags and rubbish. We brought this to the attention of the hotel as did many other people who were staying there.
On our last day a door appeared in a wall that said ‘to the beach’ but this beach is definitely not outside this hotel.
On a positive note the food is amazing and the staff work very hard to make your holiday the best.                                     
Wouldn’t return because of the problems that we had.
title: Not an all inclusive !

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Vor 20 Jahren war der Strand lang und breit! Jetzt frisst das Meer leider den ganze Strand weg. 
Riesig Steine sind am Strand damit das Hotel noch weiterbestehen kann!
Aber mir wurde gesagt dass sie bemüht sind etwas dafür zu unternehmen!! 
Was, ist einfach die Frage???
title: Das Hotel Royal Palms ist wirklich zum empfehlen! Aber der schöne Strand ist weg zum laufen und schwimmen zu gefährlich!

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pick a different area if you want a beach oriented holiday with bars and restaurants
text:
This was a hard hotel to rate as hotel itself deserved 4 stars but area made me mark it down to 3. 

Firstly the area, Kalutara for us is definitely not a tourist area. It is much more of a working town. Around the hotel there are very few bars, restaurants etc and since the problems even these are shut down so the hotel is the only place to have a holiday. If you want to just sit by a pool the hotel is fine for a visit but if you want to get out and about a bit also choose a different area. 

Hotels itself is a good standard hotel, a little dated but all clean and tidy. All the standard things you would expect in a hotel. No bath only a shower. 

Food on all inclusive was very good to be fair and we always found plenty too eat. Wine was restricted to 1 glass of wine with your meal and this was not best quality. 

Drinks were not the best and pretty restrictive on all inclusive. Only a few cocktails to choose from, spirits were all local and seemed pretty weak. 

Pools were big with plenty of beds around the grounds. Hotel is situated on the beach but do not expect the beach to be of a good standard, sand is golden with black sand in patches. There is a lot of debris on the beach so no chairs set on the beach. Waves were really but with some bad currents in the sea. Lots of hawkers about who were pretty persistent in trying to get some business. 

All staff were helpful and went out of their way to be helpful but English could be a bit of a problem with some. 

Hotel was empty when we visited only on average 30 people instead of the capacity of about 300. 

Weather was terrible when we visited so this may have tainted my time at the resort but I do hope that the tourists will return soon as there was only 30 in resort on average instead of a capacity of 300. The hotel and staff do deserve to have more visitors for the effort they put in.
title: Not a holiday resort

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel doesn’t send you reservation confirmation even you
insist them to do so. Because if you don’t have a confirmation you’ll have to face unpleasant situation when you check in and you’ll have to dance to their tune.
You’ll have to pay more or you’ll don’t get the credit card promotion facility. Therefore don’t go to this hotel without proper written confirmation .
Hotel is very good , rooms are clean , food is great , I would like to thank chef Chandana and his crew along with the restaurant staff to their tremendous job. Also like thank Upali @ bar lounge .
title: Unprofessional reservation and front office staff

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Rooms in the north wing are close to the busy railway line.
text:
This hotel sells itself as 5 star. This depends on the definition of 5 star.

The positive aspects.

Staff are unfailingly friendly, polite and helpful.

Rooms are adequate and comfortable  but not 5 star by any measure.

Public areas are pleasing but again, not 5 star.

Food is varied.

The negatives.

The public beach is coarse sand/fine gravel with a steep slope to the shore. The beach is untended and heavily polluted with plastics. The sea is very choppy and not suitable for very young or weak swimmers.

The pool bar is very basic.

We booked an all-inclusive package and were shocked to learn that wine with meals is restricted to a single glass per person. The wine quality is quite poor.

As paying adults, we can decide for ourselves if one glass is adequate. Beer doesn’t seem to be limited in quantity so why is wine different? We aren’t talking about high quality, bottled vintages! 

Is this 5 star service? Not in our experience.

Overall, if the hotel is viewed as 3 star with limitations,guests won’t be let down. If you expect 5 star facilities, you will be disappointed.
title: Mixed opinions

text: I had a brief stay here as part of a longer stay in Sri Lanka and Thailand. Mercury holidays advertise this hotel as 5 star but although the facilities here probably give it this rating the hotel itself is in my opinion not 5 star. The rooms and we looked at two were well past there best requiring some decoration and both an element of repair. The hotel is 23 years old and whilst it is imposing from the entrance and within the lobby the rest of the hotel seems to lack ongoing maintenance. The food was well presented but the Asian selection had too much chilli added and I am half Sri Lankan though I live in Europe. We joined a group already staying here and they all agreed about the food. The deserts and soup choices were good but I wouldn’t have liked to stay longer than a couple of days. It is good to have the train close by but it creates naturally a great deal of noise and some parts of the hotel vibrate as they pass. The staff are friendly but there is also a culture of tipping to keep the best sun beds which created problems. The staff should clearly not accept this as it is not a gratuity. I use the word tipping to be kind! All in all if you want lots of hotel facilities and not too bothered about food then you might find this hotel acceptable but to many of the guests I met we all agreed that by no stretch of the imagination is this a 5 star hotel. It is just ok!
title: Definitely not 5 star

text: Having stayed in many hotels in Sri lanka  this one whilst adequate was dated and the food was much too spicy compared with the others though the starters were good as was the soup and the deserts were delicious. The main courses however were somewhat repetitive and just too hot. On a health and safety issue there were no rubber mats in the bath - an accident waiting to happen. There were not enough parasols to complement the sun loungers and not enough shade anywhere to compensate for this which led to clients bribing the staff to secure them - this is not acceptable for a hotel with this rating. However, the staff were charming at all times though why they cannot serve sugar free soft drinks without paying a premium is beyond me.
title: Not a 5 star hotel as advertised by Mercury travel but adeqaute

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed one night at Royal Palms Beach Hotel on 08/Sep/2018 with office staff and family. Following is my review.

Reception - 5/10 - Reception was not so prompt, but somewhat okay. Baggages were handled properly. The welcome drink was a cordial instead of something fresh (did not expect this from a 5 star hotel, especially when it was a corporate booking for almost 30 people).

Room, bathroom, amenities & bedding - 8/10 - Spacious room, comfy bedding, clean washroom & needed amenities were there.

Pool - 6/10 - Very nice and humongous pool and it's spread across a vast area. The drawback is that the hotel management allows you to get in to the pool ONLY till 6:00pm..!!! This is totally UNACCEPTABLE as the guests are NOT staying in the hotel for FREE..!!! Guests should at least be allowed to have a swim till 8:00pm (as most other hotels do).

Food and dining - 7/10 - Food in the main restaurant was very tasty and there was a quite a lot of variety to be selected from. But the a-la-carte menu at the seafood restaurant was of no value for money. Many of us agreed that the food was not tasty.

Staff, service and friendliness - 6/10 - Some staff members were extremely helpful and friendly while some others were sort of minding their own business.

Overall rating - 6/10 - The expected level of a 5 star hotel is not met in my opinion. The management needs to pay more attention to the operation as a whole.
title: Nice hotel, but needs more attention..

When you sent a message via KIPSU, we were immediately made aware of the situation, and we regret that you did not feel comfortable reaching out earlier. I can assure you that we take these matters seriously, and upon your request, we promptly arranged for a room change.

We apologize for the lack of communication and the inconvenience this caused. It is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide, and we will be reviewing our processes to ensure that any issues with room conditions are addressed promptly and efficiently in the future.

On a positive note, we’re happy to hear that you had a good experience at our main restaurant. We value your feedback and will continue working to improve all aspects of your experience with us.

Once again, we apologize for the discomfort and disruption you faced during your stay. We truly hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back and provide you with the exceptional service and comfort you expect from Hilton.

Best regards

Karim Schadlou
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
We were provided with three bedrooms, but none of the air conditioning units were working. The rooms were extremely hot, making it difficult for us to sleep. We informed the staff about the issue at around 7 AM, and they checked the units and said it would take four hours to fix them. 

Since the rooms were so uncomfortable, we decided to leave and returned after 1 PM, only to find that the air conditioning still wasn't repaired. They asked for an additional two hours to fix it, without offering any apologies, and expected us to stay in the hot rooms. 

We had to repeatedly request to be moved to another room, as we couldn't bear to stay in those conditions any longer. We had already spent one night without air conditioning. Overall, the service was disappointing and not up to the standard we had experienced before. The only positive was that the main restaurant provided good service.
title: The guest experience needs improvement.

Dear Mr. Charles,

Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback following your recent stay at Hilton Colombo Residences. We value all guest comments as they help us continually improve our services and facilities.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay. We take your feedback very seriously and would like to address the concerns you have raised:

Room and Suite Conditions: We understand your concerns regarding the condition of our rooms and suites, we will work on that an elevator modernization project is on the way that will feature faster service.  This upgrade is aimed at to enhance the overall guest experience and bringing our facility up to modern standards.

Housekeeping Services: We regret to hear about the issues with housekeeping services. While our laundry services are outsourced, we strive to ensure that clean towels and prompt cleaning services are provided. We have reinforced with our team the importance of timely and efficient housekeeping. We encourage guests to communicate their needs to us, especially when a "Do Not Disturb" sign is used, which may delay service.

Staff Training and Workload: Our team consists of well-trained staff and trainees completing their internships. We maintain a balance to ensure high-quality service while providing training opportunities for the future workforce in the hospitality industry. We assure you that we adhere to fair work practices and schedules to prevent staff fatigue.

Service and Breakfast Buffet: We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast buffet and found our staff friendly. We continuously train our team to enhance their skills and ensure they provide the best possible service to our guests.

We appreciate your constructive feedback and are committed to taking the necessary steps to improve. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, providing you with a more enjoyable and cost-effective stay.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback.

Best regards,

Karim Schadlou
General Manager
placeInfo/address: 200 Union Place, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just returned from Hilton Colombo residences after spending 2 weeks in Colombo. Whilst I agree with the plethora of good reviews to some extent, one has to outline the negatives of this Hotel as well.

In terms of the room/suite rates they are certainly not cheap or reasonable for the level of accommodation you pay for.  The building as a whole remains the same as it was in it's inception in the 1990's. 

Having visited star class hotels globally, some in underdeveloped countries, this particular establishment is light years behind its competitors within the hospitality industry,  Not much internal work or improvement has been done as a whole to the property. If was to summarise the  internal features of this hotel it is like going back in time to the 1990's. The parquet flooring we remember when we were kids, the outdated elevator systems , the wooden furniture that we do not see if modern hotels etc.

The walls need some TLC to say the least as they probably haven't seen a paint brush for many years.  Please note our apartment had some damp/mold on the bedroom walls. The housekeeping department have issues with providing clean towels regularly, from what the cleaning staff have mentioned, I understand that the laundry is outsourced to an external service provider. The apartment was not cleaned until after 3 PM on most days and required some prompting. I believe this is due to staff shortages.

The service is slow the entire operation is run by trainees or apprentices all working 12-14 hour days with 4/5 shifts being worked consecutively . Most of them have mentioned how tired they are and the shortage /high turn over of staff within the hotel.

Everything about this hotel is dated and I am astounded how it has received so many good reviews. 

The only positive is the breakfast buffet I suppose and the friendliness' of the staff even though they don't have the necessary skills or the training to competently perform their duties.

General Manager and senior management team please take note of my comments above and hope you are proactive in your approach, in taking some remedial action to make the guest experience more fulfilling and cost effective.
title: Hilton Colombo Residences 3 Star Service and Facilities at 5 star Prices

roomTip: Check on restaurant opening and private party restaurant closures.
text:
I am currently staying at this establishment, we have paid for a 3 bed apartment with kitchen, to be fair the word kitchen has to loosely used, the kitchen has all of the appliances in place but the kitchen draws are virtually empty and we have one frying pan and that is it.
This is clearly set up this way to ensure you use the restaurant which does prepare great food.
Tonight we return back to the apartment, get a shower and head downstairs for a drink at the bar and intended to head for the restaurant.
When we arrived at the we were greater by very loud music which we quickly realised was comming from the adjacent restaurant which also appeared to be covered in balloons.
We stood up to go to the restaurant and the very nice bar manager told us that the restaurant was closed for a private function. Now I want to confirm at this point that we had no prior information confirming this closure.
We accepted the situation reluctantly and headed off back to our apartment to order room service.
At 20.39 the order was in, we sat then for close to 90 minutes for delivery !
Eventually I picked up the phone to ask where the food was, at this point I was told that due to demand forced upon room service because of the restaurant being closed for a private function they were struggling to meet the customer requirements however the gentle said "your food will be with you in one minute".
10 minutes later the food arrived, we order food for 4 people and we had 3 delivered and my daughters food wasn't there.
Moreover all if the food delivered was stone cold.
By now it was late and frankly it was becoming a little bit of a joke.
The waiter took the cash for the food and retreated cautiously, also kept the change, not that I mind that but I thought tips were based on service and performance !
Now this is an establishment with 30 floors and on average 10 apartments per floor, and the management clearly find it easy to negate the needs of the allready checked in customers in favour of a one off private party.
This really disappoints us, firstly the kitchen and lack of equipment to use the apartment in full and then this ridicules situation that we have found our selves in this evening.
One word sums the situation up "DISCUSTING".
We are here on a British Airways prepacked holiday, I will be taking the situation up with both the local Hilton management, international management and British Airways.

If you do visit remember your needs and wants while here on holiday are clearly not at the forefront of the establishments thoughts !
title: Disappointing aproach to customer satisfaction

text:
During our last family trip to Sri Lanka in March 2020, just before the COVID-19 crisis erupted, we stayed in both the Hiltons at Colombo.  In fact, we had the higher expectation from the Hilton Residences over the other Hilton near the Dutch Hospital.  Our personal experience turned out to be otherwise.  I must concede here that we were not long-stay guests though, which is what Residences are supposedly designed for.  Originally we were due to stay here for 2 nights, but as the COVID-19 restrictions started to appear and our return flight got preponed, we ended up staying for a little more than 36 hours.

The booking was made via Honors points + money option for a standard 2 bedroom suite.  As an Honors Gold member, on contacting before travel we were pre-upgraded to a 3 bedroom premium suite on the 30th floor.  I had requested for 2 separate single beds for our twin boys, which seemed to be only available in their 3 bedroom configuration.  I was also told about a kids pool and a play area on the 3rd floor, although when checking in no such play area seemed to exist (more on that check-in later).  We were also sort-of confirmed of an early 9 AM check-in, as we were arriving Colombo from Kandy via an early morning train.  All of this till now sounds wonderful.

Our experience started to radically alter from the moment we arrived at the hotel entrance as in the following.
1.  There appeared to be a single attendant to shift our luggage during arrival.  We waited for a bit and this person was not to be seen.  Eventually, we got off the suitcases ourselves and let the cab go.
2. Although the lady who checked us in was pleasant (won’t take names) she was not very efficient and gave a bunch of wrong information.  First of all, she gave us incorrect breakfast timings. She also gave us the impression that we could have breakfast on the day of our check-in.  Now, this is not at all odd in this part of the world and is frequently extended to elites who check-in early.  So when we arrived for this breakfast at Flow, it was already over (as she gave us wrong timings) while on top of that our host wanted to charge all of us for the full breakfast (that was technically over!).  At the end, when we got up to leave, some staff (along with the check-in lady) sorted the issue out.  We found the staff at Flow to be not at all ready to handle regular long time Hilton guests.  On the second day when we requested to carry a few pastries to our room (for our kids) they made a huge fuss and sort of enlightened us on how they have a rule against it in their hotel.  Well, everyone has these rules, and still there is something that goes by the name guest service.  Here, the duty manager of that day had to step in.   The experience here was in such a contrast to the other Hilton in the city where F&B was clearly the highlight.
3. The hotel had, perhaps, the slowest set of elevators for a 30+ floor building anywhere in this planet.  On top of that only three of them are available any time, as the fourth one was a service elevator.  There was no air-conditioning at the common areas of the apartment floors.  I mean all this in a top rated hotel in Asia?
4.  Each time, it took us almost 7-8 minutes to “climb” up/down our apartment from/to ground level.  Now imagine after our check-in when we finally made it to our floor our check-in lady declared that she didn’t get the right key.  We easily waited for another 15 minutes to finally get inside our apartment.
5.  Our 3-bedroom apartment on the 30th floor was spacious and well-furnished for sure.  Our welcome amenities included a bottle of Chilean red wine (decent for a welcome wine), couple of dessert plates (apparently for our twin boys) which was a nice touch.  The balcony access was locked.  The bathroom and the living areas appeared somewhat renovated.  However, the apartment was quite old school and nowhere close to the upper-upscale standard.  There was no central air-conditioning (AC) and while the four split units were functional but they failed to be comfortable. The spacious kitchen, on the other hand, was beyond the reach of these ACs.  There was a washer-dryer unit inside a utility area that was out in the open.  The views from the windows all round our apartment was quite stunning though: the ocean was at a distance, while Colombo’s newest constructions were right in front and even a cricket stadium was visible.
6.  The room service was non-existent.  On the first day we asked for a turn down service in the evening that took forever, while on the second day no one serviced our room!  Yeah that’s right.

In summary, this Residences may work out for long-stay guests, especially with so many grocery shopping options around and who may not care much about their service standards.  But I wondered  why they have labelled it Hilton Residences (yeah, I know: due to the brand recall value in this part!), because in our experience even a Homewood Suites tag may be too much for their staff to handle.
title: A surprisingly average experience

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
My family and I enjoyed a memorable holiday at Jetwing Blue Hotel over Christmas, and we enjoyed many aspects of our stay. The food was absolutely fantastic, room service was prompt and pleasant, and the massage services were incredibly soothing. The pool and beach made for perfect relaxation spots, accentuated by a range of 5-star amenities. 

However, our check-in experience left a lot to be desired. Despite having made reservations in May 2024, and my father even came the week before to confirm the reservation, the reception staff struggled to find our booking even when we showed them our printed confirmation. The staff member left twice to check the reservation, eventually returning with the weak excuse that two confirmation numbers in their email had been misread.

Although our rooms met basic expectations, they were located far from the main lobby and dining area. Since we were a group of five and had booked two rooms, it would have been more appropriate and considerate for the hotel to allocate us to bigger rooms, preferably on one of the top floors as they have in the past. On top of that, room service staff even mentioned that we should have been placed in larger rooms.

Disappointingly, this was not the first time we faced this issue. We had a similar check-in experience during our stay at Jetwing Beach Hotel as well, where our time was wasted by the reception staff due to apparent disorganization and inadequate training of new employees. Given that they serve as the initial point of contact for guests, it's crucial that reception staff are well-trained by upper management.

While everything beyond the reception experience was delightful and up to our expectations, the initial check-in process needs significant improvement. Hopefully, our next check-in experience will be smoother, or we might have to consider staying elsewhere in the future. Nonetheless, Jetwing Blue remains a favorite, and we hope to see improvements for an even more enjoyable experience.
title: Good Stay But Improvements Needed at Check-In

roomTip: Check quality of room
text: The setting of this hotel is beautiful, the staff friendly and attentive. Unfortunately our room was awful - 114. It desperately needs a complete refurb - the room was very tired indeed. Tatty blinds, doors to patio didn’t open properly, some electric sockets didn’t work  which made charging items difficult. There was no subtle bedside  lighting - just huge ceiling lights over the bed. The bathroom smelled damp when we arrived although better after the door was left open for a while. The bathroom wasn’t dirty but unfortunately looked it - poor quality sealant around shower and bath and what looked like dark mould in places. We were very disappointed but so tired as late  when we arrived that we didn’t do anything about it. It was the end of our brilliant stay in Sri Lanka and we were hoping for a relaxing couple of days. Unfortunately the room spoiled it.

Dear Guest,
 
Thank you very much for taking your time to share your review on TripAdvisor following your stay at Jetwing Blue.
We are pleased to know that your overall stay has been a pleasant and comfortable one. However, we are also aware that there were a few shortcomings as well, and we humbly apologize for all the inconveniences you had to face. We greatly appreciate your highlighting the areas which need serious attention. Your comments have been taken seriously and positively, and will be shared amongst the relevant personnel for improvement.
Your kind words on the friendly and courteous service rendered by our team of associates have been shared amongst them as compliments such as yours are highly motivational in ensuring that authentic Sri Lankan hospitality is delivered above and beyond expectations. 
We thank you once again and we look forward to the pleasure of welcoming you back to Jetwing Blue in the future.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra de Silva
Hotel Manager
Jetwing Blue and Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is relatively basic but attractive with nice pool area. We stayed in family room which was huge and comfortable enough. One concern we did have though was that the balcony railings were not sufficient to stop a toddler crawling underneath. When you are in a family room with young children the last thing you need to worry about is the safety of children on a balcony. 

Pool area is very beautiful and great size however when we was there a roof tile fell off and landed in the pool not far from where kids were playing. It left a lot of stunned looking people in shock. The pool guy just fished it out with a net like it was a fairly regular occurrence.

Negombo beach is a working beach and not the most pleasant place to enjoy. We did find it annoying that hawkers are allowed to constantly pester you when sitting by the pool and the staff make no effort to discourage this. I appreciate these people are only trying to earn a living but we live in SL and as westerners do get fed up with the attention in daily life  so when we stay at a hotel it’s nice to enjoy peace and quiet.

Food is very average in quality and there is almost no variety. This May unfortunately be more as a result of the situation in SL though.

To summarise it’s a nice hotel for sun worshippers and comfortable enough if the price is reasonable. Staff were very friendly and accommodating.
title: Beach hotel Negombo

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your review. We are so sorry about the noise in the surrounding area. Hope to see you again, and we will make sure you enjoy your stay.

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text:
Good location for entry into Wilpattu
Shipping container accommodation well insulated against heat and air conditioning worked well but was very cramped. 
Staff good and owner very helpful. 
Breakfast start time of 0730 too late considering Wilpattu entry is 0615. Packed breakfast and lunch provided but poor quality and quantity. Unripe bananas, soggy sandwiches, no cutlery. Provided in a basket. Should be in insulated containers given the heat.
title: Let down by food

ownerResponse/text: Thank you very much for your review . we are sad that you did not enjoyed the food and the park. hope you will come again.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
text: We spent one night at this establishment near Wilpattu since we insisted on staying in a place that had hot running water.  It was a relatively late substitute for another lodge that didn't.  It is close to the southern gate of Wilpattu National Park, and definitely sitting "in the bush."  We didn't arrive until after dark, and it was hard to find off the main road.  For rooms, the lodge has erected elevated concrete block foundations and placed modified 20-foot shipping containers on top of them with stairs and a small deck for access. One side of the shipping container has been replaced with a partial glass wall/sliding doors, and the inside fitted out as a modest hotel room.  There was a double bed, two night tables, one luggage rack, another place for luggage in the "cabinet" with hangers, coffee/tea maker, two bottles of water, AC and a fan. There were two large towels, two wash cloths, and one bath mat in the small bathroom. There was no blow dryer.  Water in the shower was lukewarm, not hot, but at least not cold.   Wifi was available only in the dining/lounge area.  We arrived late at 7:45 pm after a long and unproductive "safari" in Wilpattu.  Dinner was underwhelming: some bread, fish curry, dhal, water, and ice cream with a small banana.  Breakfast was bad coffee, papaya juice, scrambled egg, some sort of sausage, barely toasted bread with butter and a grilled tomato.  Service was pleasant.  It provides the basics, but we would not likely  stay here again, nor would we go to Wilpattu.
title: 2.5 to 3-star small rooms, accommodations in modified shipping containers.

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for reviewing us on TripAdvisor. We are sad that you have not enjoyed your stay. The Backwaters is a forest lodge built to blend with nature. Our available amenities are clearly mentioned in all booking sites, So the guests will have a clear understanding of the facilities available. Room doors have  locks. We are sorry that you have not been able identify this. Your personal belongings are very safe in the rooms. We have never had any  complaints from Guests. Wilpattu is the largest wildlife park in Sri Lanka and very popular for leopard and Sloth bear. 
Thank you for identifying certain mistakes for us to improve upon. Hope to see you again.
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Wilpattu National Park ,, Eluwankulam 19979 Sri Lanka
roomTip: A new place that deserves a chance
text: One of the three owners was there and was gracious, his company sincere and his presence kind.  There was nothing else for which I would return.  In fact, other personalities came across as people it is best to avoid.  Without a/c the place is unlivable.  It needs a bit of professionalizing.  My debit card was not accepted and created quite a mess at the time of checkout.  The waiter served me lime juice while munching a piece of meat in his mouth. The room doors cannot be secured and there is no safety lock either.  Valuables could be lost.  Horseflies made wounds in my skin from which, it took a week to recover.  The safari in the park worth if you are forest lover. You will not see animals.
title: One of the three ownesr: He was gracious, sincere and kind

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons séjourné 2 nuits dans cet hôtel. L'intérêt de cet hôtel réside dans la vue sur le rocher du lion depuis la piscine, et sa proximité de sigiriya. 
La piscine est profonde 2,40m, agréable pour les nageurs et il y a un bassin enfants. La nourriture est bonne mais le service est mauvais, tables sales, coussins sales, pas de tables propres disponibles... 
C'est un hôtel de groupe donc attendez vous à du bruit et a passer après les groupes (qui ont des emplacements réservés). 
Les chambres sont très très vieillissantes et peu spacieuses. Nous étions 2 adultes et un enfant dans la chambre, nous ne pouvions pas ouvrir ni la fenêtre ni le mini bar qui étaient obstrués par le lit ajouté. 
Les singes se baladant dans l'hôtel ajoutent un peu d'intérêt.
title: Hôtel qui mérite d'être rénové rapidement

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Very (at times overly) friendly man running the hotel. When we arrived in our ground floor room, there was a very strong sewage smell. Hotel maintenance tried rectifying but smell remained throughout the 1 night stay. Suspect the smell is typical for the ground floor rooms. Ask for a room on first floor to avoid this, 

We went out with a private driver at 05.30am to climb Lion rock. The property gate was however still closed and we had to climb the fence to get out. Apparently part of the gate was left slightly open, but only learned this when coming back. Nobody answered calls and knocks on the door where the person was still sleeping. Better communication the night before would have prevented this. 

Breakfast was good and besides the smell, the hotel is actually good as well.
title: Bad smell in the room - would not come back.

roomTip: Sri Lanka has so much to offer for a holiday. We are 75 and with a driver and preplanne holiday it was such a safe and enjoyable holiday. Excellent value too.
text:
We spent 2 weeks in Sri Lanka and had a superb trip with so many excellent experiences and such great service.
The only hiccup was hotel sigiriya were we got a grumpy waiter, numerous dishes on the menu  not available and to top it off the costs quoted on the food and beverage menu didn't include an extra 30% taxes ( they were in the fine print).
Watch out, this was the only place we stayed at that did this and it was somewhat sad that this experience was the only downside to such a memorable trip.
We highly recommend Sri Lanka as a holiday destination and would like to emphasise this was a one off for the entire trip.
Heaps of praise for travel local and best of Lanka they were fantastic.
title: Sri Lanka hotel Sigiriya

Hotel Sigiriya
placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a good hotel but it is let down by the restaurant service. Whilst the food is good, the service in the restaurant is bad. If you don’t arrive soon after opening, you find that tables that have already been used have not been cleared and reset. It is rare that someone clears your empty plates away between courses, leaving them to stack up around you. It’s not nice to dine surrounded by tables covered in other people’s dirty plates. Empty dishes on the buffet are not refreshed so that your own choice is reduced. And trying to get someone to take a drinks order is hit and miss at best. 
Other staff in the hotel (poolside, reception, housekeeping) are friendly and helpful, but the restaurant waiting staff are not great. It would perhaps help if there was more of them. 
It’s a shame because the hotel itself is nice, with a lovely view of Lions Rock from the pool, and our rooms were a good size and clean. But although there are cafes within a few minutes walk which can be used for lunch, the dark road outside means that you will likely want to stay in the hotel for dinner in the evening and unfortunately that’s not a great experience.
title: Good hotel but with poor restaurant service

placeInfo/address: Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: The gardens are lush and there is a great view of the Lion’s rock from the swimming pool! Rooms are average. I did a spa experience here (1 hour massage and 1 hour facial) which was lovely. The breakfast buffet is varied but the ‘hot’ food is not hot. The restaurant is somewhat pricey and the tax added on makes the price similar to Australia. A tuna baguette with a few fries is 1800 LKR but with tax/VAT comes to over 2300 LKR. Tax seems to be added on for everything at this hotel. Some prices are in LKR (food, bar) some are in American dollars (spa). No information given at check in and there is no information in the room. However, if you do ask staff, they are accommodating.  The hotel is a short walk to the village of Sigiriya.
title: Sigiriya Hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for choosing to stay at Kithala Resort and for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed our scenic location amidst the paddy fields and appreciated the peaceful surroundings and open-air swimming pool. We’re also pleased that you found our rooms clean and well maintained.
However, we’re truly sorry to hear that certain aspects of your stay did not meet expectations. We sincerely apologize for the mix up with the breakfast parcels, especially regarding the vegetarian request. This is not in line with our service standards, and we understand how disappointing and inconvenient this must have been for your group. 
We also regret to hear that the bathroom space felt cramped and that our dining options, particularly for children, were limited during your stay. Your comments have been noted, and we are currently reviewing our facilities and menus to better accommodate a wider range of guest preferences.
Regarding the insect presence, being located so close to natural surroundings does present challenges, but we are working on enhanced pest management solutions to ensure a more comfortable outdoor experience for our guests.
Your feedback is incredibly valuable to us and helps us identify areas for improvement. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with a more enjoyable and seamless experience

Thank You
Best Regards
Udayangani Peiris
Senior Guest Service Agent
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Kithala Resort, located about 25 km from Yala National Park, mainly for its convenient access to early morning safaris. The property is surrounded by scenic paddy fields and has an inviting open-air swimming pool with views of lush greenery, which was quite relaxing.

However, the overall experience was underwhelming. While the room was clean and decently maintained, the bathroom was noticeably cramped and could use an upgrade.Food quality at the resort left much to be desired, with limited options overall and nothing catering specifically to children.

One of the biggest disappointments was the breakfast arrangement for the safari. We were provided with a packed meal for our 5 a.m. safari, but despite requesting separate vegetarian and separate non veg options , chicken steaks were included in the vegetarian parcel. This made the food unusable for our group and was quite frustrating.

Additionally, the insect presence around the property was excessive, which made spending time outdoors less enjoyable.

While the resort has potential thanks to its natural surroundings and proximity to Yala, it falls short in service quality and attention to detail. With some improvements in food service, hygiene, and guest needs, it could offer a much better experience.
title: Living our Tarzan moments at yala national park 🏞

text:
We were a group of 4 and booked the deluxe double rooms. We checked in at night after an entire day of sightseeing. The staff checked us in but gave us shabby deluxe triple rooms at the far end of the resort, without any prior intimation. We spent an hour discussing with the staff and agent and only much later the staff apologised and we were given deluxe double rooms, facing the pool and field ahead. 

The night didn't end here - while changing rooms, their room key broke inside the door! And there was further delay.

With a 5.30 am safari meetup time, we barely had any sleep and had opted for the packed vegetarian breakfast as we were vegetarians. However, 2 out of 4 boxes had eggs and chicken sausages! 

The kettle plug also kept sparking and we required a change. While the upkeep can be improved, what really requires work is hospitality.
title: Feedback

text:
Reservation 
Quick and smooth. Very customer friendly service.   

Check-in
Quick and Fast. Luggage service was little bit slow.

Location and surrounding
Easy to find road side and convenient place between Yala, southern express way and Katharagama. 
Located in front of a paddy field, so you don’t feel congested.
Well-kept garden and general areas though cats are there in restaurant.

Rooms
Very VERY small. Only suitable for single person and you can clearly hear the neighbors. 
Poor AC function and limited pillow menu.
Bathroom is very small and if you are over 100kg you would not fit. Only a rain shower difficult to have a body wash. 
Limited Bathroom amnesties. 
Only 6 TV channels available.

Pool and other
Nice pool with good quality of maintain, yet no pool boy or life guard. 

Restaurant and Bar 
No train staff at all. Poor knowledge in Beverages and skill
Very limited selection of food (which can be excused with the situation of the Country) with poor execution. Apart from adding slat and chees or souses could not even make a simple dish.
title: GOOD but not that Good!

text: The location is beautiful. Lush and serene. Rooms are clean and nice. Food was normal. no wow factor except mutton cutlet and hoppers which was great. Restaurant staff and F & B Manager was very polite and hospitable. Madawa was a great host as he interacted with guest and ensured they were making memories. Reception staff was up to expected standard. However, there is no flexibility for any adhocs. We wanted some water glasses and had to ask thrice. We asked given hotel was almost full with locals if a nice 2pc calypso band or some music could be played to add light to the evening and they refused. Housekeeping staff was very prompt when complained of a water issue in bathroom. I think overall they are good but given their rating... need to improve on making guest feel special. Food definitely need to improve.the night reception staff went an extra mile to make sure the breakfast pack for Sunday 12th at 4.30am was ready. He went to the kitchen ans help pack. Could not get his name but check the roster and thank him please. He is an asset.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
 
Thank you very much for your detailed narrative on the experience at Kithala Resort. We really appreciate you taking the time to put your experience to words which helps us assure a better service in future.
We have noted your comments and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused at the check-in. We gently remind you that we did not “assure” you of a possible check-in at 12.00 pm but instead promised that “we would try our level best to arrange the check-in before 2.00 pm.” The hotel being highly occupied on the previous evening the rooms were not ready for check-in at the time of your arrival . However, we were able to offer the double room at 12.30 pm and the triple room at 1.15 pm.
 
The rooms being available for booking online does not mean that the rooms are clean and ready for check-in at that moment itself. Our efforts to explain the situation to you was misunderstood as being rude. 
 
We would like to emphasize that for us at Theme Resorts, guests are our first priority, and we would not have kept you waiting if there was a possibility of giving the rooms earlier. 
 
We thank you for your understanding.
 
Regards,
The Management- Theme Resorts & Spas.
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Very disappointed check-in

I used to stay at Mandara Rosen and wanted to try somehow different. When I was browsing on the internet for a place to stay in Tissa, I came across this hotel. Upon reviewing the comments, I noticed one comment about an early check-in not being given even when rooms were available. Therefore I called the hotel and inquired if I will be able to check in around 12noon if rooms are available. I was assured this was possible.

Therefore I pre-booked 01 triple and a double through the hotel website and made the full payment online. There is a place on the booking form where they inquire on the time of arrival to which I replied as 12.00noon.

Arrived at the hotel at 12.07pm. This was on a Thursday and the hotel was empty. No welcome drink was provided till 30 minutes later and that too upon inquiry. The front office Manager Madawa was very rude and simply said the check-in time was 2.00pm and for us to have lunch first. As we were after a five hour drive, we wanted to check-in and freshen up before lunch. Therefore I requested that we check-in first and as the hotel was empty, why was this not possible? Then I was told all the double rooms were booked and only family rooms and triples were available and this was the last double. Then I checked their web site and it showed 21 doubles were available (this was only on the room hunt offer so there would have been more outside). When I pointed this out to the Manager, he changed his story and said these are the only double and triple available next to each other. I was a bit puzzled as a triple is no different to a double apart from an extra bed in most hotels. The Manager was pushing us to have lunch instead with no courtesy whatsoever. Finally I said we will forego lunch and wait for the rooms to be ready. Finally the rooms were ready around 1.15pm. 

Upon entering, both the double and the triple was identical apart from the extra bed. Having 21 rooms available, why they could not allocate two rooms and allowed us to check-in around 12.30pm is a mystery

The food was a basic spread but tasty. The Chef Gayan and the restaurant Supervisor Segar on the other hand was a complete contrast to the front office manager. They were very friendly and helpful which made our stay somewhat pleasant.i gave three stars considering the service of the restaurant as if not, the rating would have been a lot lower.
title: Terrible front office

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Recommended for travelers looking forward to go safari in Yala National Park. The hotel prepared breakfast packs by 05:00 A.M. It was good. Lunch was good. Dinner was average no action menu very small buffet food is delicious. Service was great. Friendly staff. The rooms are clean beautifull with a good view of the paddy fields. But the room is compact bathroom is a little bit smelly. 
Pool's water is not the cleanest but not bad. The hotel it self is old. Over all  good value for the price. When it's compared with their company's other hotels (Malu Malu & Aliya Resort) the Kithala Hotel is unacceptable.

text:
I had a bit high expectation since the hotel belongs to Theme Resort Group which I had a great experience in their Aliya Resort Sigiriya. However it was other way around. Except the restuarant staff & their service, all other departments & services to be drastically improved. I feel the front desk staff should be undergone a training for PR & customer service. ownerResponse/text:
Guests have hundreds of choices of places to stay in Negombo.

Thank you for choosing Waterland and for taking the time to share your experiences and observations.

Guest reviews help other travelers make informed choices about where to stay.

You are indeed correct that most guests who stay at Waterland are at the beginning or end of your trip.  

Your review states that “it claims to be on an estuary”.  We reviewed our literature and marketing materials and found no mention of being on an estuary.  Please let us know if that description of being on an estuary was in some marketing material. We also did a Google search and similarly found nothing that suggested that Waterland is on an estuary.  If a travel agent suggested that Waterland is on an estuary, please let us know the name of the travel agency so that we can correct the travel agent and thereby prevent any other guests from being similarly disappointed about the location.

We can well understand your disappointment about the location if you were expecting to be on an estuary as Waterland is not on an estuary.  

Waterland is on the meeting point of a river and a canal and is 700 meters from the ocean. 

Thanks for noting that guests should take with the steps across the pool in the living room of the Monsoon Villa.  The Monsoon Villa is the only villa in which the outdoor plunge pool carries on into the interior spaces of the villa.  The steps across the pool to one of the bedrooms provide the living room with an added touch of romance.  The design was inspired by a villa we stayed at some years ago in Seminyak.  Your advice for guests to take care when crossing the steps is excellent.

We are sorry that there was such a delay in the lunch order, that the lunch order was incorrect, and that you were disappointed by the service.  Meals are cooked to order.  That said, waiting for an hour for lunch is long.  We can well understand your annoyance at having to wait so long, especially if the food provided differs from what you had ordered.

We hope that you had a wonderful trip to Sri Lanka and that you have fond memories of the island despite the several disappointments you experienced at Waterland.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Triple-check and double-confirm that food order!
text: We stayed here because we were flying out the next morning (which I think is true for a lot of people). It claims to be located on an estuary -- which might be true if you count the urban canal with concrete embankments. The family room we shared was large, but beware of the swimming pool steps, inside the room, that are easy to trip on. We ordered lunch, waited an hour, and then they had gotten the order wrong so we waited some more.  I mean, anyone can make a mistake, but the staff is so-so at best.
title: Meh.

ownerResponse/text:
Vielen Dank, dass Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben, so ausführlich und nachdenklich über Ihre Erfahrungen zu schreiben.

Wir freuen uns, dass Ihnen die Villen, die Lage und das Design gefallen haben. Waterland wurde tatsächlich mit Liebe gebaut und wird mit Liebe betrieben.

Waterland hat enorme Anstrengungen unternommen, um talentierte und engagierte Mitarbeiter zu rekrutieren und zu halten. Unser Küchenpersonal, das Reinigungspersonal und das Managementpersonal sind alle seit vielen Jahren bei Waterland.

Leider haben einige unserer Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption kürzlich das Unternehmen verlassen, um im Ausland Karriere zu machen.

Selbst bei hohen Gehältern, guten Arbeitszeiten, großzügigen Sozialleistungen und guten Personalunterkünften war es unglaublich schwierig, erfahrenes Personal an der Rezeption zu finden. Dies ist nicht nur ein Problem für Waterland. Ein großer Teil der gut ausgebildeten Arbeitskräfte hat Sri Lanka aufgrund der Inflation und der Wirtschaftskrise, die das Land heimgesucht hat, verlassen.

Das Personal an der Rezeption, das wir einstellen, ist freundlich und vertrauenswürdig, verfügt aber nicht über Erfahrung. Infolgedessen gibt es Probleme wie die, die Sie bemerkt haben

Wir entschuldigen uns zutiefst für die durch diese Unerfahrenheit verursachten Unannehmlichkeiten.

Wir haben ein strenges Schulungsprogramm, aber natürlich braucht es Zeit, um zu lernen und die erforderlichen Kenntnisse, Fähigkeiten, Gewohnheiten und das Selbstvertrauen zu entwickeln.

Aufgrund Ihrer aufschlussreichen Bewertung habe ich den Manager, den stellvertretenden Manager und den Rezeptionsmanager gebeten, einzugreifen, um die neuen Rezeptionsmitarbeiter genauer zu beaufsichtigen und sie bei ihrer Schulung besser zu unterstützen.

Bezüglich WLAN verfügt jede Villa über einen eigenen WLAN-Router. Es gibt zwei weitere Internetverbindungen für das Personal, sodass WLAN-Verbindungen in den Villen nicht durch das Personal verursacht werden, das das WLAN nutzt. Leider ist die Internetverbindung in Sri Lanka aufgrund einer unterentwickelten Infrastruktur oft langsam und unzuverlässig.

Wir entschuldigen uns noch einmal für die Mängel, die Sie während Ihres Aufenthalts festgestellt haben. Es liegt uns sehr am Herzen, sicherzustellen, dass unsere Gäste im Waterland ein magisches Erlebnis haben. Ich hoffe, dass das neue Personal an der Rezeption schnell lernen wird und bald in der Lage sein wird, den hohen Servicestandard zu bieten, den Gäste erwarten und verdienen.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Die Unterkunft und einzelne Häuschen sind sehr schön und mit liebe eingerichtet. Doch leider ist das Service-Personal seeehr jung und leider eher unerfahren und unsicher - wenn auch lieb. 

Doch für den Preis hätte ich mir dann doch etwas mehr erwartet. Das beginnt damit, dass bei den Mahlzeiten zwar immer Wasser eingeschränkt wird, doch nicht mal nach weiteren Getränkenwünschen gefragt wird. Auch das Essen muss immer vorab ausgewählt werden (woran ich schließlich die Keller immer erinnert habe, damit sie nicht dann plötzlich kurzfristig vor der Tür stehen). Ich hatte Vollpension... doch es wurde nicht erklärt, was/wie ich alles wählen kann und so hatte ich zunächst immer nur eine Hauptspeise. Auch bei Frühstück bekam ich dann nur meinen gewünschten Morgenbrei und Kaffee - fertig. Generell war das Essens-Angebot für Vollpension relativ überschaubar. 

Tagsüber war das WLAN in meinem Zimmer sehr schlecht (gaanz früh morgens ist es gerannt) - ich vermute, dass das Personal auch im Internet war?! 

Sie waren alle nett und wenn sie bei der Sache waren sehr bemüht - aber halt nur dann. Wie gesagt, waren sie sehr jung (unter 25 Jahren) und keine seniorige Person in Sicht. Das hat man leider gemerkt und für mich leider etwas kaputt gemacht.
title: Mit liebe eingerichtete Zimmer, Service aber leider enttäuschend.

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks for staying at Waterland and for sharing your experiences.  We're glad the staff provided you first class service.

We're sorry that your experience was not more uniformly positive. We know that a few disappointing aspects of a stay - limited restaurant hours, a menu that does not meet what you had hoped for, inadequate communication, ... can tarnish an experience.

We very much appreciate guest feedback, perhaps most especially feedback on how we can improve.  To avoid similar disappointments in future, we have now expanded our dining room hours so that we are open on Tuesdays.  We have also eliminate the breakfast basket that you described as makeshift.

From April - July, we have been closed in order to revamp the kitchen and carry out a wide variety of upgrades to the property.  In terms of the dining experience, we now have a talented and energetic new head chef, doubled the size of the kitchen, and added on to the dining room so that we can accommodate all our guests at the same time.  We also did a full upgrade of the outdoor dining experience, building a magnificent new outdoor kitchen and doing a number of upgrades to the dining barge including new seating and a a new thatch roof.

Other upgrades made in the past 4 months are 2 new pools, new pool tiles for all the existing pools, larger gardens for the Studio Villas on the Canal, new landscaping,  2 new bathrooms, a new lounge, and a new games room.

Again, we're sorry that you had a disappointing stay.  If you do return to Sri Lanka, please let us know.  We would love to host you and provide you a more consistently stellar guest experience.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
Disappointing. More ‘bling’ than glamour. One night was enough! Staff were the high point, 1st class! Food was overpriced and underwhelming not what was expected for a supposed ‘boutique’ establishment. Only after arrival were we informed that breakfast, again average, would be a makeshift affair 
served outside our room as the restaurant was closed on Tuesdays. No prior notice of this. Don’t like giving negative reviews but in this case hard to find something uplifting.
title: Stop Over Returning Home

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for staying at Waterland and for taking the time to write such an extensive review. 

We're glad to hear that you found the staff to be helpful and friendly and that you found the  villa to be nice and clean.

We're sorry to hear that you were not fully satisfied with some other aspects of your stay.

It seems that once you learned that there was a charge for the airport pickup, you were no longer able to enjoy your stay.  We have all been in situations in which an initial disappointment colors the whole experience.  

Waterland offered free airport pickup until 31 December 31, 2016 to guests who booked from December 1, 2015 - 30 September 2016.  We did this to ensure that guests had no difficulty finding Waterland.  Your stay began on 25 January, 2017.

Waterland has a strong commitment to responsible tourism and environmental sustainability.  We sponsor clean-up campaigns in the neighborhood, have installed solar panels for the hot water supply, and have installed energy efficient air-conditioners, energy efficient lights, and energy-efficient appliances to minimize our carbon footprint.  As part of this commitment, each of the villas has a "key card".  When the guest comes in and inserts the key card, all the lights, air-conditioners, fans, ... can be operated.  When the guest leaves the villa, she/he removes the key card, ensuring that there is no wastage of energy in the guest's absence.  It seems that we did not do a good enough job explaining the environmental function of the key card system.

It seems that you then had some disappointment about the display of prices in dollars.   We display prices in dollars for several reasons.   First, nearly all our guests are from abroad and have a good working knowledge of the value of the U.S. dollar.  Second, most of our guests come to Waterland at the start or end of their stay and have dollars, but not rupees at that point in their journeys.  Third, we were following a tradition of other boutique properties in Sri Lanka, India, Cambodia, Thailand, Laos to display prices in U.S. dollars.  There is no expectation that guests pay in dollars and guests are welcome to pay their bills in Sri Lankan rupees.  Our acceptance of Sri Lankan rupees is evidenced by the fact that you settled your bill in Sri Lankan rupees.  We use the currency exchange rates of the xe dot com currency converter calculator.  These rates offer ours guest more rupees to the dollar than they would receive at a bank in Sri Lanka.

As with many things, it seems that much of your dissatisfaction may have stemmed from misunderstandings.  I'm sorry for any shortcomings in our communication about exchange rates, why we price in dollars, why you did not receive a free airport pickup, and why you were not able to keep the AC running through the day while you were away from the villa.

Just as are committed to responsible tourism, we are also deeply committed to the guest experience.  Accordingly, on your next visit to Sri Lanka, we would be delighted to welcome you back for a night's stay free of charge.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: I must start by saying that the staff who work  in the hotel are helpful and friendly, but that cannot be said for the way the hotel is managed.I booked my stay through Agoda and my paperwork stated clearly that I had a one way airport transfer and breakfast included. However, the manager/assistant manager refused to provide that despite three phone calls from the staff who had seen the evidence! The room was nice and kept clean, but be aware that the hotel likes the A/C to be turned off when you are not there and the room becomes very hot and it is slow to cool down on your return. The food breakfast was ok ish, but there was a somewhat limited selection and not too much of it. The other menu was not very comprehensive and was small in quantity. It is highly overpriced for what it is and BEWARE, the menu is priced in US dollars , for some ludicrous reason, but when u pay for it, you are expected to pay in Sri Lanka rupees, which means you are subjected to a very poor exchange rate, giving you even less good value for money. Why on earth can they not just be up front and price the meals in the currency of the country, which you are in like every one else does? I had really hoped that this hotel was going to be a real paradise like oasis, but I was left feeling much disappointed. Sadly I would never visit the hotel again. I am not a fan of being ripped off. There are many other better places in Negombo to stay.
title: nice surroundings, but be prepared to be disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for staying at Waterland for those several nights and for providing that extensive account of your experience.

We are delighted that you had a good stay on your first night, that you found the Deluxe Villa to be great, that you found the views outstanding, and that you enjoyed the infinity-edge plunge pool.  It's good to hear that it was the perfect start to your holiday and that the stay deserved a 5 star rating.

Your concerns about the price of dinner suggests that we need to do a better job in our marketing.  We need to be clearer that Waterland is a premium property and that budget travelers will be happier elsewhere.  Our 4-course gourmet dinner with an amuse bouche costs for 15 USD provides excellent value, but obviously is not a good fit for those who want to spend just a few dollars on a meal.

Thanks too for sharing your concern that we were not able to serve breakfast before your early morning departure.  Unlike large hotels, small boutique properties such as ours are not able to offer meal service 24 hours a day.  That said, we will explore whether one of the chefs can prepare a fruit bowl to go for guests the night before their departure.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in Waterland for 2 nights. One night when we arrived in Sri Lanka and one night before we left. We have mixed feelings about Waterland. Our first stay was excellent: beautiful family villa with a outstanding view, 2 very modern and beautiful bedrooms and a sitting room. We were delighted to swim in the private swimming pool with views on the beautiful river. We had dinner on the site which was ok. A little bit expensive for what you got for 20 dollar per person. Breakfast was very good and started at 8.30 am. Late for a tropical country but that didn't bother us because we weren't in a hurry. Perfect start of our holiday and this stay deserves a 5 star rating.
Nevertheless, our return stay was different. We stayed again in the family villa which was great. However the sheets in the upper bedroom were very stained. We decided to go to Negombo for dinner because of our average dinner experience in Waterland before. To go to Negombo beach is an quick tuk tuk ride 800 LKR return fee. Next morning we had to leave the hotel at 7.15 am in order to catch our flight back home. So in the afternoon before, we asked the personnel if we could get breakfast earlier than 8.30am or  could have a picknick breakfast. They had to ask Mr. Mark, the boss living abroad. In all hotels in Sri Lanka and other countries it never was a problem, so we didn't think it would be problem at all. But after we came back from dinner we were very surprised and disappointed to hear that is wasn't possible. A 5 star accommodation turned out to have a 1 star service level in our opinion. We already payed for the breakfast and we couldn't get a refund, having breakfast at 7 am is everywhere in the world a normal time to eat. And we couldn't even get a bottle of water or a banana to take to the airport before starting our 24 hour trip. We couldn't believe it! We went to the airport very disappointed.....And at the airport we spent 50 US dollars for breakfast. Just coffee and a sandwich for the 4 of us...
title: Beautiful rooms but don't stay there if you need to catch a morning flight.

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks, Amanda, for choosing to stay at Waterland and for taking the time to write such a thoughtful, extensive, and helpful review.

We're glad that you enjoyed the cleanliness, the villa, the pool, the tranquility, and the beauty of the sunsets.  Waterland seems magical in the early mornings as the sun is rising and during the sunsets. We're delighted too that you found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. 

Thanks for expressing your concern about tips and about paying 6 dollars per person including tax for lunch.
 
Your comments underscore that we need to do a better job of conveying what Waterland is and is not so that guests will not be disappointed.   Waterland is not a local guest house where one can have a meal for a few dollars.  Nor is it a guest house in which there are 1 or 2 untrained workers.  Waterland is a premium private estate with lavish accommodations, a large staff (6 full-time staff for 10 guests), and a highly experienced, attentive, and educated staff with good English skills.  To provide guests gain a better understanding of what Waterland is and is not, I will upload the menu to the website.  I will also add some information to the frequently asked questions section of the website so that guests have a better understanding of the property, the restaurant, the prices, ...

Your points about the dining experience were also very helpful.  It seems that you were served an a la carte meal by the cook and not by the chef.  I worked with the chef this past weekend and emphasized the importance of consistently high quality meals and short wait times.  I reiterated the importance of preparing only items on the menu which we know we can do well and which we know that we can prepare in a timely manner.  

We are now serving a more streamlined, dynamic, and high quality breakfast menu, a 2-course fixed price lunch, and a 4-course fixed price dinner menu.  I have developed these items with the chef, had each menu offering this weekend, and can vouch for their excellence.

If you do return to Waterland, I think you will be delighted by the dining experience.  That said, the meal prices parallel our costs and are on par with those of other luxury properties.
placeInfo/address: 106A St. Mary's Road, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here for one night before we flew out. We had a lovely room on the river and were pleased with the cleanliness and the pool. It was fantastic watching the sun set and the location was quiet. The hotel was able to arrange a tuk tuk so we could have a look around because the hotel is a little out of town and away from restaurants. I don't know if it was because the hotel was relatively new, but there seemed to be a teething issues. First of all, the staff were very friendly and helpful but I couldn't help think that they were waiting for a tip every time something was delivered to the room. It doesn't help that there were constant reminders in the guide book to tip as well. My second complaint were the meals. We had lunch when we arrived and were charged 24 US dollars for 4 average bowls of pasta. This is quite expensive for Sri Lankan standards. In retrospect, we would have eaten somewhere else (there are some fantastic restaurants overlooking the beach that offer great seafood). My last gripe was breakfast; it took forever. Luckily we were able to enjoy the pool! The hotel was able to give us a late check out which was greatly appreciated. We are returning to Negombo later on the year, but not sure if we would return.
title: Lovely spot but a couple of concerns

placeInfo/address: 322 Udugama Ampitiya Rd, Ampitiya 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
During our trip to Sri Lanka, we stayed at Golden Crown Hotel for two nights. Upon arrival, the hotel made a good first impression – the building looks nice, the welcome was pleasant, and the reception staff were kind and helpful.

We were accommodated on the first floor of the older part of the building. The room was clean, but signs of aging and wear were noticeable on the furnishings. However, the overall atmosphere was quite pleasant.

Restaurant and Services

Unfortunately, dinner at the hotel restaurant was disappointing. First, we had to wait several minutes for a table. When we finally got one, it was dirty, with only minimal tableware set. The staff ignored us for a long time, and when we tried to order drinks, it took more than 15 minutes before someone came to us. Despite repeatedly asking, we kept being told that a waiter would be called, but no one came for a long time.

The buffet selection was quite large, but the food quality was average. The same situation occurred during breakfast – a lack of pastries, slow service, and mediocre food quality.

Outdoor Areas and Pool

The outdoor infinity pool is one of the hotel’s main attractions. It offers beautiful views and is located in the new part of the building. Unfortunately, even here, the service was lacking – when we wanted to order from a selection of more than 15 types of Arrack in the evening, we were told that none were available.

Overall Rating

The hotel has great potential, with a beautiful historic building and a pleasant environment, but the quality of service does not match a five-star rating. While the staff is friendly, they are extremely slow and unorganized, which significantly impacts the overall experience. The food and restaurant service need improvement.
title: Not a 5 star at all :(
