text:
This is not a five star hotel!  We booked a junior suite for our three night stay which was very comfortable and would recommend.
Upon arrival the checking in process was average and towards the end I had to go and confirm the  process had been completed. It felt we were left stranded. Not even shown where the lifts were located.
You are only issued with one key card and a third time used key card holder. Masking fluid had been used to remove the previous room number! ( this was a cardboard key card holder). You had to return both at the end of your stay otherwise according to the guest information book in the room there would be a 20 USD charge for lost cards.  I find it unbelievable you are issued with a used key card holder and incur a possible charge.
The food was very good, however, if you would like a bottle of wine with dinner, only the most expensive wines were available throughout our stay which reduced the wine menu  significantly . No apology was given from anyone when attempting to order  the wine. 
There is a small swimming pool with only eight sun beds available. However, it seemed to work. 
We had a driver from the hotel who took us around Kandy for the day and very informative regarding the sights and made sure we were dropped as close as possible and agreed a pickup time. A big shout out for excellent service.
Overall, the staff were very friendly which made the stay manageable. However, it is the extras this hotel is missing which is what a five star should provide.
title: Not a five star stay

text:
The hotel  looks Grand. The lobby is impressive. The room was ok.  We arrived and the saw the fridge was not working. We called reception and they were confused. text:
The Golden Crown in Kandy offers a blend of positives and areas needing improvement. The staff were notably friendly and accommodating, making our stay pleasant. The restaurant and buffet provided delicious meal options, though the à la carte portions were disappointingly small.

The beds were comfortable, ensuring a good night’s sleep. However, the rooms appeared to be a bit dated and could benefit from some refurbishing. The gym, despite having a cool setup, had leakage issues that need addressing.

Room soundproofing was another concern, as we could hear noises from adjoining rooms. Additionally, the internet connection was often slow and unreliable, which could be inconvenient for guests needing consistent online access.

A peculiar aspect of the hotel was its pricing policy, especially the obligation to participate in certain events, which felt a bit imposing. This policy could be a turnoff for guests seeking more flexibility during their stay.

In summary, while The Golden Crown has its charms and commendable aspects, there are several areas that require attention to truly justify its status and pricing.
title: Mixed Experience at The Golden Crown, Kandy

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Bandara,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback with us. 

We truly appreciate your honest insights and are glad to hear that you found the location, staff, pool area, and certain aspects of our dining experience enjoyable. It’s wonderful that the lake view provided a peaceful atmosphere, and we’re pleased that our team made an effort to ensure your stay was welcoming.

At the same time, we sincerely regret that certain aspects of your visit did not meet expectations. Your comments regarding maintenance, cleanliness, and room conditions are taken very seriously, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused during your stay. We acknowledge that maintaining high standards is essential, and your observations regarding the sliding window, bathroom functionality, food accuracy, and general upkeep highlight areas we need to improve upon.

Our management team is reviewing your feedback carefully and will be working on necessary corrective measures to enhance both quality control and guest satisfaction. Your input is truly valuable in helping us provide a better experience for all future guests.

We appreciate your constructive suggestions and hope that in the future, we can welcome you back for an improved and seamless stay that fully meets your expectations. Thank you again for sharing your insights.

Warm regards,
Angela Manawadu
Front Office Manager 
EKHO Safari Hotel Tissa
placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Positives:
• All expected amenities were provided.
• The staff was friendly and made an effort to accommodate us.
• The lake view was lovely and peaceful—though the garden area could benefit from a bit more space to fully enjoy it.
• Most of the food items on the dinner menu (Room service) were tasty, and the portions were generous.
• The pool area was clean, appeared well-maintained, and was nicely arranged.
• Breakfast was acceptable in terms of taste, though nothing exceptional.

Negatives:
• Overall, the hotel was poorly maintained and did not reflect a 4-star standard—more in line with a 3-star experience.
• The room cleanliness was lacking. In particular, a sliding window in our triple room was not properly fitted, leading to water leakage during rain. This caused discomfort, as water dripped onto the third bed placed near the window.
• The bathroom setup in the triple room was inconvenient, with only a shower available and no tap for a quick body wash. The single room bathroom did not have this issue, but both rooms showed signs of poor maintenance and cleanliness.
• Room space was tight but manageable.
• Although dinner ordered to the room was generally good, the Seer devilled fish was not Seer fish as listed—it was Thalapath, and the taste was not good and fresh.
• Bathroom doors were old and difficult to close; they clearly need replacement.
• The bathroom floors did not drain well, leading to standing water, and the tiles were extremely slippery—posing a safety risk.
• Despite being located in a coastal area (Hambantota), the breakfast menu (Buffet) offered no seafood-based curries, which was disappointing.
• The single room’s bathroom commode was stained and not properly cleaned.

To Management:
While the staff appears to be trying their best to offer a pleasant experience, there are clearly gaps in maintenance, cleanliness, and attention to detail that fall under management’s responsibility. A 4-star rating sets certain expectations, and unfortunately, the experience delivered was closer to a 3-star standard. With improvements in upkeep, quality control, and better alignment between listed and delivered amenities, this property has the potential to offer a much better guest experience.
title: Nice Location, Average Experience – Needs Better Upkeep

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
The best things about this hotel are the staff and the location.

Gorgeous views looking across Lake Tissa, watching the sunset was magical. The pool was a comfortable temperature and it was exciting to see a large monitor wandering across the grass.

The staff were very friendly and accomodating, helping carry bags up the stairs and looking after us very well in the restaurant.

What lets this hotel down is maintenance. It appears that some upkeep is currently being done, but it is quite shabby. Once you walk away from the lovely reception area you can see how tired the hotel is - peeling paint, cracked tiles, stained sunlounge cushions. Random storage areas were visible and also looked worn. 

The main part of the room was fine, though there are no PowerPoints beside the bed. The bathroom needs some work - shower head was calcified and needs with a good clean or replacement. There was damage to walls where things possibly had been removed. The cupboard just looks old.

There were flys in the buffet food area, and sometimes in the food. One of the air con units in the restaurant was dripping water onto the floor. But the staff in the restaurant were wonderful - explaining dishes and making sure we had enough.

I can see this once would have been a beautiful well maintained 4 star resort but it felt more like a 3 star. Hopefully with continued renovation it can return to what it once was.
title: Great staff, great location, hotel a little tired.

placeInfo/address: Kataragama Road, Tissamaharama 82600 Sri Lanka
text: The initial greeting and welcome drink were good.  Our rooms were spacious, clean, with dated furniture, had nice views of Tissa Lake, was very quiet at night and in all three rooms the air conditioning was fine.  We had booked a safari through them and the car and driver were okay, but Yala (about a 40 minute drive to get to Yala and then being among the 250 vehicles racing up and down mainly the "main road" searching for limited game views) was such a disappointment when we were there that we did not do any further safaris.  We started with a light lunch in the restaurant, the fried rice was very bland, service almost non-existent, a slight odor in the restaurant; no wonder there was only one other table with guests - it looked like a tour group basic restaurant.  As we had other plans one morning, we only ate breakfast on our last day; there was enough choice, but the quality of the food was mediocre.  We had cocktails late one afternoon, and it took more than 5 minutes to find a waiter to order the drinks.  Our rooms were okay, but if I were to return I would eat elsewhere.
title: An okay place to stay

位在湖濱的酒店，有漂亮的湖景美色。
房間面積不小，浴室也夠大。但是，卻有些缺點：

酒店湖邊的樹木，在天際將黑時，飛來大群體積甚大的蝙蝠休息，倒掛於樹上。
酒店距離知名的雅拉國家公園車程約40分鐘，欲一早進入國家公園的話，需凌晨即起，酒店會先準備咖啡、茶及小點心供住房旅客享用。

text:
We booked 2 triple rooms
Overall stay was not satisfying
Welcome was poor,no welcome drink provided
WiFi password was not given on arrival and kids had to request for it
Lunch was very bad and found 2 human hairs, one in the soup and one in a curry
Taste was OK but refilling took a long time
Table service was good and staff was friendly but didn't have serviettes and the supply of paper serviettes was inadequate with 5 kids
Dinner was OK, but rice was half cooked
Soup was horrible
Breakfast was quite good compared to other 2 meals which had a mix of western and Eastern cuisine
Room service was zero
Though we booked triple rooms, the coffee supplies were for a double room and when we requested for a extra supply of COFFEE NEXT DAY MORNING, to the room they said THEY ONLY SUPPLY THEM. ONCE TO A ROOM
THAT IS UNACCEPTABLE AS IT IS A BASIC FEATURE PROVIDED IN ANY HOTEL AND WE FELT VERY UNCOMFORTABLE AS WE HAD TO STAY UNTIL BREAKFAST BUFFET TO HAVE OUR MORNING TEA
The amount of shampoo and body wash provided also was not adequate for the whole stay, for a family of 4 who booked a triple room
POOL WAS VERY POORLY MAINTAINED
One kid in our group had his toes cut to a sharp edged tile in the pool and we noticed that the same happened to another kid
Anyhow the view from. the poolside was mesmerising and relaxing
Departure also was not very good
There was nobody to open the EXIT GATE which was under lock and key and nobody even bothered to come and open the gate until we stayed there for about 5 minutes and not bothered to say sorry for the delay caused
title: STAY WAS NOT WORTH FOR THE MONEY FOR A FAMILY

text:
Special mention to our waiter Indunil who was excellent and so warm and welcoming. He even took us to the waterfall and was very knowledgeable about the area and very helpful with our little kids. 

Also, special thanks to the chef for amazing meals throughout our visit. Kids were really happy with what he prepared and his western and srilankan cuisine were both exquisite. 

The property itself is lovely and gorgeous big rooms. But there was so many issues:

1. google maps pin was incorrect and took us 30mins away from borderlands where we had just had an exhausting day of rafting. 
2. The room phone only worked on speaker mode. 
3. The fan regulator either worked on 1 or 5 speed
4. The hem of the blinds were broken and had to painstakingly pulled apart each time we tried to use the jacuzzi 
5. The tea hadn’t been replaced in a while and were stale when we tried to fix ourselves a cup of tea
6. The ice they brought for our drinks were tapered from the edges of the fridge as opposed to cubes of ice. 
7. Whilst we were ok with the charges for bottled water, I felt that it should have been mentioned as none of us cared for bottled water and were charged for it.
title: Great experience with room for improvement

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Located in 6km from main road Kithulgala, this is wonderful jungle resort in middle of the rain-forest, close to a river and Mana kathi ella waterfall.The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. There are two type of rooms and we stayed in Araliya which Sauna and plunge pool.
But there service is not up to standard. We had issues in water supply and sauna operating after check-in. it seems they were not ready to welcome the guest. The staff is friendly but not  match to other similar levels hotels in Sri Lanka
Their foods were tasty, but food options  were very limited and poor set menu compare to other  hotels. For a unknown reason they didn't serve pork related food items for guests. Overall   this is a wonderful place but feel like bit overrated in reviews

Rooms - 4.4     Service - 3.0     Location - 4.6
title: Wonderful Nature resort, Can be improved

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
The situation is magic, surrounded by forest and beautiful walkways to your rooms (we were in the Nelum Suite). The room itself is beautifull, great view to the jungle through the huge glass window. Superb bathroom. 
We were on half board for two nights. First night menu: 
        Cream of vegetable soup
        Bread and Butter
        Fried Rice with chicken or sea food OR Pasta Bolognese
        Peach Melba
The second night choice was similar, soup, then a rice dish or pasta. 
Dining is an important moment on holiday, especially if you are in luxurious surroundings. The menu was closer to a school canteen!
The Nelum suite unfortunately has another suite attached to it. The architect thought it a good idea to have a connecting door between the two. The connecting door doesn't fit very well, so that both sound and light come through it. Our neighbours had a very small baby that cried in the night and had to be fed. So we had both the sound of the crying baby (close to the connecting door, since the door is at the fridge and sink area where food is prepared) and the light shining through the door onto our ceiling. It is a pity to come such a long way and then be disturbed by one's neighbours.
Although there is a swimming pool, this is at the central area, a long way from the rooms.  There are no designated changing rooms; staff suggested I change in the lavatory. I preferred not to swim!
Some people have written that the staff are not good here.  I disagree entirely as I found all the staff to be friendly and efficient, particularly the young man on front desk. The Manager was also most helpful and professional.
There is no alcohol licence; bring your own!
title: Beautiful but poor acoustics in room and boring food. Superb management.

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. 
The room we got was very good, just like the online pictures , with tall windows with views of the jungle and waterfall. The bathroom in the room was great with great shower area and an excellent private jacuzzi which we really used. 
We reached the hotel around 4 pm the first day, so the only thing we could do was trek up to the caves with Lakman (who btw is a very good and friendly guide!). We reached the hotel back around 6.30 PM . The thing I  didn't like was that after sunset there is absolutely nothing to do in the resort . You are pretty much confined to your room, u can order room service , enjoy the jacuzzi and watch movies . They should really provide additional activities in the resort such as a games room, a spa , etc . 
The next day we went rafting and canyoning in the morning which was good fun. The rapids are easy and basic but still fun. We came back around lunch time . Unluckily that time Lakman was out of the hotel for some work and they don't have any other professional who can take u upto the waterfall. Once lakman came back he took us up to the waterfall where there is a natural swimming pool . That activity was quite good and fun. 
The hotel lobby and swimming pool is a bit run down , and the food is average. 
The receptionist Suren was pretty clueless all the time , he couldn't help us much in guiding us as to what all there is to do in Kitugala. 
The resort can do well in terms of adding facilities like a hammock where u can just lie down and enjoy the scenery , a games room, probably a spa , and some way of utilising the waterfall which is literally right there !! Like probably figure a way of doing a picnic lunch by the falls .
title: Lot of scope for improvement

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
Feels like a treehouse with all it's simplicity and raw-ness. Only you have glass walls around you. 

Fear of insects? Get ready and familiar as you're about to encounter many.

Love breakfast buffet? Not what you will receive but you are served one of two options. Local or Western.

Great activities on site but way way too far from any other popular site in still Lanka so don't plan on visiting if you plan to get toured around to sigiriya, nuwara eliya and the likes.

We got here from the airport. The road took 3.5 hours with a good thirty minutes feeling v bumpy with roads narrowing up more and more. For the brave hearts this is v exciting. 

Buggies here are tuc tucs which I thought was a very cool touch.
title: Very VERY secluded.. welcome to the sound of tree life

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
The location is just breathtaking . The many complaints written about the road are not  valid as long as you have a 4WD ,driving on this road is not a problem.The resort is bordering a waterfall and is the perfect place for rest and relaxation. The chalets have been beautifully designed to blend in with the environment and are extremely spacious and comfortable.
When we made the reservation we specified the need for vegetarian food and we were told (By the lady handling our reservation) that all we had to do was inform the chef and that he would make whatever food we wanted.
When we checked in we were disappointed to find that there was a very limited choice for vegetarians and dessert was limited to 2 items (Ice cream and curd and treacle ) and whatever we requested was not available (Mainly for Dinner - eg- : Lasagna sheets not available, Paneer not available )
However whatever limited food they did offer was absolutely delicious.They had an extensive menu for non vegetarians which our kids were happy with , so the problem of limited choice is mainly for the vegetarians. Unfortunately items on the the dessert menu were also not available !!
They have skelton staff who have to multi task (The pool boy who takes you on excursions and also handles maintenance , one waiter struggled to handle all 6 tables s the person at the reception had to chip in) and therefore unable to really focus on making the customers happy, which is part of the boutique hotel experience .
Since the price being charged is on par with boutique hotels you cannot except a customer to be satisfied with what is being offered, Palmstone retreat has a long way to go towards understand just this simple concept !  
We found it quite annoying that out of the two Jacuzzi's adjacent to the pool , one was not working & only one side of the other one was working, to add to this housekeeping didn't appear to have sufficient bath towels  so we had to be satisfied with face towels for 2 nights of the 3 .
One staff member worthy of mention was Lakmal , He is the boy in charge of the pool and he took us on 2 excursions (Beli Lena cave and a waterfall) both of which we thoroughly enjoyed. He appeared to be very knowledgeable, very cautious and very helpful when the kids were struggling on the hikes. 
Palmstone retreat should looks into the possibility of obtaining life jackets for adults and kids so that the guests who cannot swim very well can enjoy the natural pools near the waterfall safely as the water in some places is 30-40 ft deep. It is an amazing experience and one that should not be missed ! 
The ONLY reason why we decided to stay back instead of checking out earlier is because we enjoyed the environment so much. Thanks to Lakmal for making our stay a memorable one !
title: Beautiful retreat sans a boutique hotel experience !

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: The road for this place was somewhat a rough ride and it took us 45 minutes to go there.It s a really nice place located next to a small water fall  within a rain forest and view was astonishing. The food was great and they could really improve the room amenities and maintenance since this is a really beautiful attraction especially for couples.
title: A place in an Iconic place

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your detail review.We are happy to say that we have improved our Menu ,so new good reviews coming up with positive comments regarding food.Hope to welcome back to our hotel.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived at this isolated location for one night so that we could take advantage of exploring the local area and fitting in some white water river rafting as part of our honeymoon.  
The journey from the main road to the hotel is rather treacherous although we managed fine with our careful driver (ours was a Hiace van).
On arrival, the four loungers at the pool were occupied. I asked for one to be brought out only to be informed the hotel only had four sun loungers and this usually was not a problem as most guests stayed at their villas.  Disappointingly I had to just wait until evening for pool time as there is no possible way of lying on the grass. I dont think it is acceptable for a luxury hotel not to have facilities for at least half its guests to be pool side if you provide a pool as one of your main facilities.
The villas themselves are wonderful and look out onto expansive views of jungle and river.  The bathrooms were a particular highlight with jacuzzi baths and monsoon showers.
There is no alcohol on site so be prepared or decide to be healthy as we did.
Food is rather poor and a weak attempt at European fare - I would recommend this hotel just stick to cooking local food.
Service was hit and miss.
All in all, a wonderful location and a great base for hiking, swimming and rafting, all of which we did but still a way to go.
title: Satisfactory but with potential

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much  for reviewing us in Trip Advisor.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We drove to the hotel in a normal sedan car and it is 45 minutes (we timed it) off the main road. The track (parts are not really a road at all) is very bendy and difficult to drive on- our driver was not very happy about it at all. If you have a hired driver I would avoid this hotel unless they drop you at the bottom (staying elsewhere in Kitulgula) and you ask the hotel to come and collect in their 4x4 vehicle. This is what they really should already be offering to their guests- I don't know why they don't.

It was a lovely hotel but the stressful 45 mins in and out rather ruined the experience. If you are only want to stay one night because you are white water rafting in the area there are other hotels much more conveniently located (the plantation hotel is one I think). If you are going for a few days then it is more worth it.
title: Note of caution

placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
First, the location - very good. In the middle of the forest, detached from any and all distractions. Premises border on the river, and is conveniently accessible from the hotel. Chalets are well spaced out, spacious, glassed up, and gives the immersive feeling of being surrounded by the wilderness.

The road leading up is very poor. We took a chance with a car on the advise of the hotel staff, but it turned out to be ok. You just have to go a bit slow. 

The food, leaves a lot to be desired. We weren't that satisfied with the choices in the menu, hence we requested a special order, which turned out ok. Value for money is very slim, since the prices are on the exuberant side of things. That is partly acceptable because the location is pretty remote here.

The staff was good. Checked in on everything and gave a few good recommendations on things to do.

No alcohol served in the premises - which is a let down because you have to travel to the nearest town to get some, and even so, having a risk of not finding anything of quality because the area is not that well populated.

The forest across the river can be trekked, and you can travel up the river as well. The rock tends to get a bit too hot in the midday sun.

Honestly though, we paid 150 USD for B&B which was a lot, and spent on a few dishes with room service as well. Considering the poor accessibility and lack of good food/beverages. I'm all for premium pricing, when quality doesn't suffer. With a little more work, I'm sure this place could be living up to it's potential.
title: Good location, but falls short on other things.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for reviewing us.We appreciate your comments,also we would like to apologize about the inconvenience caused.We will try our best to satisfy and make  the guest  happy.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We had high hopes about this Hotel after reading tripadvisor reviews. Unfortunately our visit did not meet our expectations. 

Our car was not ready for dirt road to Hotel from Kithulgala. When we book the hotel we were told there is a secure parking in kitulgala and there is a security guard as well. It turns out secure parking is empty land where buses park and security guard is village man who lives next to it. We were worried about vehicle safety which kinda ruined our time there. 
MAKE SURE YOU COME BY 4x4 or PARK AT YOUR OWN RISK. 

 A+ for location. Middle of forest facing to a river. You feel like you are living in middle of nature with modern luxury. Hardly you see anyone unless you walk to main building so it is very private. 

Staff : very friendly and Helpfull. Nimal who served us most of the time is really nice and friendly. 
They are trying hard but unfortunately little or no experience and little training let things down.

Food : we were happy breakfast and lunch. But dinner was not up to standards. They offered us something else but we were not hungry and lost appetite after we tried. Menu is very limited. No choices with food. There are no other restaurants so you are stuck with what they offer which is very limited. 

Room : very modern and luxury. But lack of maintenance and cleaning make things go down slowly. 
Outside finish is not the best. Should have done better. 

No dental kit. No shaving kit. Had to request. Quality is very low of the dental kit we receive.  

All the Towels were torn. 

Safe was not working. They tried to fix it but nothing fixed till we left the place. 

Sauna is ok but safety switch turns off automatically had to get someone to turn it on.

Bathroom is needs more cleaning. Even though hotel is new dirt build up already in the edges. Seems like no one tried to clean apart from daily housekeeping tasks. 

Overall apart from location there is not much about this place compare with the price.
There are lots of small luxury hotels in sri lanka for this value which offfers lot more. 

Small things which cost very less can bring up the quality. management should pay attention as this place has lot of potential.

Seriously torn towels.. No shaving or dental kit unless you request... For 35000 lkr night hotel ???
title: Has lot of potential... Not worth the Money

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for spending your time to give us a feedback on your recent stay.We are happy to hear that you remarked the perfect location around our hotel and that you are pleased with our friendly and helpful staff.Our location is a real asset, but it's nice to see that our effort in Service and our arrangements find its recognition as well.Also we would like to promise to ensure good dinner in your next stay with us.Thanks again and all the best.Hope to see you in near future.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent three days next to the water falls . The chalet was new and spacious with great views of the Forest and the river . It has a jacuzzi that worked only once during our 3 day stay  . A sauna room that works only once a day . The road to the hotel is very dangerous and narrow . it takes  35 minutes to drive the  6 kilometers . The breakfast is good but dinner is tasteless .
The staff are great and trying hard to please us . Thanks to Abdourahman and the main receptionist and to the manager who was there on our first day . Water rafting was the highlight of this location which is about 40 minutes away from this hotel and for only $20 .
title: Isolated Paradise

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for staying with us and for leaving a review. We're glad you enjoyed our prime location! Thanks for sharing all of your thoughts. We hope you'll stay with us again, and we promise we'll make your visit superb!

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text: Palm Stone Retreat is located in a forest area in Kitulgala, beside a small river with a small waterfall. The road here from the main road is 7 km on an occasionally very bad road. We were picked up in a worn dies smelling van as it was unable to get around with the car we rented for the trip. How they got here the hotel itself is a mystery! the hotel is super modern with 8 rooms are very luxurious, all facing the river. The main building is completely open and nicely decorated next door is a nice little pool area. We were here for birding but then there are some trails in the forest, it was quite impossible to get through, so the birdwatching was not particularly successful. It included no food except breakfast which is very strange in a place that is so far everything else. The food was in relation to price and quality very expensive, certainly not worth the high cost! There is no alcohol to buy, but it is perfectly possible to bring their own. Despite its luxury outweigh it is not the disadvantages but the hotel is newly opened, so my hope is that there will emerge a great lodge!
title: boutik hotel in the forest

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your amazing review.Sorry for the inconvenience caused.We usually send all our guests about the road condition and the shuttle service in the booking confirmation email itself,But I don't know how we missed to inform you regarding road condition.All in all we are very glad to hear that you enjoyed the stay at Palmstone Retreat ,other than the road condition.Also we are very happy to welcome you again to our hotel.Hope to see you soon.

Thanks & Regards
Palmstone Retreat
placeInfo/address: Koskanuwala, Mahabage, Kitulgala, Kitulgala 71720 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I wanted to take an overnight trip with our one year old and picked Palmstone retreat to stay for 1 night. When I called the hotel and got the details and directions, never did they mention anything about the 6.5KM of bad road it takes to get to the hotel after turning off from the main road. With the baby also in the vehicle, in our SUV it took us about 45 minutes to travel this stretch of 6.5kms and halfway through, we almost turned back as well. I saw later that some reviews mention the 4x4 ride that they were offered free of charge but this was never mentioned to us by the hotel and so I thought that it would be important to include this bit of information in my review.

Another thing to mention is that unlike at other hotels once you get there, there's no going out to find a place to eat. It is by all sense of the word a "retreat". So plan to have all meals at the hotel itself.

Apart from the above issues, the hotel itself is situated in a beautiful location and the room and the scenery were both stunning. The rooms were very spacious and the bathroom was as big as the room itself, if not bigger. The sauna and the outdoor heated jacuzzi were 2 of our favorite additions. The food was good but not great. The staff were very friendly and nice and even the manager was friendly and wanted to make our short stay as comfortable as possible. 

Initially even though my rating would've been a lot lower I cannot give it any less than 3 stars due to the scenery, the room facilities and the nice staff. I wish they had informed us about the difficult road and that we were prepared for it but we were not. All in all, I would go there again, with the option of the shuttle service, and would plan to stay for a few days.
title: Beautiful location!! But difficult road!!

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel is nice.  Location is good. Food is very good if it is Sri Lankan.  Western foods are ok at best. However guest to staff ratio is inadequate for this price point.  Also, staff need’s training for more professionalism.  Mistakes were made in room service orders and had to call multiple times to get toilet paper.  Also departments such as housekeeping don’t answer the phone.  

Also only lobby, main restaurant and rooms are air conditioned. Rest of the hotel is hot.

Also crows and a cat was roaming in the open bar area.

Is the Spa treatments were good but more care and warmth is needed when interacting with customers.

At first glance hotel looks very nice but once you stay for a while you notice the deficiencies.

We had a Suite for 3 days.  Suite it self was very functional and had a very nice view.  Also pool was nice and warm.
title: Service and staff needs improvement

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text: J y suis actuellement, pendant 5 jours. Très grand complexe avec un environnement extérieur charmant avec vue sur mer. La plage face à l hôtel est moins fréquentée car il est indispensable d avoir des chaussures adaptées dues aux coraux présents au sol. Mais à quelques mètres seulement, une magnifique plage se dessine avec du sable fin et une mer très calme pour adultes et enfants. Pour les amoureux de ballade et de la marche, c est le lieu approprié. Des pêcheurs sont présents au bout de la jetée ainsi que des locaux pechant avec un simple filet,  à proximité. Atypique et parfait pour prendre des photos pittoresques des traditions du Sri-Lanka. Le jardin et sa piscine sont à la dimension de l hôtel. C est superbe et magnifique. Tout est parfait. Prestations et services de grandes qualités. Un bar géant ou tout vous est proposé. Cocktail avec ou sans alcool préparé avec soin ou tout autre chose. La salle de restauration est identique en volume et le choix proposé et surtout varie chaque jour est à l image de l établissement. Le personnel est à l écoute et efficace. La chambre est à l image du complexe , spacieuse avec une bonne décoration de style très soignée et idem pour la salle de bains. Petit bémol pour mon cas , ma chambre se situe à proximité de la Réserve des réceptions marchandises et d appareils de ventilations qui occasionnent une nuisances quotidiennes. Ma vue de ma terrasse extérieure donne sur un jardin avec un mur en béton face à moi !!!!. Pas très glamour. Et en plus, un passage au dessus permet aux visiteurs de visualiser tous mes mouvements sur mon environnement personnel. Donc très déçu 😞 sur ma situation actuelle. C est pour cela que mon jugement n est pas parfait sur cette hôtel. Dommage !!!!
title: Prendre absolument les chambres avec vue sur mer!!!!

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and was impressed by the rooms and the views—they were both excellent! The rooms were comfortable, clean, and offered a great view, making the stay pleasant overall. However, the food experience was a huge letdown.

There was no wide spread buffet, which was really disappointing, especially given the location. What was even more frustrating was the complete absence of seafood, which is usually a highlight at seaside hotels. If you are someone who was looking forward to a great seafood buffet, I would not recommend this place. It's not the right choice for seafood lovers.

While the hotel itself is great for relaxing and enjoying the view, the food really needs improvement to match the quality of the accommodations.
title: Good Rooms and Views, But Disappointing Food

roomTip: best to walk 100 m to the left to the public beach or 10 minutes walk to Kalkudah Bay/the opposite bay (there is a dream beach there)
text: Very large hotel complex. Modern and large rooms with sea views. The spa area is great (very authentic and professional, OK price-wise). The food was OK (large selection, but unfortunately everything was cold). The beach is nice, but since there is a (dead) reef right in front of it with lots of dead stone corals, you can't swim there (you can't walk there without bathing shoes - risk of injury!!!). Best to walk 100 m to the left to the public beach (there are no stone corals there and swimming is possible) or 10 minutes walk to Kalkudah Bay/the opposite bay (there is a dream beach there)
title: Nice hotel with large rooms and awesome spa

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Consider paying more to stay in a better quality hotel
text:
I want to write a really balanced review which draws upon the strengths of the hotel as well its shortcomings 

Strengths 
We had a deluxe sea view - lovely airy room enough for 3 . Spacious bathroom amenities topped up daily . Our room boy Lojanan was great as was maintenance Daaz.
View and sunsets  amazing the hotel is nicely framed by swaying palm trees around the grounds 
Shop was good value - friendly person working there 
We were given an anniversary cake and decorated bed lovely touch 
Overall staff very kind and helpful from restaurant, bar , reception and pool attendants
Hotel clean good evidence lots of maintenance goes on daily .
Laundry service fine 

Negatives
The area outside is rough , dirty rubbish nearby 
The seafood bar  opposite plays music at a ridiculous loud level why ?? 
Whilst the public beach next door didn’t bother us at all , when it was busy there were men hanging about outside hotel  not sure why 
I saw the security guard at the beach drink out of a wine bottle whilst on duty . Even if it was water that should not be happening ! 
The pool hygiene is questionable, I saw a naked toddler in the pool this was ignored 
Crows drinking from the pool . Dirty scum round edge . Questionable chlorine levels. 
Sun bed wars at times you needed to get there before 8.30 am   to get a lounger .
The food!! The quality was inconsistent bones on meat , tough beef. A lot looked the same from previous nights . Saw lots of flies at the outside cooking station some were dead in-between the glass panelling 
I think there was a food  and  beverage  manager walking around , little if any interaction with guests 
Breakfast could be chaotic items not replenished in a timely way . Napkins were at times dirty 
One tourist chose to walk around bare foot at breakfast despite clear etiquette around clothing this was ignored 
Food cold mainly 
Service at honey  beach bar  slow .

In summary
We ate at the Uga  hotel one night and had lunch at Malu Malu  hotel the difference in quality is unmeasurable!
Wished we had trusted our gut and stayed in a high end resort .
title: I wouldn’t come back ! Disappointed with aspects

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Joannacl4966IV,

Thank you for your detailed feedback. We're glad you enjoyed the Family Residence Suite, views, and beach. We apologize for the issues with the food, staff, and pool area. Your comments are invaluable, and we will address them to improve our services. Safe travels!

Warm regards, 
Management - Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an amazing Family Residence Suite with the most beautiful view! Our housekeeping chap was very helpful and kept the rooms lovely.

Loved sitting at Honey beach early evening with a Ceylonese cocktail watching the sunset.

This is the 4th hotel we stayed in on our trip to Sri Lanka and sadly the worse in terms of food, staff and the pool area.

The staff got friendlier the longer we were there luckily. But for the first few days they were very unfriendly compared to all our other stays. The buffet was manic, at breakfast and dinner - with less choice than previous hotels, things not topped up readily and the majority of dishes luke warm at best. Very disappointing.

The resort got busier and busier into our stay.....then sunbed wars started. There is not enough beds for the number of guests. I did not expect to have to be fighting for a sun bed in Sri Lanka.  The pool isn't great.....very underwhelming, shallow and the ravens are constantly drinking from it and pooping on the edge. Pretty grim!

No mention of a national holiday until we went to the bar and were told no alcohol being served ! Thought they would have at least informed their guests! 

Definitely only 4 star but loved our suite - apart from the child above who constantly ran everywhere sounding like a herd of elephants at all times of the day. After 4 days of putting up with it, Reception tried to help however it didn't improve sadly. 

The beach is lovely, take water shoes and use the public beach for swimming due to coral reefs.
title: Could be brilliant.......

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: lack of shade option around pool area. Music is excessively loud from main bar and they play American rap with racist, offensive language
text:
Stayed as a family of 2 adults and two teenage sons in family room 1001.
The complex is clean, fresh, modern. The family room is a great size. The option to hire jet ski and paddle boards is great and the staff accompanying are polite and attentive. 

The a la carte food is meh. £7.50 plus for a frozen style pizza you pick up in a multi pack at Lidl for £1 sets the standard. That'd despite their being an actual pizza oven that's decorative only. 
Cocktails again meh. Warm when delivered.

Bar staff don't take orders from the seating area. You have to go up to the bar to order. Staff are simply Lethargic, will only act reactively. Nothing pro active. Once you have their attention they will do their job but should you constantly have to chase to be served when your on holiday and its their job. 

Again sunbeds have option for cushions. They are packed away and not put out by staff. You physically have to get yourself or chase the staff. Once caught again they will then get to work. 

Breakfast buffet is limited but ok. Stayed at multiple hotels in Sri Lanka now its fine in comparison. 

Prices don't include tax or service. That's a dated practise and top hotels on the island have combined in published menu price to be more transparent. 

Overall this hotel could be great but the service levels and a la carte options we experienced really let it down.
title: Great Looks but limited personality

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Sapatilhas para irem ao mar (muitos corais)
text:
Hotel muito agradável, muito limpo, os quartos bastante grandes e confortáveis. Os funcionários muito prestáveis, na sala de refeições havia dois funcionários particularmente simpáticos, a "Shakila" e o "Bimsara". A comida deixa um pouco a desejar, principalmente para Europeus, bastante picante (sem informação escrita), pouca variedade frutas, quando o país tem óptimas e variadas. Fiz algumas sugestões ao Chef, espero que num futuro próximo as sigam, o Director do Hotel percebeu mas em momento algum nos abordou para saber como estava a ser a nossa estadia, pouco simpático. Utilizámos o SPA, experiência bastante agradável onde fomos atendidos pelos simpáticos "Yaithan" e "Sachintha". O "Kumar" também deixou os nossos quartos sempre impecáveis. A zona da piscina bastante agradável e da praia também com bastantes cadeiras, o mar calmo mas com bastantes corais (levem sapatilhas próprias).
De qualquer forma não deixou de ser uma estadia agradável.
title: Estadia agradável

roomTip: Watch it’s not got a function on
text:
The architecture is gorgeous very modern. Our room was super spacious with a nice sea view. 
The beach was off limits due to weather conditions. 
The buffet was barely lukewarm and meat was tough. Even though the buffet was included we went without dinner the second night. 
The staff were pleasant.

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Обратите внимание, что отель у залива. Добираться от Коломбо 5ч.
text:
Прекрасный отель для восточного побережья. Мы в итоге переехали на западное, поэтому оценка 3 по сравнению с западным побережьем. 
Инфраструктура практически отсутствует из-за недавно окончившейся войны. От аэропорта Коломбо добираться около 5ч, до всех достопримечательностей тоже будет неблизко. 
Мы брали All Inclusive, питание хорошее. Завтрак и ужин шведский стол. Обед по меню. Можно было найти неострую еду, но сложно. Однако персонал всегда идет на встречу и подсказывает что-то не острое, может поменять блюдо. Вкусные коктейли. 
Пляж у отеля рифовый, там никто не купается. Все идут левее пару сотен метров мимо пляжа, где купаются местные, которые очень любят фотографироваться с европейцами. В итоге купались на пляже  напротив трехзвездочного отеля Marina Beach, там нет рифов, песок, приятный вход.
Обратите внимание, что это залив, волн и силы океана здесь не поочувствовать. Но с детьми наверное самое то. Также в отеле есть детская комната. 
В качестве активности есть бильярд.

В ноябре было мало постояльцев, было похоже на отшельнический отдых. Поняли, что не для нас, не хватило движухи.
title: Прекрасно для восточного побережья

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

We are very sorry to hear about your experience during your stay with us at Amaya Beach, Pasikudah. Your comments have been noted and we thank you for taking the time to highlight the above and hope you do give us another chance. Thank you once again. 

Warm regards, 
Management – Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid Fridays to Sundays if you prefer quite beach access.
text:
Pros:
1) The location and resort surroundings are really scenic and if you want to just relax on your sun beds and watch the world pass you by, this is the resort for you.
2) Water sports like Kayaking/boat trips/jet ski(accompanied) are available from the hotel’s sports club located on the left. However if you like to do jet ski on your own, or want to do a Padi course(requires 4 days), go further on the left of the hotel on the beach for caters for more water sports. 
3) All the staff were really friendly and would smile and greet you. Every evening, they would deliver one bottle of water per person to your room in addition to one bottle per person left when they clean the room. 
Cons:
1) If you love swimming in the sea, this is not the resort for you as the sea facing the hotel has shallow water with stones and very low reefs making it difficult even to snorkel or swim. On the left side of the hotel, the beach is like a lagoon, but we were not able to use it as it is swamped by locals during Fridays-Sundays when they arrive by tuk tuks or coaches. Further to its left, the beach is long with crystal clear waters. However you are not protected from the sun as there are no sun beds/umbrellas as it’s a public beach. We booked the hotel through a local travel agent who recommended this hotel, but with hindsight we should have stuck with our original selection of Anantaya beach resort as we heard that his was a better location for quite beach access. If you prefer splashing out, Uga Bay resort is the best as per our driver. 
2) Food can be a bit repetitive, but if you don’t like the options, the chefs will be more than happy to something you like with prior notice. 3) it’s a pity they didn’t have live music at the bar in the evening like Cinnamon group of hotels. They would make more money at the bar if they had live music as we didn’t see many guests ordering drinks.
title: Scenic location but not great for quite beach access

placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
text:
Отдыхаем в отеле прямо сейчас (август 2023), в целом отель очень хороший, кроме одного нюанса, который ОЧЕНЬ сильно нас огорчил и подпортил все впечатление!  Мы бронировали номер Делюкс, так как хотели вид на океан и ванну и душ в номере. По описанию номера Делюкс на сайте отеля все это входит, по факту ванны нет и вид на океан большей частью  перекрыт. 
Когда мы попросили заменить номер, нам сказали, что номеров нет, будут через 2 дня. Мы подошли снова, нам предложили другой номер, но с раздельными кроватями, которые нас совсем не устраивают в романтическом путешествии. 
По факту наш номер соответствует тому, что на сайте описано как стандарт, сотрудники отеля утверждают, что у нас номер Делюкс. За что мы переплатили мы не понимаем. Фото с видом из номера прилагаю, океан там конечно есть, но его тонкая полоска, если не подпрыгивать.
В таких же номерах другие туристы, с кем мы познакомились, купили стандарт, заплатили дешевле и разницы никакой. 
Если планируете отдыхать в этом отеле, переплачивать за класс номера ввше смысла нет!
title: Одно Няо, которое может сильно испортить настроение

ownerResponse/text:
Dear yadgiry,
Thank you for sharing your lovely feedback with us and delighted to learn of your experience at Amaya Beach, Pasikudah. Do visit us again soon. 
Warm regards, 
Management – Amaya Resorts & Spas
placeInfo/address: National Holiday Resort, Kalkudah 10120 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Pools loungers are taken early.
Ask the hotel to reduce plastic especially water bottles - damaging oceans!
text:
We have a family room (deluxe supreme) on half board, the room was beautiful very clean and the best bathrooms we had on the entire trip for size and luxury!
The housekeeping where the best team (which I think speaks for itself)
1) Arrival - no one at door, check in team really didn't seem to acknowledge us too them a while to say 'sit down' it felt a little unwelcoming.
2) The room was nice as mentioned
3) The dinner here is awful, it caters to the western tour groups on mass - so very meat centric, on the first night the hotel offered to make something else but we were limited in our options. 
4) The pool is extremely shallow 
5) You need beach shoes to get into the ocean!
6) Vijaykumar served us at breakfast, lunch and dinner and is the only member of staff alert enough to spot we where not happy - he was a really nice young lad who went out of his way to try and make our day.
7) I could not believe the restaurant team knowing our disappointment took the trouble at departure to ask for a positive tripadvisor review!
The beaches and hotels are 3 stars at most in this stretch, go to Tricho for luxury or accept that this underdeveloped (but overpriced) 
8) There are snorkelling trips but the water can be murky, the glass boats are pointless in these conditions.
9) Check out was ok
10) Spa was awaful, run 45 mins late the oils were not nice and smelt like castor oil, the massage itself was not true ayrverdic. There was no relaxation room nor any nice spa scent, its very basic.
title: Nice rooms! Great beach views exceptionally clean property

Greetings From Habarana Village by Cinnamon. Thank you for choosing to stay with us at Habarana Village by Cinnamon, and for sharing your valuable feedback about your recent experience. placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Well located for safari etc
text: This was our first stop on our private tour of the island for two nights. We found the superior room very rustic, apart from space and the views a deluxe room would have been fine, as we weren’t spending too much time in the room. It was clean and comfortable. The restaurant/ bar service was not great we had to keep going looking for the staff to get fresh drinks in the bar area. The first night we had the buffet for dinner as we had been traveling from Colombo airport and was tired. They catered for my partners gluten free requirements and the buffet was fine. The following evening we thought we would treat ourselves to the a la carte menu. When the food eventually came one of the starters was completely wrong. So we had to wait for the correct one to be prepared, while the other was kept warm some where. During the starters the main was presented, the waiter just stood looking at us, so we pointed out that we were still eating the starter and he took the mains away. When they were brought out for a second time, I had a beef skewer marinated in spices, whilst the flavour was great the beef was really tough and well over done, may be through keeping it warm? I couldn’t eat it and I was offered what I wanted from the buffet as a replacement, what I chose was not much better, but I had lost the will to live at this point! When the bill came the a la carte main was still on it, they eventually took this off when we objected to it. This hotel seems to cater for the larger tour groups and on this evening we’re focused on a private BBQ, so may be distracted! Like others we had spent a lot of money on our trip and was not impressed. Especially after completing our check out they told our private guide to wait while they checked we hadn’t had anything from the minibar, not something we ever experienced before! If we came back to this area I think we would look for an alternative hotel
title: Disappointing service

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a 2 week tour around Sri Lanka booked through Kuoni in the UK.
The setting was lovely; however the room was very dated with dark shabby furniture. The door to the bathroom and semi open shower had to be kept closed to avoid any insects getting in.  It had a bolt and latch which was very loud when used, particularly in the middle of the night.
Food at dinner was good but very disappointing breakfast with very few hot drinks options ( tasteless coffee and only black tea) and flies around the open food dishes.
Wine was extremely expensive- we were shocked to have to pay more than £39 sterling for a mediocre bottle of Italian white.
Young staff seemed disinterested and not very customer oriented.
We paid a lot of money for this trip of a lifetime and we love Sri Lanka and its people who have been exceptionally warm and welcoming.
Our stay here was the exception which has been a disappointment sadly.
title: Slightly disappointing

text:
L’hotel est joli, dans les arbres, avec de l espace et des complexes sportifs (tennis, badminton..) 
Les employés comme partout au Sri Lanka sont gentils et aux petits soins.
Le restaurant est acceptable. 
Il est bien situé pour visiter Sigiriya ou les parcs nationaux pour le safari.
Malheureusement il est tres vieillissant. Les chambres sont quelconques, l’air conditionné directement orienté sur le lit et ultra bruyant, la piscine est completement decrepie : les photos du site internet donnent une impression de luxe, ce qui est tres trompeur et loin de la realité. C est plutot un lodge. 
Rapport qualite prix trop bas.
title: Hotel vieillissant

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Venkat,

Thank you for your honest feedback. We sincerely apologize for the shortcomings in your recent stay, particularly the small room size for a triple occupancy, the uncomfortable extra bed, and the tired-looking bathrooms. We will definitely address these issues with our housekeeping and management teams.

We appreciate you mentioning the attentiveness of our staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. We're also glad you enjoyed the packed lunches for early excursions.

However, we are truly sorry to hear about the disappointment with the food selection and quantity. We aim to offer a variety of dishes to cater to different palates, and it appears we fell short on this occasion. We will share your feedback with our F&B team to ensure they improve the variety and portion sizes.

Thank you for helping us identify areas for improvement. We hope to welcome you back and provide a much better experience next time.

Sincerely,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive, Guest Services
Habarana Village by Cinnamon
placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Substandard budget food
text: Exceptionally beautiful location. Very friendly staff. Rooms are very small for Triple occupancy. The third bed was way too risky to sleep on and moved around every time you tried to sleep. There is no room here to add a third bed in the superior rooms. When the bed is added you cannot use the dresser as it Bloks the whole space. The bathrooms look tired. The iron board cover needs replacement as it is burnt in so many places. The A/c was not cooling. Didn’t attend to it when we informed but kept disturbing us when we were ready to check out. However, the staff was very apologetic to the fact that it was not fixed on time. The food was the major disappointment. It was the same every day with very little quantities in the serving dishes that you don’t feel like talking any as it is sufficient for just one person. There was no variety at all it is very evident that they are cutting cost in food. Some days there is no buffet and a menu is given to select from. Substandard salad and half or lesser small bowl of soup. I requested for squid with rice and just got 5 small pieces of squid with a large plate of rice. Very substandard and budget. There is absolutely no choice for people who don’t eat Sri Lankan curry. I have to mention that some staff were amazing and friendly and always ready help but maintains the budget food quality as it must be a management decision to cut cost on food. The place is kept very clean and room amnesties are replaced very well daily. The staff packs a lunch for those leaving early for excursions and they do a good job of it.
title: Substandard food at beautiful hotel with good staff

placeInfo/address: Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
Le cadre est magnifique (jardin, arbres et forêt au bord d’un lac) et certains bungalow donnent sur ce paysage.
Les chambres sont agréables.
Le vrai élément décevant est l’ambiance et la restauration. 
L’ambiance est celle d’un “resort tout compris” où une clientèle internationale se croise, matin, midi et soir autour de buffets à volonté sans caractère, d’un restaurant aménagé façon “cantine géante”. 
Bien qu’ayant beaucoup voyagé, je n’ai jamais vu un buffet aussi gigantesque, avec toutes sortes de cuisines internationales ou “locale adaptée à une riche clientèle touristique”. Pour moi c’est une honte à deux titres :
- d’abord c’est réellement indécent d’offrir un tel choix infini, même pour clientèle variée et aisée, dans un pays assez miséreux et où les serveurs doivent doivent être gênés par un tel gaspillage! On passe presque plus de temps à parcourir le buffet qu’à manger. Je n’ose imaginer les montagnes de déchets après chaque repas.
- deuxièmement, à force de privilégier la quantité, on en oublie la qualité. Vous pouvez mélanger à peu près tout et n’importe quoi (fruits, curry, pizza, pates, crêpes, viandes, féculents, légumes, épices, œufs, simili-fromages, 1001 desserts, 1001 trucs d’apéritifs…) et au final, vous obtenez une assiette chargée mais sans saveur. J’ai vraiment regretté les bons restaurants d’hôtels plus intimistes où un chef vous proposait un menu limité mais élaboré et savoureux.
L’impression d’être un cochon qu’il fait gaver midi et soir. Pour qui aime bouffer sans réfléchir pour avoir l’impression de rentabiliser le prix. Mais certains types de touristes aiment ça (notamment les russes, les chinois, les américains).
Pour moi, ce type de restauration est honteux et est tout ce que je fuis.
title: Beautiful setting but "holiday club" atmosphere

We spent two nights at the Village with another family. The check-in process was smooth and without incident. The room was ok, but i did not like the fact that our room had twin beds. I asked about changing the room to one with a King Bed but was only offered a bedsheet to combine them into a single bed. This was very inconvenient for sleeping with a small child in the middle. The swimming pool was also quite dated, There was plaster coming off the sidewalls and this was a potential safety issue as you could get scraped on the side.

The food, on the other hand, was quite delicious and well-prepared. Wimalaratna from the buffet service tried his best to do a good job, but the table service was slow.

I understand that covid and the current economic crisis have decimated the industry but I expect a higher standard from a hotel under the Cinnamon brand

placeInfo/address: 35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here as part of a organised tour through Sri Lanka. This hotel was booked for us by the tour company. It was a surprise when we arrived at the hotel. We were driving through a neighbourhood in what appeared the suburbs of Kandy when the hotel suddenly appeared. The hotel was in a seemingly odd location about 10-15 minute drive from the centre of Kandy however it later made a bit more sense as we drove around the city more over the following days. Kandy has the most unusual layout as the city itself winds around the hills and rivers. For practical purposes, the hotel is isolated and the only way in and out is by taxi or tuk-tuk. There is nothing of interest within walking distance.

The hotel on approach was pleasant. The grounds and the pool area near the reception was quite nice. It was obvious on arrival that it was a bit tired looking but it was only when we got to the room that it was apparent how run-down the hotel was. The room was spacious but it didn't make up for the sagging and uncomfortable beds more befitting a run-down 3-star hotel. The towels in the bathroom were so old that they were all frayed at the edges and the tension in the shower head was so weak that it could not hold itself up under the weight of the water. You had to hold the shower head to have a shower, and that was when there was water pressure which was hit and miss.

The hotel restaurants were mixed. Some meals (such as the New Year buffet) were excellent however the breakfast was hit and miss. Some of the dishes that should have been warm were cold on multiple mornings and it was a food poisoning risk.

The gym was reasonable, if a bit dated but sufficed for a few days. One of the stand out features of the hotel was the lovely pool and surrounding grounds - it was pleasant. That however was not able to make up for what should be a nice hotel but just in desperate need of renovation.
title: In real need of an update

text:
We visited the Mahaweli Reach Hotel on July 6th for the morning buffet. Although we arrived a bit late, the reception staff were initially reluctant to let us join. However, Ms. Nadeesah, the  stewardess , kindly encouraged us to enjoy the buffet and assured us that she would bring some food items to our table to save time. . She fulfilled her promise, allowing us to finish our meal in just 40 minutes. If we had followed the initial advice from the reception, we might not have had the opportunity to  have th breakfast  at your hotel and would have left looking for another hotel in Kandy. 
Ms. Nadeesah's exceptional business acumen was instrumental in our decision to stay back for the buffet. Your esteemed hotel, like many others in Sri Lanka, would greatly benefit from more staff members like  Nadeesha the stewardess , who use their common sense to attract guests. We also observed her assisting other foreign guests who arrived late, ensuring they could enjoy the morning buffet as well.

As Sri Lanka strives to promote tourism and boost foreign revenue, it is essential to encourage and support dedicated individuals like Ms. Nadeesah. We wish her all a all the luck !!
We aslos wish to  mention  that the food was quite good and the Hopper makers were helpful. However  as we had overstayted for 5 minutes one steward  informed us that time is up signalling us to leave.  I wish that this gentleman could have used a much more polite tone !!
Overall the expreince at your hotel was satisfatoty !! Damayanthie Rajapakse
title: Buisness acumen of Ms Nadeesha ( stewardess ) at your hotel

text:
Good property but not great. Firstly I’ll tell about the good part… That is food and restaurant staffs. Excellent food served in the buffet dinner. Grilled pork chops and fried calamari were fantastic. Breakfast spread is also with great variety and tastes. Restaurant staff Anjali was very helpful during our first dinner. On the second day Kevin and Nadeesha were really taken care of us. I would also like to mention the name of Indika , who was really served well.

Now , the unpleasant things. You don’t expect an artificial flowers in the reception of a five star. Reception are is most unpleasant place in the hotel . Lots of wooden furnitures are there in the property but not maintained at all . They look really shabby. Bar area doesn’t have any separation with common entrance. No ambiance for a bar. Uniform of the staffs are very dull and shabby.
Rooms are Ergonomically and aesthetically not pleasing. Charging points are far away from bed . Tiny TV kept in the corner of the room.
Also , SPA is operated by a single therapist. Seriously! In a five star you don’t except that.
Renovation required seriously.
title: 3 star for the Restaurant food and Restaurant staffs. Otherwise 2 star property. Serious renovation required

placeInfo/address: 35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you want easy access to Kandy this is probably not the place for you and try to avoid the coach party crush at dinner …
text: This should be a five star review. This is beautiful hotel in an amazing location. When you arrive you feel as though you are in a top class hotel. We stayed three nights on half board and the problems all surrounded mealtimes. Breakfast and dinner were both buffets. Each day we were there coach parties who seemed to be on one night stays. They would check in before dinner at 7.30pm and the buffet became a free for all. Cultural differences visitors don’t explain bad manners and parents allowing their children to handle food other diners are supposed to eat. After the first evening we decided to wait until 9pm when the coach parties seemed to disappear but there was little we could do to improve the breakfast experience. The staff who were excellent during the day when the hotel was quiet were completely overwhelmed and seemed very uncomfortable with what was going on. The food when you could get to it was very good - the sad thing was the bun fight that had to be endured to eat it. The only other comment is that this hotel is not well located for getting in and out of Kandy. Unlike other hotels visited on or trip tuk tuk drivers were not waiting outside and when asked how we should travel in and out of the city we were told to download the PickMe app (similar to Uber) rather than the front desk offering to call transport for us. Despite the above comments the facilities were very good and special mention should be made of the bar staff who looked after us very well.
title: Great hotel but ….

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Location - Do not follow the Google maps, location is wrong. If you follow the map location you will end up in some other hotel. 
And there is no proper Sigiriya rock view neither Pidurangala. It is close to the Sigiriya and Pidurangala, but the road is terrible. Even though map says it is half and hour it will take 1 hour or more than that due to the condition of the road. 

Rooms - Seerock is a concrete jungle. It felt like they have built a hotel in a desert. Rooms are very well furnished with modern amenities, but not with an elegant taste. It is too cluttered with furnitures. They have a Jacuzzi, which is crazily aligned to the main door. No view, just a small balcony. Rooms are not worth for the price. 

Service and Food - Service is wonderful. Starting for the check in process, Seerock is blessed with some wonderful people. We tried their Sri Lankan dishes, everything was perfect.
title: Average everything

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review.  I must say that we really do wish you did tell us, directly, to us the staff of myself as the Resident Manager. 

We noticed that you have got disturbed to see the power lines that runs on the side of our property, however they are under the ownership of the government and the Electricity Board of Sri Lanka. 

The local travel partner who organised your tour, Jetwing, is one of the largest in the country. It is one of our biggest partners and no doubt funnels us a significant amount of business. As such the driver guide who transported you is a multiple visitor.  it was he who requested that very accommodation, choosing a quiet place over the accommodation provided on site at the hotel. Furthermore, the accommodation provided to him was at a property 50 meters from the hotel, a place that many driver guides stay at. If your driver guide had an issue with his accommodation, it would have been in his best interest to keep us informed instead burdening you, the guest, with that problem.

We apologize that the food was not to your liking however a simple mention would have had them changed right away or exchanged for something more to your liking. You ordered 4 dishes, and your total was $ 31, inclusive of mandatory government taxes and service charge so in reality you bill was only $ 24 + taxes.  

We serve 3 types of bacon at the hotel, taking into consideration our clientele. Back Bacon ( Pork ), Beef Bacon, Chicken Bacon. If you were not served the above then we apologize and we will address the communication issue with the restaurant.

Finally thank you for the positive feedback on the staff, rooms and internet. I am happy we were at least able to salvage and do something right during your stay. 
So while I am sorry that your stay could have been better, and certainly wish it could have been, some of the issues were really beyond our control. As for the rest we will take in under consideration. I once again humbly request that issues and grievances be brought to the attention of management, without resorting to using online review sites, via which no real problem can be solved especially after a check out. 

We wish you a pleasant stay during the rest of your time in Sri Lanka.

Best wishes,
Alec van Cuylenburg
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa,Sigiriya, Avudangawa 21120 Sri Lanka
text: It’s never a good sign when you pull up to a property and a bunch of letters in the illuminated sign are dark. This proved to be a portent of things to come at Seerock. Some of the lights were on but not everyone was home. But I’m getting ahead of myself. As a travel writer, I get paid to share my opinions with readers in the Asia-Pacific region as well as some North American publications, but this time around it felt necessary to issue a caveat emptor to those considering a stay here. The good things first and there are several. The staff could not be more courteous, friendly and welcoming. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and luxurious. The internet is robust. Three big ticks there. Now for the bad news. While the remote setting is tranquil, as are the water gardens, the massive set of power lines running through the place detracts from the serenity like, well, a massive set of power lines running through a property. Okay, perhaps I should have looked more closely at the images. Where this resort falls down in a massive way is the food. If you are going to charge in US$ in a country where cheap, fresh and flavorful fare is abundant, you need to deliver. The food at Seerock is none of these things. A meal of samosas, a dozen minuscule garlic prawns, bread and dhal patties we christened Clint Eastwood on account of their toughness was billed at a massive $41. The surrounding areas are bristling with restaurants where you can taste the pride in every mouthful - the predominant flavor here is a slipshod gouge for cash. The best you can say about the breakfast offering is that it’s adequate but don’t ask for bacon as you’ll get a slice of fried spam which curls at the edges as if rearing up from itself. Like many travelers to this region, we had a driver/guide from the Jetwing company (highly recommended btw). His accommodation was guilt-inducingly appaling. The drivers of guests simply deserve better. Most of the negative feedback on this page has received a “we wish you said something while you were here” response, so Seerock, here we are, down the lane with two more nights booked. Anyone reading this review, I’ll do an edit including their response. Let’s see what happens...
title: Think twice
